2lvXqFcZBJBBQi-e64GSGg.text: OH EM GEE!!!!!!  I think this is currently my new favorite restaurant.  You don't hear much about this place but my friend brought me here for an early bday dinner and I loved it so much that for my actual bday dinner when my other girlfriends arrived in town, we came back!  I've had tapas before but this place was one of the best.  The portions are small but that's really what tapas are!  And it allows you the ability to try more and order more!  My favorites would be the carpaccio, the crab cake lettuce cups, the thai chicken flat bread, papardelle pasta, and holy SMORES PIZZA!! Honestly, that smores pizza is one of the best things I have ever eaten. I have no idea what they put in it - crack perhaps? - I could eat ten of those in one sitting, if I knew that it wouldn't all go straight to my butt.  Sooooooo good!  Drinks are a bit pricey.  They offer wine flights, selection of four wines in 2 oz glasses.  That was good, but still pricey.  Sangria was good too but wayyyyyy expensive!

e561YqibOLOkj3MXhpItmg.text: We stopped in here for a bit to eat before Le Reve.  It is not a place that we even researched prior to going there but it was recommended by our server at Parasol Down.  The ouside patio is beautiful with the surrounding pool and gardens.  We had some Prosecco and 3 tapas - bacon wrapped dates, some smoked salmon wonton thing, and stuffed chicken.  They were all quite tasty although the chicked was a bit dry.  Service was great.  I would love to go back and try some different items on their menu - the wine list looked very interesting as well.

3VdNR_NnB62Z4OfAH6eMDw.text: We came here for post-dinner, pre-show drinks and all in all it was quite lovely.  The ambiance is really great - classy without being uptight, dim without being too dark.  If we weren't on a schedule, this is the sort of environment I could hang out in sipping wine for hours.  The service was exceptional and the drinks delicious.  My friends got the blood orange margaritas and they were amazing - tons of flavor and not too sweet.  I had a white wine flight that was also very good, and reasonably priced at $15 for four 2 oz samples.  Oh, and the server explained the date on the plates to us - one was clearly the year they opened, and the other was 6,000 something B.C., which apparently is the first recorded date of wine.  Pretty awesome.

Mis_jDV-3I7ePfOoAfK58A.text: Great atmosphere, Great service & Great food! We had dinner before the Garth Brooks concert on a Friday night.  Patio seating was excellent and our server was fantastic!  We had a party of 8 in which she gave us several reccomendations of items to try along with our drink orders. She was so accomodating and nice, even when she forgot 2 items, it was ok, because she was that good and everything was perfect.  Wonderful cocktail selections along with the food. The carpaccio was absolutely delicious! Tender meat served with capers and herbs along with an aolii sauce.  The flatbreads had a wonderful combination of ingredients with the flavors bursting in your mouth.  Would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

KenLxUOmdgrkxfrigFGH9w.text: Stopped at La Cave for a small lunch after working up an appetite shopping all day. Our server was very friendly. We ordered the seared scallops and the filet w/bleu cheese and crustini. I had an Asian pear martini and it was tasty.    The scallop was one of the best prepared scallops I have ever had (next to gary danko in San Fran and Alinea in Chicago) Next time I return, I would definitely do a full dinner at La Cave. I definitely want to try a flat bread next time.

SuS4sxRIeQqxKxBlRHb9uw.text: Went here for Sunday brunch and had a blast. The patio seating area is beautiful. The food, the service and the atmosphere are amazing. On top of all this, there was an awesome live jazz band playing that morning.  Can't wait to go back.

r341OeSM-8qABesT6g3sjQ.text: Loved this place- Great wine and tapas. It would get a 5th star if the seating was more private. Service was excellent too! Ended up eating there twice on our trip in February.

0AN8o3upcGroxYdW7yFwdg.text: Service: extremely slow and inconsiderate of the needs of their guests. The waitress sat my wife and I down. There's no cloth napkin and she just disappeared and never showed up. We asked for ketchup and tabasco sauce and again another waitress disappeared requiring us to ask for the third waitress. Our order for drinks took about 20-30 minutes to complete. Our plates were not clean and they walked by 3-4 times without the courtesy of changing them. When they replaced the plates, we can see leftover food on the new plates. My wife asked for a pancake and, again, the waiter disappeared but he came back with food to serve other table. We had to ask another waitress. The restaurant was not as busy as any other typical restaurant and they obviously were not short of staff.  Food: same burgers, sandwiches, pizza and tater-tots over and over again. The food is cheap american food you can get it at any fast food restaurant. The quality is equivalent to McDonald's. It costs $48.00 per person before tax and tips and you have to pay for your drinks separately plus NO refill. No water unless you ask for it. Waiters and waitresses were dropping their plates several times like it's normal.  I'm a Las Vegas resident with an average standard. If you want good food and decent service, you should NOT come here. We came here for Easter Brunch for butler service--all you can eat.

dWt1N0K98E_bXkqt69ik_Q.text: I am so in love with this place!!!! Very romantic ambiance, delicious food and excellent wine selection! What more can a girl ask for?!

Y-ywmzoZ73UHdsX2z-ZxDg.text: My husband and I are wine fanatics so we decided to try La Cave.  All I can say is AMAZING!  This is our new Vegas go to spot.  The service was impeccable!  The wine list was massive.  There is a wine for all taste buds. We bought a bottle and ate on the patio overlooking the garden pool.  We ended up being there for 3 hours and were not rushed to leave.  The food is tapas style and very high quality.  We had the La Cave Cesear Salad which was yummy and the meat & cheese board.  Biting into the cheese you could tell it was real aged cheese, delicious!  After sitting there so long we decided to have the chocolate mousse cake for dessert which was divine.  If you enjoy high quality food and wine this is the place for you.

ui2s2vwV4vJwj41jXiNnYQ.text: After 2 days of partying, loud music and empty stomachs, La Cave was just what the doctor ordered. The cozy, lounge like atmosphere made La Cave the perfect beginning to our last night in Vegas. To satisfy our greens craving we ordered the asparagus, egg and pancetta salad which was spot on! The quail egg, ham and cheese flatbread was super delish and had an unexpected, yet nice spice to it. The steak croquettes topped with blue cheese were also delish! What was that sauce? Yum! We also enjoyed a nice bottle of Malbec for $48. The service was great and our waiter was super accommodating. He even allowed us to hang out long after closing to finish our wine and enjoy the view off of the balcony. In the end, we spent about $120 (including tip) for two girls. Best and least expensive meal we had in Vegas. I would recommend calling to see if you can reserve a table outside on the balcony.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful balcony
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing design

SklkOULfXEeQwZzB1vTM6Q.text: La Cave is a smaller Tapas joint hidden in the Wynn corridors. Part of its allure are the 3 different seating "rooms" the restaurant offers. Indoors for the person that wants an intimate, dark setting with chatter around. A covered patio type situation with wicker seating for the casual diners who want to have a more spacious experience. And of course, the tables completely outdoors that face the pool area.  Having had the opportunity to dine here for both a late-night dinner as well as an afternoon lunch, I was able to experience the entire restaurant. The hostesses and waitstaff here were very friendly and they even remembered me when I came back the next day. This is truly the most heartwarming restaurant - service wise- that I've been at the Wynn properties. Yes, most of the time service is impeccable in these resorts but this was the only place that I felt that the wait staff actually cared and weren't just carrying out directions.   The chef, Bill De Marco was there the entire time at dinner and I actually saw him inspecting all the food that left the kitchen. That to me, is a good sign (as I constantly mention in my reviews).   Once again, we had partaken in the vegan menu offered here (all priced between $10-$15):  1. Salt Roasted Beets, Vegan Cheese, Pistachios - The beets were cooked very well and sweet red juices were oozing out of every bite. The pistachios here really made the dish. Grated to the tiniest piece, they provided the uniquest crunch to the dish. I can only say that perhaps adding a few more pistachios might have made this dish more memorable  2. Mushroom Tortellini, Arugula, Tomato "Cream" Sauce - I was going insane at the plump juicy cherry tomatoes that topped the dish. Yumminess! The tortellini's were savory and the cream sauce was exquisite. Pieces of mushrooms mixed into the dish were also so satisfying. Served in a cast iron cup, the presentation was also eye-catching  3. Gardein "Chicken", Celery Root Puree, Lemon Caper Sauce -Yum Yum Yum. After we plowed through this, we wanted seconds. The protein was cooked amazingly. Crisp in the right places and moist in others. The concoction your fork made with some Gardein, the celery root puree, some of the spinach and sauce was just heavenly. Deliciousness.  We had blood orange margaritas that were rather potent and very tasty to round out the beverage portion of the night.   La Cave is a nice place for all events...date night, a nice weekend brunch or a rambunctious group dinner. And they have a menu for everyone. I like!

vrEaPyfwc1ljPXJdBsY26g.text: Perfect anniversary dinner.  Everything was wonderful, from food to ambiance to wine.   Highly recommend.  Had salmon sashimi warm slow roasted beets rack of lamb and sirloin.  Only complaint was that for some reason the drink service was a little slow.

bVlD5ZLy7H316dOuyghtyQ.text: Me and hubby decided to have a drink, sitting outside overlooking the pool. Ended up ordering a salad, filet and a lamb pasta dish. All were excellent and we enjoyed this place which we almost walked right by. It's a must do and we can't wait to go back.

FLhDukK0ZFVMptVK-OUhkw.text: What great service. The small plates are really well made. I am a fan of the vegan menu. And the wen selection is great

b3_mJa6RBln-trrK17wwfg.text: Tried this place for my husbands birthday. I have good and not so good reviews  Service:  We had reservations. Got seated right away in the back bar area (asked for patio area but it was booked or closed for another party)  After being seated it took almost 10-12minutes before anyone came to us and asked if we wanted something to drink.  Once we ordered waters and 2 cocktails, our beverages took another 10minutes or so to get to our table.   Once drinks were out of the way, we ordered our food.  My husband and I are big foodies, so usually we order a lot of things off the menu when we go out to eat.  The server knowing we ordered 7 plus different tapas dishes, they should have paced the food coming out to the table. I say that because we were seated on a small 2 top  table and there was very limited space to place all the dishes we ordered. I felt as if we had to hurry to eat what was on the table to make room for the next dish. Or they squeezed the next dish on the table. Trying to move our water and cocktail glasses here and there to make room. That kind of bugged me.   Food:  Not too much complaints there except the scallop dish we had was bit salty. Even my husband who likes salty food said it was too salty.  But it was cooked to perfect temperature.   Overall the food was pretty good. Service not so great.

tQ1WBBFxzm-KvO9-QsGM7A.text: Great Concept.  Great Food.  Great Wine.  Great Service.  Oh, did I tell you...amazing!  Defiantly has now become our "TO GO" place!  Congrats on you all.

smZtdNe5yO-bYNNF4-W-YQ.text: First time here at this restaurant. Great food and service. Atmosphere was good. We sat on a balcony overlooking the pool. Not typical cheesy Vegas.

j3Z-tk6NCSWLZznE-pMxIg.text: It is a small restaurant down from the buffet, but it has amazing food! Their salads and flat bread were yummy!

Uf9mQX9zbmBuAthu7ttEGw.text: Absoltuely positively delicious.  We started out with the 3 meat & 3 cheese assortment.  We then shared sliders, several delicious flatbreads (the best of which was the chef's selection with the quail egg), garlic shrimp.  Everything was great except the beet salad (being warm caused the goat cheese to melt, obscuring the taste of the beets) and the chicken (I've never like to order chicken at a good restaurant anyway).  The crab cups were really interesting  All this plus Banana Bread Beer!  I will definitely come back here

UKhhr5GwLcK43AAvohMdqg.text: As I was eating dinner at La Cave the other night, I was debating that this review could go anywhere from a 2 star to a 4 star.  We ate there with a group of 6, and since it is Tapas, we were able to try almost everything on the Menu.  Unfortunately, nothing was super memorable.  I'll start with the highlights.  1) Our server was very nice.  Great personality and even gave some good recommendations for offstrip restaurants. 2) The Beef Filet was quite was good.  That and the Charcuterie plate were probably the two best items that we had. 3) The wine selection was quite good.  The Sommelier acted of high importance, but didn't show any action for his promises.  As shown below.  The bad: 1) The restaurant is in the Wynn, and prices were as expected.  They were not outrageous, but for the quality of the food, they seemed a bit high. 2) As we were eating the duck, the Sommelier asked how the duck was.  I told him that it was chewy and not very good.  At first he acted surprised, and said he would take it off the bill.  As the norm, I said, "oh no, that's ok" (still expecting him to do it).  He then replied, "other people have said they didn't like either.  I'm taking it off for you guys."  I figured if he DID stand behind that comment, that would def. bump La Cave up a star.  If he didn't, then it goes down a star because it was that bad. 3) Other disappointing dishes were the overcooked and small Scallops, the watery grits, and the chewy lamb.  La Cave is a 3 star restaurant for the mediocre food, and above average service for the strip.  All dishes were "OK" and nothing blew any of us away.  It was all just OK.  As you guessed, the duck remained on the bill, and as expected, the Sommelier was just giving us words.  I doubt I will be back to La Cave, and gladly try other restaurants in Vegas.

VNL_TZsXoa9LGBWdgMM9jA.text: Hosted a lunch event here for about 50 people. Fixed menu. Food was excellent, service was excellent, location is great. We were out on the patio so fresh air and a pool view. Great venue for hosting a group.

na-_rocvmjlqoFCt6vsM2w.text: Our meal at La Cave in the Wynn hotel was by far the most outstanding dining experience we enjoyed during our extended weekend stay in the desert.  After a number of other meals and experiences which fell short on the execution, I thought that La Cave did everything very well.  Our server was prompt, friendly and informative.  There was never a push to hurry any decision which gave us plenty of time to look over the "American tapas" menu.  The cuisine is creative American, all served in small plates.  It took us some time to come up with right combo of tastes and sizes.  We agreed on 4 small plates - the rack of lamb chops, the pasta with broccolini, the mushroom grits and the 3 bean salad.  All of the dishes were excellent.  Of the 4, probably the salad and lamb were the biggest stand outs.  The salad because this wasn't your picnic variety of 3 bean salad.  Rather, the La Cave version had fresh green beans, fried garbanzo beans, grilled artichoke hearts in a delicious ice wine vinaigrette. Yum!  The lamb was served hot, juicy and tasting of the grill.  La Cave has an extensive wine list of bottles, glasses and 1/2 bottles - domestic and imports.  We settled on a 1/2 bottle of a French white which complemented our meal well.  The wine server  was very knowledgable, kept our glasses full and spoke with us extensively about the dessert drink options.  My wife tasted, and then ordered, a glass of Madeira and I had a fantastic Amaro.  There were a handful of dessert options but we were plenty full and enjoying the after dinner drinks.  The interior design of the restaurant is very eye-appealing.  Despite the hard wood floors and background pop music, we found the noise level not to be a problem.  The overall meal is pretty pricey but considering the excellent execution and location, it's not out of line for the experience.  If we were closer, we'd be back for date night!

pev3JztZmfsfbSpNWOuENA.text: This was our first dinner. We ordered a bottle of Sauvignon blanc to start.  The ceviche was amazing.  We also ordered the clams.  The salmon was delicious but I feel the portion was very small for the price. I want to say we also ordered the hamachi? All was good.   I loved how Intimate this restaurant is.   Will be back

D37AVhm6xBZNBwaI2t4m4w.text: Wasn't expecting anything special but Cava was absolutely incredible. Small plates with exceptional taste. Service was great. Fillet on Crostini is a can't miss.  I need to go back so I can try more.

J5a-kzoim0sIzzjsIdYxCg.text: Beautiful decor. Attentive service. The food is actually good too but the prices are a bit steep for how small the portions are. $17 for chicken skewer app, 10 for grits, and $16 for small lump crab lettuce cups. Everything flavor wise was on point just wish portions justified the price. Good if you want small tapas though. And everything fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very rich flavorful grits minus the mushrooms

nQSkRolaPwr5-nz2KBj88g.text: First off this is a tapas style place which made me like it even more because I'm all about trying everything.    Everything I had was great but the highlights were...  Mushroom Grits- the mushrooms on top were to die for.  Bacon wrapped dates- drool  Scallops  Thai chicken Flatbread- I just loved every element of this dish.  My group all had wine flights which was a great way to sample all sorts of wines. I personally had the Running with the Bulls flight and I loved each wine.  To top it off the music in this place was off the hook. I wish they had dancing!!  Super cute, yummy food, good tunes.  Go here.

JV8icmmJH15L-8ZcdEA_Zg.text: Sunday brunch, beautiful garden inspired patio, long booth for us, so relaxing and comfortable, a bit of a retreat from the strip, with a hint of romantic....perfect for a quiet Sunday after hard partying on Saturday night ;p. We were looking for a restaurant for lunch at Wynn, this place looked pretty nice, decided to give it a try, host lady was very friendly, took us to a nice patio table, our super cute eye candy waitress Lisa came to us, introduced the brunch with bottomless mimosa or mojito options, also gave us a wine list to decide.   The brunch buffet was amazing! Unlimited salad bar in the front, along with chilled soup, veggies, fruits, pastries, assorted cheese and carving station. Servers brought us tapas every few minutes, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage, ham or veggie flatbread, potato, beef sliders, mushroom gratin, pancake, French toast on a stick, steak Benedict...so many choices, they were so delicious! Our mimosa and mojito were so yummy and strong, they brought a few desert treats too after we finished our brunch.  The service was great, all eye candy waitresses kept our glasses full all the time, servers kept bringing us more and more tapas. We enjoyed our brunch so much, with the garden patio seating? Even better!   The tab was $130, with bottomless mimosa and mojito for $20 each. It was funny I had to run back to give our waitress Lisa more tips, cause hubby realized he didn't give enough, and she deserved more. :)   Love this cute little restaurant, romantic, intimate and relaxing, one of my favorites in Vegas. :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $20 each for bottomless mimosa or mojito
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ugKjyu6eAETzZ7dDNnzsJw.text: My girlfriends and I came here for our highlight bachelorette party dinner and it was FANTASTIC. I've loved every restaurant I've gone to at the Wynn (Tableau for brunch) and will continue to make sure I try one of their restaurants every time I'm back in Vegas!   Every dish was delicious, plus their service was awesome (we needed to be out of there within 2 hours to make our show and all our dishes came within 20 minutes of us ordering! It gave us extra time to lounge around and order extra drinks at the end of the meal before we had to go. The environment   On to THE FOOOOOD!   *Thai Snapper Ceviche, Asian Pear, Habanero - $15 4 stars Great way to start the meal - light, well balanced flavors, fresh seafood. I don't even normally like ceviche but I liked this one as it had some really stand out flavors!  *Jumbo Lump Crab Lettuce Cups, Citrus Segments - $16 4.5 stars Love the contrast in texture between the fresh lettuce cups and the crab. The citrus added a great tangy kick to the flavor. A wonderfully simple but refreshing dish.   *Bacon Wrapped Dates, Blue Cheese Fondue - $12 3.5 stars Delicious - as bacon wrapped dates always should be. The I thought the blue cheese would add a really unique bit of taste but it was a bit bland, also a bit too much creamy (like those dips that come with those veggie platters at the grocery store).  *Beef Carpaccio, Arugula, Truffle Aioli - $15 4 stars Yummy, tender, well balanced.   *Fiery Artichoke, Roasted Pepper, Olives Flatbread - $14 *Chorizo, Italian & Andouille Sausage Flatbread - $15 4 stars Both flatbreads had a great crunchy crust that was soft and steamy once you bit into it. They all had a good balance of flavors.  *Salt-roasted Beets, Whipped Goat Cheese, Pistachio - $10 4.5 stars Beet-lovers (and even non-beet-lovers) unite! A wonderful little dish that has the sweet, the savory, the creamy, the crunchy.   *Lamb T-Bone, Spinach, Pomegranate - $19 4.5 stars The lamb is SO tender and delicious. With just enough pomegranate seeds to add that kick of unique flavor into every bite.  *Diver Sea Scallops, Polenta Cake, Shrimp Sauce - $17 4.5 stars Fantastic use of seafood, soggy carbs (my fave), and a delightful sauce.   *Chocolate risotto 3 stars Well done, and it came with some small cookies, but nothing particularly unique/memorable about this dish. Get if you like chocolate rice pudding =).  *S'mores flatbread 4.5 stars Ohhh yes. A delicious fatty way to end the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores flatbread - 4.5 stars
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo, Italian &amp; Andouille Sausage Flatbread - 4 stars
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Wrapped Dates, Blue Cheese Fondue - 3.5 stars

mYnT4qLQNgjIEf-ydzIz7Q.text: One of the most enjoyable Sunday Brunches I've had to date. It's advertised as "Butler-Style Brunch" or, American Dim Sum, I was a bit confused by what they meant until it was explained to us. Small plates that are brought around to your table by the servers, and you pick what you want. My previous experience at La Cave was great, the outside patio option, and the view of the pool, plus the food was excellent, made me anxious to come try brunch.   A little kink in the service, we did sit for awhile before being offered a drink, after someone had noticed, we were started out with bottomless mimosas ($20 extra on top of cost of brunch) but it did include a variety of drink options if mimosas aren't your thing.  They included;   Bloody Mary Caipirinha Margarita Mojito Sangria (white or red) Mimosa  I liked that you are able to switch them up.  Table side items inlcuded:  Heirloom Tomato and Mozzarella Salad Chilled Tomato Soup Fresh Fruit Salad Yogurt Parfait with Granola Cornflake Crusted Brioche French Toast NY Style Egg Sandwich Scrambled Eggs Angus Mini Burgers Mushroom Grits Baked Potato Loaded Tater Tots w/ Brown Gravy Tomato Mozzarella Flatbread Chef's Selection Ham & Egg Flatbread Eggs Benedict with Chorizo, Canadian Bacon or Filet Veal Short Rib Hash Pancakes with Berry Compote Bacon and Chorizo Sausage Cups  Everything we had was really good, but a few really stood out, I'm not a huge french toast lover, but the one served was by far the table favorite. I had 3 servings (don't judge, they're small). The mushroom grits and the Eggs Benedict Filet, oh and the Fresh Fruit Salad (sounds boring but it was outstanding) were  my favorites.   I'm not sure if it was intentional, but we did wait quite awhile in between servings, not sure if this is to let you rest and digest before the next server comes around with items, but we did have to ask a few times for refills on our drinks and well as food. There seemed to be plenty of staff. Service wasn't bad enough to knock a star off, we really did enjoy our food. Already making plans to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From their website
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch Offerings

9DP3xo4I_pGvxtVaMb1m1A.text: I loved La Cave. The decor and ambience were very relaxing. The service was excellent and the food is delicious! We started with the bacon wrapped dates which are so good! We had several other tapas including a flat bread and the filet crostini. The servings were larger than I had expected for a tapas restaurant and we loved all of it.

uB2rzQJA4FAWAjYhsiR30A.text: The prefix brunch menu was unexpected but delightful. Each item was brought to us and it was delicious. The service was friendly and the ambience was just right for our annual girls trip to Vegas. We felt like we were treating ourselves to the nice life.

dy279BCLgQdRa4lEiL_-ZQ.text: Beautiful setting inside. Awesome wine list to choose from. Vegan/vegetarian menu options as well. Friendly good service

u3hm8oZVJYRJouNzfN-tZw.text: I came to Vegas for a bachelorette weekend for a close friend and was charged with finding places for our party to eat (perks of being a Yelper!). I had to work with the diets of a couple veggie/vegan friends and that slightly limited my choices of eateries in Sin City. However, googling and Yelping showed that The Wynn's head chef was a converted vegan and many of the hotel's restaurants had vegan choices...yay!   Vegan/veggie menu? check. Classy venue? check. Cocktails, beer, and/or wine to start off our bachelorette party right? check!  The ATMOSPHERE in here is a combination of a classy restaurant/lounge -- there are traditional tables to sit at along with comfy couches/benches too. Instead of huge bay windows, the wall just opened up on one side of the restaurant and we got a wonderful view of the High Roller Ferris Wheel throughout our meal.   Onto the FOOD!   Even though this is considered a "tapas" restaurant, I thought their portions were much larger than traditional tapas. I got the chicken thai flatbread and it had the most amazing spicy chili sauce on top. It was also very filling! Upon request, they offered a separate vegan/veggie menu and my friends all enjoyed the mushroom ravioli.  For the DRINKS...  They had many beers on tap and a large selection of wine. There is also a full bar for cocktails. I ordered a SANGRIA and it came in the largest glass ever...it was like half a fish bowl! I loved the fresh berries and apples in my drink.   The SERVICE was very accommodating here. I was able to make a RESERVATION via Opentable and they even called me the day of to confirm our spot. I really appreciate restaurants checking in because I hate having my party wait upon arrival while they get our table ready. We were running a bit late due to traffic on The Strip, but they still held our table for us 30 minutes after our reservation time.   If you're ever in need of a classy restaurant with a diverse menu (especially for vegetarian and vegan eaters), I highly recommend La Cave at The Wynn!

B-N4BCLM46o9d4GFOVf9Fg.text: The food here was really good, however the service was terrible. It took 45 mins for us to get our checks after a mishap. They knew we needed to be out early to get to a show. After paying and leaving the manager ran us down and stopped us saying we didn't turn in a receipt. This made us even later for our show... and it turns out it was their mistake because one of the girls paid in cash so there was no cc receipt to sign. He never even apologized for incorrectly accusing us. He even used profanity when we brought it to his attention that his mistake that the customer service was poor.

_TpW1msY4Xbuxg4qZRyddg.text: The food here is good. A mix of American small plates. I was with a group of 6 and we ended up ordering about 12 dishes. Definitely enough to feed us! Some of my personal favorites were the Mexican corn flatbread, Gorgonzola salad, and the bacon wrapped dates. The place is extremely dark, fine, but everyone is using their flashlights to read the menus. The service leaves something to be desired. Spent a lot of time trying to get check, and then for it to be paid.

fXMGWRbVtifysXgtjXhB0g.text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Share plates make dinner intimate - or a party. The wine selection is tough to beat, particularly the wines by the glass.

gekwuu0ArPZT97Wj8XpcgA.text: Sat at the table right next to the bar.  Ordered ALL appetizers; to taste/experience.  Had the dark beer and saw the wines by the glass, enclosed in the glass case dispenser.  Asked to have one (Sassicaia); was told they were out (but, it was shown in the case).  Then asked for the Dunn; was told they were out too and that the bottles were just for show; they didn't have.  Then I was looking to find what else they had; that was not the only bottles. I wouldn't have thought much in another establishment, but, the Wynn?!  Why would you put a wine that you don't have on display?  Especially in your display dispenser?!?!  FYI.  Staff is very attentive at first.  Trying to get someone to order a cocktail, additional menu items is another subject.

nfHnhq-BQVUKovuIwfzzlA.text: We went to "La Cave" last night. It was really a nice experience. All the meals are small plates and they are arranged by type of food in the menu so you have a vegan/vegetarian menu. Some of the food was excellent and some was just ok. My "must orders" is the Mexican street corn flatbread. The service was amazing.

4v5Re7M97hkk0BoAqv7qUw.text: 5 for a great ambience although can be a little snooty so if you are uncomfortable with that there are too many other choices; Food quality was a 4; Presentation 4.5; Value 3.5.

CrE7QYmgYa7pquFuvNzqXQ.text: I truly don't like to hate on places, but there is nothing about this restaurant that would make me go back. I read reviews people said they had a good time others said there was a nice ambiance. None of this was True.  Let me start with service. It wasn't terrible if u like that your server doesn't care. The only reason I tipped her is cause I'm in the industry and felt bad for the bussers. She barely let us know the menu and could care less. And pretty much only stopped at the table to take the order and pick up the check. We ordered a bottle of wine also. The came to table presented it then took it to the back to open it. I'm not balling and buying crazy expensive bottles, but that's not how u do it. Especially for a restaurant specializing in wine. The food was about the quality of some wanna be tapas shanti that can't make its food cost, so they go extra cheap.  Shrimp ceviche had some flavor but was impossible to taste it cause you needed a spoon to get the sauce out of the dish and That was non existent. The beef carpaccio was decent. The flatbread was just another flatbread, the beignets were over cooked and not doughy in the middle. The crab was canned crab on lettuce with an orange wedge. I get simplicity but not with that product.  Overall mediocre meal with lackluster service at a high price.

xRGw1o3LQJJZGiWM6MgkJQ.text: You can't lose at LaCave--amazing atmosphere and food! I was here in late March and had been here once a year prior, and both times I was with clients and it was absolutely delightful. The waitstaff are so super helpful and nice and not at all snobby. We ordered a bunch  of wine and small plates and shared them around the table, to the delight of all. The bacon-wrapped dates are a must, as are the mushroom grits (trust me). This time because we were a party of 8 we were seated on a small candlelit balcony--there were other people there but it was amazingly intimate.

t1L6EmQDtZ2CC8NohUdEpA.text: Just have to say!!!! GO. Great little plates that aren't so small. Very well thought out cudos to the chef!!! Wine list extensive. Atmosphere was very relaxed and quiet great place for a late lunch!!! Love it

vxNAj9cp1UlIKcqmkiKW-g.text: I've been looking forward to trying La Cave for awhile now. We made reservations and were seated at our outdoor table at 815pm. The atmosphere inside near the pizza ovens and bar would have been more interesting but the outdoor area was enjoyable.   Our server explained the menu and special and responded to our questions very well. She was busy with several tables the rest of dinner and could have checked in on us a few more times.  I had the Spanish wine flight but had to ask for a copy of the wine menu again because she didn't explain each of the wines.   We enjoyed the asparagus with jamon Serrano and egg; those Spanish pigs are tasty. The beets with goat cheese were not as good as I had hoped. The bacon and quail egg flatbread was just ok but filling. The veal short rib pasta was quite good especially with the Spanish red wines on the flight. But the winning tapas of the night was the sea scallops with polenta. You only get two and we could have eaten ten they were so good.   Overall La Cave was a good place to enjoy tapas and wine on the north strip. But I was not wowed like I am when I eat at Jose Andres restaurants like Jaleo. If I'm anywhere near the central strip and in the mood, I'd rather eat there.

-Wbcw4Kc1_YMVqj4GrgNAA.text: Ambience is nice. Food is satisfactory and overpriced for what you get. If you want a great tapas spot, go to Firefly instead.

zPm--bn8-zojdvOOmpMl7A.text: I will SO not be coming back here! Came here for brunch, and boy, was I NOT impressed! I'll start with the pro's....it's in Wynn, and that's a classy casino. The ambiance is quite nice. They have these 2 swings in the corner that you can sit on, and these 2 really relaxing looking chairs you can eat at. THE END. The cons.....oh the cons! The price for brunch is ridiculous, especially when you add in the bottomless drinks. The service is HORRIBLE....like, can you pass me again without offering me food....thanks! The waitress didn't even know what one of the drinks was.....there are only SIX drinks....and FIVE everyone knows: margarita, mimosa, mojito, blood mary, sangria. The last one was a brazilian rum drink (I dont know the name, but I dont work there so I dont have to!) The food was eh. I mean, really EEHH (shoulder shrug). Nothing stands out, nothing was delicious or OMG, you have to try it. Well, that's not True. The yogurt parfait was delicious. That's it Freakin yogurt.....add some lemon zest and basil and BAM, it's tasty. PASS on this place. Save your time, and your money. Not worth it. Half price? Not worth it.

QKMF5ddoAfB8V9yFE1ndyw.text: I had the serious DISPLEASURE of attempting to dine at La Cave in the Wynn Hotel, Las Vegas this evening. What a dark, miserable little dungeon run by trolls.  I was seated by a very snotty, skank hostess who apparently had little interest in the answers to her canned hostess questions: Was I a guest here? No. How do I like staying at the hotel? Uhm, I'm not. Would I like a wine list? No, I'm not drinking tonight....still got the wine menu. Why even ask if you don't even care??? Robot in fishnet stockings that she was, I'm glad she got off her stripper pole at the gas station in North Vegas in time to come to work at La Cave and find me a wobbley little table. YIKES.  Anyway, I was dining alone and sat at the table waiting for a waiter/waitress for well over 15 minutes without ANY service, water or otherwise. Waitstaff walked by constantly, still no service.  Since I was on a tight schedule, I got up and tracked down a waitress in the kitchen area and politely explained to her what had happened and then handed her back my menus. No one cared and no one tried to remedy the situation.  I wound up eating at another restaurant in the hotel, with great service. Sorry, La Cave. Your service was beyond rude, your hostess staff was dirty and I was happy to take my 40% tip elsewhere.

-VoyBTP2aSwcezbpnH4brw.text: The Sunday brunch is fabulous.  Enjoy bottomless drinks (you can alternate among mimosas, margaritas, caipirinhas, mojitos, bloody marys, and sangria) and high-quality butler-style tapas.  (Think of it as Westernized Dim Sum.)  The view over the Wynn pool is also quite gorgeous!

t-R922hQIRzf6zOcmWetFA.text: This was one of the most memorable dinners my wife and I have ever had. We went on a Tuesday night before going to a show right there at the Wynn and enjoyed a leisurely dinner on the patio of the restaurant.  The wine list was quite lengthy and we had a great bottle of Pinot Gris, which was kept chilled for us on a very hot day.  The food was absolutely phenomenal. I have a big appetite and usually stay away from Tapas-type places but we were able to order plates one at a time to make sure we had enough food (but not so much we couldn't enjoy the show after). The scallops were a highlight, along with the bacon and egg carbonara. The flatbread was delicious and a bit more filling and the sliders were excellent.  Thanks to Nikia for tremendous service and a truly memorable dinner.

ddGfuNktJXBHGJFohiIQOA.text: We were staying at the Wynn, decided to give this place a try.  I thought this was a family restaurant, but it's more of a bar lounge.  If you are looking for that kind of an environment, this is a nice place.  I was with my kids and they were hungry we decided to stay anyways.   The Thai Flatbread - not too bad for the size and price.  I personally don't like the Thai flavors on pizza or flat bread it always too sweet.  My kids liked it so I guess it was alright.   Cavatelli Lamb with brussel sprouts - it was ok it's super small...Good thing I wasn't hungry so it was fine.  Angus Burger Sliders - Now if a 9 year says his burger is dry then you know it's dry.  They eat McDonalds all the time and don't complain.  These sliders were really bad doesn't live up to it.  French Fries - Surprisingly, they were the best things, then again they're probably frozen fries.     Beignets - You get 5 doughnut holes with some jam for $9, talk about getting ripped off.  I ordered a 4oz pour glass of wine and my kids had soft drinks, bill came out to $96.  I guess you pay for the ambiance and not the food!!!

kYrKzkTKYkx2BKbYRUgZXg.text: Wow this is a great spot for a special occasion. I dont try and go to the strip often, but I have been meaning to try this place. Me and my girlfriend went for her birthday dinner and it was superb. It was pricey but we were celebrating and expecting to spend some dough. But we felt like it was worth it. The staff was helpful and friendly, as well as the manager Rich. He made great suggestions and we had an enjoyable conversation with him. You feel like the food is made with care and attention to detail. And the service allows you to enjoy yourself, they don't make you feel rushed which irriates me about other places. We are glad we went, it's hard for me to find a place on the strip where it feels like the staff genuinely cares and works well together

z9PuWUUvznL_j5mgWO75Cw.text: Overall I loved it.   The scallops were beyond delicious,  scrumptious perfection, but only 2 pieces.   The veal short rib with brusell sprouts was delicious,  but unexpected specially since the description didn't mention it would be penne pasta with shredded short rib.  The sauce more than makes up for the misleading description.   The flavors in the beef carpaccio decadent, too bad it's such a small portion.   The ceviche had no flavor,  u couldn't even taste the lime,  that alone makes me want to take a star away,  but everything else was delicious.  I wish they would bring the lamb chops back.   The place is suppose to resemble a wine cellar hence "La Cave"  but it could be too dark for some folk. Oh and the portions are too small for the price of each dish.    The price range was from $8-12 for salads not bad,  but $15-20 for main dishes,  which are tiny.    By the way I'm not a fat ass that gorges on food I actually like sharing with my significant other,  and I believe in quality not quantity,  but these portions could use a slight enlargement. :-)

fyGKFDFUkpw4Sv5seRExTA.text: A large group of were searching for a great place to nosh before spending a rather grandiose evening out in Vegas (ya, one of those Vegas nights!). We stumbled upon La Cave, which graciously accommodated our size, then proceeded to Blow-My-Mind! The bacon wrapped dates were scrumptious, the flat breads delicious, the prosciutto  stuffed chicken was rich and robust, and the diver scallops to die for. But the pie de resistance was the carpaccio. It was THE BEST I have ever had. We ordered 7x over. 7! I'm not kidding. That good.   So next time you are in Sin City check out La Cave. I'd say it'd be a sin not to!

7yKj97De66D8fkcEchse3Q.text: La Cave is a nice hidden gem (at least the entrance is) not far from The Buffet. When the line for the Buffet is easily over an hour long or you don't feel like paying the extra $12 for the VIP line, consider coming to La Cave to enjoy a meal. Tapas-style portion sizes means you can order a bunch and share it amongst the table.  If you're looking for a cozy brunch, La Cave offers an AYCE served-tableside brunch option. Think of those Brazilian churrascarias, but instead of coming by with skewers of meat, they come by with trays of yummy breakfast items including but not limited to berry crepes, french toast sticks, jerk chicken wings, pancakes, sausages, grits, tater tots, and CUPS of bacon. Yes, that's right. You can have CUPS of bacon at your table. Oh, and short ribs (of all things??)  If you can score a seat on the patio, you'll have a nice view of the guest pool, and if you happen to be at the edge of the seating area, you'll catch a nice balanced draft of A/C and desert air.

fkvaNMI7avT4CH0iJu4NRA.text: This place was the best food I had in las vegas.  It was fresh, had tons of vegetarian and vegan and gluten free options (thanks to Mr. Wynn), and was creative and highly recommended!  Prices were expectedly high but not as high as other 'luxury' restaurants with less choice and less good food.

eeAFmfgskX0DwRzuuRa3bA.text: Nice Atmosphere, very kind hosts, good food.

6Qj-sS678aTFDNfHB6oxjA.text: Really enjoyed my dinner at this "new" place when we went for the 1st time! The place is very nice, one bar facing the kitchen (which is too warm for me), one bar facing the wine, and one large bar facing alcohol bottle and wine bottle. The tapas were fantastic! The staff was amazing, one of the bartendar was the master in food recommendation and the other bar staff was the wine expert. Perfect team! The place is little too warm for me, which made the wine too warm for my taste. Even if poored from the wine fridge, it was too warm for me.  The food was amazing, the ambiance was great. The bar high chair were not comfy but the bartender recommended switching them with the one from the middle of the place which were much MORE comfy!!  The highlight of my experience were the beignets!!!! ...and the sliced sirloin!!!! :) Going back this week and cant wait!! Yoohoo!!

W35HsrDT1EuWlxkWm6UTxw.text: One of our favorite spots. Awesome food service and ambience. Dining on the outdoor patio is a must and all the food is great. Bacon wrapped dates and sliders are always a must. The s'mores flatbread was a winner too

L7ryeK38096KUA6XTLTmFw.text: Was not memorable. We ordered 4-5 different items and we're not impressed with any of them. The goat cheese was ok, the bread did not taste fresh, the pasta a bit cold, the caviar and tuna tartare was not what we expected, and even the sliders tasted like something I can make at home. Overall, we were hoping for more with all the good reviews.

Gx8FkmdQT-XG0CpGAmcrzQ.text: I hosted my husband and daughter's birthday celebrations at this wine and food hideaway.  We had the front part of the bar area reserved for two hours.  It was perfect and the food was amazing.  The ambiance was perfect for a party. We had enough space to mingle and the passed appitizers were very delicious.  The manager Rich was very attentive and really went out of his way to make sure that we were taken care of.  The price was reasonable for what we got.  I was so impressed as it's always hard to book a party from the telephone and at a place that I've never been to. Thank you, La Cave for helping us make many lovely memories with our family and friends.

uazyJHfBNQyYR7UZ4ezOsw.text: Went to La Cave ar tve Wynn last Saturday night. My experience was awesome. The Shrimp Shishito Peppers with the Orange Glaze Sauce was tasty. Bacon Wrapped Dates with Blue Cheese Fondue were amazing too. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Washed everything down with a delicious trestles IPA from Left Coast Brewing. It was Citrus crisp and refreshingly smooth. I'll definitely be back.

ItRe-sN6Iuwg5oLPmNBuAg.text: La Cave is an alluring, quaint little restaurant within Wynn that was my second gastronomically-bookmarked stop in Las Vegas. It's a potentially dressy but not too dressy, intimate but not too intimate venue, with both indoor and outdoor seating. I enjoyed the ambiance within La Cave, especially the hammock swings, but the nonchalant attitude of our hostess and server put a bit of a damper on brunch. Jumbo lump crab lettuce cups with citrus segments: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) The lightness of this dish was very refreshing, but the straight-out-of-the-refrigerator coldness of the lump crab meat kept me from loving the preparation. The presentation, as shown on the picture, was also a bit lacking. I liked the acidic balance of the citrus segments, but I would have preferred they be sliced into smaller bits and interspersed throughout the crab. Kale salad: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) I love the taste of kale by itself, so it's very hard to go wrong with kale in my book. The fresh kale itself was tender and springy, but the dressing was deathly sweet. It was so sweet that I had trouble tasting the actual taste of kale, which was disappointing. As I'm allergic to apples, I requested that they come on the side (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). I would have also preferred that these be cut into thinner, smaller slices. Warm beet salad with goat cheese: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) This warm beet salad was probably my favorite dish of the meal, as the beets were cooked perfectly and cut into the perfect bite-sized cubes. There was a generous amount of melted goat cheese that was flavored well, and it was almost fondue-like how I was able to dip the beets into the goat cheese for a tasty morsel. The presentation was also adorable; this is a must-order for beet-lovers. Lamb shank atop bed of couscous: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) The couscous was blatantly undercooked and underseasoned. The lamb shank was cooked well, but also a tad underseasoned, which I didn't mind because I like the natural taste of lamb. For someone who minded gaminess though, it may have been too much. It was an elegant dish that just fell a little short of the mark. Shrimp with piquillo peppers and fingerling potatoes: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) We added this dish on at the very end, so I'm not sure if it was because I was pretty full by the time it was served or if I was just not really that big a fan of it.. I liked the tangy citrus notes of the sauce, and the fingerling potatoes were cooked well, but there were maybe two total.. and they were cut into halves. The shrimp also just didn't have much of a shrimp taste, which is something that always bugs me: when food misses its nature-made taste. Bacon and quail egg flatbread: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) Out of the two flatbreads, this was definitely my favorite, and I'm usually not a fan of bacon (I know, I know). The huge chunks of fatty bacon were a bit more like ham in my book, and the runny quail eggs (more please!) somehow cut the heaviness of the meat and cheese. The perfect toastiness of the flatbread, with its crunchy outside and fluffy inside, set off the dish nicely. Fiery artichoke and pepperoncini flatbread: (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) The large portions of flatbread with glaring deficiencies of toppings made me immediately "meh," and the unimpressive flavors just reinforced that sentiment. I remember the pepperoncinis being very sour, but not much else. The flatbread was a tad overbaked compared to the previous one. I'm not sure if I would return to La Cave, as the price point was a little high for mediocre quality, and the small tapas-like plates tend to add up quickly. If I do, I'll definitely order the bacon and quail egg flatbread and warm beet salad again.

pcDZdcCfFCdHG3o3VQ_XXA.text: This place was decent. Much of the food came out warm, and you know how gross cold eggs can be. I almost lost it when I took a bite of the egg sandwich. When I mentioned the chicken and waffles were cold, I was told it came straight outta the oven... that explains why it was warm and dry. Wings should come from fryers, waffles from the press. And not much of a variety for $50. @americanalv blows this outta the water. Kerry Simon did it best, when he invented this format. RIP, my friend.

2NVA80cI8kqV0gszSmqbxA.text: I had my wedding reception here on May 5, 2018 and it was absolutely spectacular.  Not only is the indoor outdoor area of the restaurant beautiful but all of the staff were extremely accommodating.  Before our wedding we decided to have the music that the restaurant offered, but the manager was extremely helpful in helping us set up music that we had brought for One special song for our wedding.  All of my guests agreed that the food was delicious.  We had an array of hors d'oeuvres and for dinner we had a pasta station two  meat stations, seafood, a Smore's station and multiple salads.  I was also impressed by our wedding cake!  I was able to send them a picture of a cake that I liked that I found on Pinterest and they were able to make a beautiful cake very similar to that picture.  I am extremely thankful for the service at this restaurant... they truly made my wedding night one to remember!!

gTl1WbbR-Sm5LGRAEJrawg.text: This place has an amazing brunch with views to match! It is a bit pricey but you are getting exactly what you pay for. Food is made to order and the server continues to come with what is on the menu. Be careful, COME HUNGRY, Because you will be super full at the end. Everything is fresh!!! Drinks are so good, you have an option of choosing from 5 different ones. My favorite dish is the loaded tots as well as the NY egg sandwich. I am originally from NY and that brought back serious memories.  I will definitely come back and I highly recommend this place!

AsHCwZg2iszJZxeLXNzr9w.text: A really great evening at La Cave! The food was amazing, the Ahi tuna completely over the top. We did two glasses of different wines, followed by a wine flight. Three dishes was more than enough for two of us. Shaundra was helpful, friendly and a superb server. We will be back!

DFq_0Q4bF2z7Blfqo8ix2A.text: Went to Vegas for my birthday and was told by the lady at the front desk who checked us in this was her favorite restaurant at the hotel. So walking through the hotel, we decided to give it a shot during happy hour. It was tapas style so the portions were super tiny, but also had a lot of flavor. Super delicious.  Would recommend for happy hour.

JaPnHOX6ElsQzuyfOOricg.text: Amazeballs! Everything is amazing! Craft cocktails made to perfection and a wide assortment of tapas with complex flavors.

QsQtRwhz55udQUiiLQ6Ecw.text: My girlfriends and I were looking for a fancy dinner and found this place! It was perfect for all our cravings because of the tapas style dishes and the wine was wonderful as well. I highly recommend this for a great atmosphere, food and drink!

VA8Evru8EORzMCO2V7P68Q.text: Food and atmosphere are awesome. Bryson was our waiter and he was great too.   The table across from us had 2 young promiscuous rude girls who had the phone on speaker super loud. My mom asked for a manager and the hostess sent her next store to get him.
