jLuYhpShANYRNdwpyhjfSQ.text: Excellent Tapas style (not top-less) dining before Le Reve for our group of 10.  Loved the smaller serving size and variety of options to choose from.  Hits at the table were the crab filled lettuce cups, Thai chicken flatbread, shredded Brussels sprouts, salmon, and the mushroom grits.  Service was excellent, and food was delivered as soon as it was freshly prepared.  Yes, it gets pricey, but it's consistent with other Similar restaurants on the strip.  Everyone in our group concurred we will return here next year during our annual Vegas reunions.

-oPx1nnuiaFRTfT-J2Vm2A.text: My husband and I love this place for date night. You can dress fancy or more casual if you like. It's a very intimate setting and the outside patio is beautiful and quiet. This place has the best vegan and vegetarian options that we've tried so far in Vegas. They are super creative and more likely than not delicious! The cavetalli pasta with pumpkin cream was a big hit with us, and my husband doesn't usually like pumpkin. Also the vegetarian French onion soup is very rich and surprising how they get it so savory without beef stock. Definitely come here if you want to try something new and creative and be ready to share bc everything's too good not to.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DdK_ScNB0tWXOs7c3KiGrA.text: Come for the ambiance over the food!  I first dined at La Cave for my BFF's birthday party. And by party I mean the birthday girl, myself and our third musketeer. We were keen on a more upscale experience. Somewhere around casual fine dining without breaking the bank. We also wanted to do a girl's night where we could actually talk to each other without a voicebox / stereo system throwdown. La Cave maintains a reasonable volume level and never gets very loud regardless of how full it is.  AMBIANCE  |  It definitely has the low-light, sultry feel going for it with a few very intimate dining areas. In my experience, the further away from the entrance you are the better. The main dining room is alright, but the garden room is a little more luxurious with the indoor/outdoor sliding doors. You get the cozy seating and low ceilings but you get to check out the Lake of Dreams-inspired garden.  FOOD  |  The veal short rib deserves a solid 5 stars. It's always perfectly cooked and really well marinated. At $20, portions are surprisingly bigger than expected. At the same cost, they have the sliced sirloin which is 100% pass. The mushroom fondue is more salt than flavor and on one occasion, it was served cold. Honorable mentions are the warm beets w/ goat cheese and the pepper/artichoke flatbread.  WINE & SERVICE  |  I've been to La Cave on a few different occasions and service seems to be consistently mediocre. You'll see your server a couple times in the beginning but don't expect them to check up on you very much. For my friend's birthday we got a relatively inexpensive bottle of chianti ($70). But the second time I went, my other friend purchased a nearly $300 cab and even then, our server rarely came by to top off our wine glasses. The wine selection is extensive and organized in a way where a wine lover of any calibre can pick something they like. La Cave also being a swanky wine bar also has a pretty decent selection of wines on tap on those fancy Enomatic systems.  Nice choice for a date spot or a GNO!

D-Yj3ii5wyuD9DMJAjT9aQ.text: Well, where do I start?  The ambiance is wonderful; cozy, inviting, with a warm but simple flair.  This was my first visit, probably won't be my last, but I won't go there for the food.  The food was so-so.  Not bad, but I've definitely had better.  Overpriced, $50 for lunch, now understand that this is for one.  The wait staff was effective--not warm and welcoming more cold and clipped. The tables for two are to close together, while I understand the need to conserve space I don't want the person sitting next to me breathing on my food.  All in all, I'll be back for drinks,  but I'll be looking elsewhere for the dining experience.

GaXYUouKW6Q-G0CJ7VG6ZQ.text: I came here for a business meeting with a group of 8 and was excited to try it out. I was honestly looking forward to giving this joint more than 3 stars but they fell short of what was expected. It all started with the lack of service, knowledge and organization.  When we asked our waiter questions about the menu he kept having to go to the manager/kitchen to ask. Then after ordering he was still having problems with getting our food to the right tables and people, therefore the arrival of our food was slow.   My meal consisted of tomato mozzarella flatbread pizza, caesar salad and some crostini/crab dish that at this point was not memorable. Also the price seemed to be normal for this kind of place, but from the service and food I'd say it wasn't worth it this time around.  I will though give Le Cave props for the beautiful decor and ambiance, but service + food needs improvement. I do look forward to giving this joint another whirl in the near future to see if things have changed.

mWHDQlRgGcR1dKKTzs4Hsg.text: This little hideaway in the Wynn is a gem!  We were a party of 11 girls celebrating a friend's birthday and this was the perfect place to drink wine and share a lot of small plates.  They have these great wine flights which let us try a bunch of different wines.  The food was delicious!  I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates, the cheese and charcuterie board, and the prawns.  They also make a great Moscow mule!

KVcRqoUcYQ-Hk1SsQqcxsw.text: This was our only dinner in Vegas that I didn't meticulously research ahead of time, and it turned out to be fantastic.  La Cave is a sexy dark little restaurant in the Wynn Hotel, specializing in small plates and wine. We were seated immediately despite lacking a reservation. Unfortunately, given the theme of the restaurant, I was very much not in a wine mood and so opted for a cocktail instead. That said, La Cave offered several different wine flights as well as an extensive menu of by-the-glass or bottles. If I went back I'd be interested to try a flight as they seemed to have interesting themes.  The food was excellent. We shared four dishes: The shrimp with piquillo peppers and potatoes, a three sausage flatbread, the beef sliders, and pasta with short rib and Brussels sprouts. All four dishes were delicious, but the shrimp was far and away the best one. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and the seasonings in the dish were just delicious. We fought over the dregs of the sauce. The pasta came in a close second place. The sausage flatbread was surprisingly spicy, so be forewarned if you're heat-phobic. Four dishes turned out to be plenty for the two of us to share, with a small amount of leftovers.  My only reason for not giving La Cave five stars is that the service was very slow, particularly at the start of dinner. We waited quite a while to give drink orders and again to order food. Once the food order was placed, service picked up, as each dish is sent from the kitchen as it's ready. Honestly, the service would not stop me from coming back--it wasn't bad, just slow--but I feel like it kept our experience at La Cave from being "as good as it gets."  Recommended.

bcrXZF4enR75hxNbMR6Cmw.text: Dined here three times already... Obviously that means I like the place.   Tried a variety of plates..... Crab lettuce cups (YUM), caesar salad (very basic), crispy wonton salmon (LOVE) , tomato flatbread (pass on this.... too saucy and tomatoey.. a little different than expected), chorizo flatbread (WINNER. but spicy. PRETTY spicy), onion soup (lots of onions and above average), mini burgers (3 burgers nice for picking.... not anything out of the world.... pretty average but will get again).  Wines they have a nice array of....... Always just do the flights for the sake of being able to try different types of wine..... Tried the France and Italian and def the French was a nice choice :D  WILL BE BACK AGAIN :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forget what type of pizza
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo flatbread.... Winner!!!

_4j50Zbfr3U_E8RzHg98oA.text: After reading other yelp reviews, there are a few standout items at La Cave (including the tableside smoked salmon). Unfortunately, I was not able to try any of these during La Cave's Sunday Buffet Brunch because these items are unavailable during this brunch. This cost $50 per person and an additional $20 for bottomless mimosas/sangrias/mojitos/etc.  The food at La Cave is only decent, probably because I did not get the chance to try their more popular dishes. The Buffet Brunch had a list of about 15 items, ranging from mixed fruits to yogurt parfaits to eggs benedict to mini burgers. Everything was served "butler-style" meaning that servers walked around with a platter and asked whether you wanted the items they had available. Of the 15-ish items, only a few stood out. First, the mushroom grits were very tasty. Second, the baked potato tater tots with brown gravy was very crispy and good, but still did not warrant a price of $50 for the quality. The eggs benedict was surprisingly good because the egg was poached very nicely and La Cave had 3 variations of eggs benedict: chorizo, canadian bacon and filet. All of these went well as the meat in the eggs benedict. One of the 2 BEST items here was the veal short rib hash. This was one of the only dishes that actually came out piping hot on a sizzling plate. The veal was shredded and drenched with flavorful sauce. The other item that really stood out was the ham egg flatbread. This was the other item that actually came out hot. The cheese was slightly crumbly and completely melted over the ham and egg. I would've been happy eating an entire piece of this flat bread.  Overall, there simply wasn't enough good dishes to justify a price of $50 even though La Cave had a list of 15 items to choose from.  As for the drinks, the red sangria here was incredible - - in fact, probably one of the best I have ever had. Even though this was bottomless, each and every glass was strong yet delicious. $20 is somewhat steep on top of the $50 meal, but I think it was well worth it!

f5YR733Fbp_qpH2zENr7TA.text: My husband and I were in Vegas, so in order to avoid all the other breakfast/brunch lines, we tried La Cave for their Sunday Brunch. All the items were on display at the front of the restaurant, which all seemed to look tasty. Unfortunately, they didn't taste as good as they looked. First, the food served was completely cold. Second, they brought the options around in no sort of order and we didn't even get offered a few things off the menu that was listed. Going from Yogurt parfait to Sliders is not how I expect to enjoy my brunch. They seemed to be passing around more of one food item, than others; so we didn't end up getting all items. Bottom line, their brunch is not up to par with all the other Wynn/Encore restaurants. We called the manager to express our dissatisfaction with the food served to us and he didn't really seem to want to gain our business in the future. For the price we paid for 2 people, this place is definitely not worth it. We will not be going back!

g5HiIxTMTeY5PlwPrfv_cg.text: Oh so amazingly fresh and tasty!!  Sit at the bar for the True interactive, fun experience. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z52LqG6R9rkDXoVkj47xSA.text: Best tapas spot in Vegas. Just go. Enjoy. I've gone about ten times now and I have never had bad service or a bad dish there. The prosciutto with fig jam is amazing. Crab cakes are bomb. Plus if you sit on the patio outside the seclusion adds a nice effect to the meal. Perfect for date night. Don't change a thing guys.

rN4RItq4xONM-cjgSfbvDQ.text: I love this place.  Considering it is at the Wynn, it is very unpretentious and affordable, especially for a wine bar/tapas restaurant.  I am giving it 3 stars because I have been there twice now and both times the service has been horrible.  Both times we have sat at our table for at least 10 minutes before anyone even approached us to offer a menu.  Then, once we got the menu, we had to ask for the actual wine menu.  I mean, you are a wine bar, that should be a given.  Once we had our menus, it took at least another 15 minutes to place our order.  After this, the food is excellent. At one point, the Executive Chef actually delivered part of our order and to check on us.  Overall, I love this place and will definitely continue to go back.  Hopefully they can work out the kinks with the service - it is not a big place and I can not imagine how the Servers would be overwhelmed with the small amount of tables they have at a time.

BZITUFjNhKnU7cPTugjv4g.text: I'm going to break this down and make things really simple.  Two words. Fiery Yazi.  Now go. Now!  Oh... Also, top notch bar service - absolutely impeccable and special. Now you may go.

2c64h5PXktVLgWr-q2DBmw.text: Great place to dine while dressed in style, at the Wynn, yet not too painful for your wallet. Yes, the portions may be small for hungry Y chromosomes, but it was perfect for a group of ladies hungry for food after watching a Cirque de Solei performance. The waitress recommended us ordering 2 dishes per person, but we found that one dish per person was more than plenty. However, you have to try their drinks! I ordered Yuca Java? (contained jalapenos) - it gives you that perfect kick of spiciness just to make your mouth tingle. giggle giggle. Everything on their menu is delicious - but I ordered the Chef's special flatbread and it was delicious and filling! Can easily be an appetizer to serve 4 people.

pUn2jE_cuXow69CDIvRaNw.text: Bacon wrapped dates are so so good ....everything was so good, great staff and nice atmosphere, the best food in Vegas I've had this far! Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates

83wPGrewNh6IWWp5Dm64-w.text: We had a great time dining here. With a reservation we were seated right away. The food and drinks were delicious. The staff and hostesses were very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1e-KTxHiCqX2_qpU95JGZQ.text: Really enjoyed ourselves in the low-key intimacy of this venue. The food was excellent: beets with goat cheese and the flatbread were great!  The huge TV inside was a bit distracting, we ended up moving to the 'outside.'

UIWYTIWriJhVR-UEmwmkUg.text: The dining options in Vegas are endless.  Many of the restaurants are more open, bustling with the activity of a club, or adjacent to the casino floor - with the lights and noise that come with it. La Cave is not this. If you are looking for a more intimate engagement, this may be your place.  La Cave is a tapas-bar, wine cellar set in a modern wine cave setting.  The first thing you will notice is that it is dark, really dark.  Lights come, most noticeably from a neon sign saying - In Vino Veritas - above a long table in the front.. Appropriate. There are also a few platforms, lit from below, with an assortment of empty wine bottles on them.  Stone arches and iron gates help complete the feeling like you are in a wine cave.  They have two bars, one in front and one in back, along with a very nice outdoor patio area.  On the night we were dining, it was about half full, but still was quiet and intimate.    First the wine - excellent selections both in the bottle and by the glass from most regions around the world. I went with the Italian Arneis - which  you don't see a whole lot and my wife selected a very nice Oregon Pinot Noir. They also have a nice offering of craft beers as well as cocktails and liquor options. It's Vegas, so be sure to pace yourself, since you will be going to other places. Though if you just stayed here, that would be a good thing.  The food portions are tapas style, but on the larger side, and everything is excellent.  We started with the Tuscan Bran Salad (tasty) and the Mushroom Grits (excellent). The Angus Mini Burgers were good, and the Pepperoni Flatbread Pizza was shockingly good (after all, it is just sausage, right).  We also had the Smores Desert Flatbread at the end, wow and wow again.   Price? Even for Vegas standards, I felt that this was on the high side, which drops them down a little bit. So, be prepared when you get a table for four with 5 glasses of wine and 5 plates and it is $230 plus tip.  Still, the next time we are in Vegas, we will be back.  Loo Review - Since it is a small restaurant, they don't have their own facilities. You have to go back out of the front door, go left and use the common area bathroom on the arcade.

D2gv9KeWqiyBoHFEZOUHNA.text: Great food. Restaurant was busy but pretty quiet over all. Good place for a quiet relaxing dinner.

ugbeKO2Roj-dCs8wCJpcCA.text: Make a reservation unless you want to sit at one of the two bars. Scallops,  flat bread, warm beats, and crab ravioli were excellent.  Nice wine and beer selection.

2TmHUUXlNIDQnIXGIr13Gw.text: Drinks were overpriced and mediocre. Bartender was not friendly. Decided not to eat dinner there

hSLzMOaefw1OI-i_3yAh7w.text: Amazing service, venue and food. Suggest you eat outdoors it beautiful. Enjoy the atmosphere and stay a while with the endless food and beverages

3dzo6fj1rrXYOhj8gJccdg.text: This restaurant is an undiscovered jewel in Vegas - it is next to the Wynn Buffet.  Food is extremely tasty and delicious and most importantly not too greasy and heavy.  Prices range in the $20s max for entrees and appetizers run in the $10s.- all of which seem like a bargain.  The angus steak, fettucine eggs and bacon, and flatbreads are all highly recommended.   I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Egg fettuccine, prosciutto sunny side egg

Kv4xbEAlvjKoJ0YxqOwnMQ.text: This place was delicious, and our waiter was superb.  I have one teeeeeny tinnnnyyyy comment. They brought out all the food at once basically. There was literally 15 minutes between the appetizer and the dessert being brought out. They need to spread it out!  That being said.. ceviche, steak, beets and goat cheese salad and the smores flat bread was incredible!   The ambiance and decor is phenomenal.  Well worth a visit!

Ken-mEfp1IBgHFkNptF69Q.text: We were a rather large group (23 - 7 of which were kids) but they knew this when we made our reservations and we made the ordering process as smooth as possible by having one person order for the group. The manager was clearly overwhelmed by the size of our party - he couldn't even hide his lack of competence. Within three minutes of seating us, he went around both tables to tell our party to keep it quiet. Considering we were the only party sitting inside, who do we need to be quiet for? You? Plus, if you had 23 people seated at separate tables, they would be just as loud.  The service was quick - they were clearly eager to get us out (which is understandable. We actually did an early dinner so we could be out of there before their dinner rush). Was it friendly? Not by any means. I had to thank a waiter three times   before he acknowledged me (he clearly heard me - he just didn't care like an ill mannered 6 year old). The kids started playing with the little fake candles - the ones that cost me $0.10 each at party city and the restaurant $0.0003 each. The manager, who just seems to really hate anything joyous, quickly ran over and YANKED (yes, yanked) them away from the kids. Why was that necessary? The kids were quiet (per his request) and not hurting anybody/anything. Why was he so anti them having a good time? Overall, decent food - unfriendly service - cheap management

yhCNjWdcj9OBv5pu-ByQ2w.text: This place is phenomenal! Coming from a local point of view, we never really eat out on the strip.  Their brunch is amazing. The corn flake brioche French toast is THE BEST. The service is exemplary and everyone that works there is so friendly. We cannot wait to try out dinner time!

-RVdLqaWSJcpuCz9CcgwOg.text: We had a friend in town for a convention and all hit up La Cave on a Friday night.  She had an event, so we had an early reservation at 5:30.  No other tables were seated, but a few came in shortly thereafter.  The wine list is solid, but the sommelier was gone for some reason, so after picking our bottle we had to wait at least 10 minutes, which was annoying.  It was a cab, and it was at perfect temperature.  You will spend on bottles here, but they had a few selections by the glass as well.  We shared a bunch of the small plates:  bacon wrapped dates, the steak/onion/blue cheese flatbread, gorgonzola salad, meatballs with polenta (a special), a charcuterie plate, and diver sea scallops.  The charcuterie was $33 for 6 choices, 3 cheese and 3 meat.  You get a LOT of food with this, so while the price tag may seem high, it's certainly worth it.  Excellent quality, and they come with a nice spread and many crustinis.  The menu is not enormous, but what they make, they make well.  I prefer that to having dozens of options that are all average or worse...  The flatbread was also large, with 8 good-sized pieces.  The dates only come 4 to an order, and they are delicious.  The bacon crisps up nicely, but didn't get burned.  They are served with a blue cheese sauce that could have a little more blue flavor for me, but it was a nice sauce nonetheless.  The salad was a slight miss for me if any dish was.  But, overall, a fantastic meal, and we certainly had enough to eat.    It's a cool atmosphere, pretty dark in the evening, but a nice place.  I will return.

EedseXH_DYvIGgNeecqnqQ.text: Once again we are totally blown away by another restaurant at the Wynn.    We have been to many of the restaurants at the Wynn and Encore and La Cave rates right up there as excellent.  Service by Melissa was superb, friendly and very professional and pleasant.    As well, Aaron the GM dropped by our table, greeted us, helped the wait staff and was exceptionally cordial as we chatted about the restaurant and his career at the Wynn.  I always find it very nice when management takes a serious interest in meeting the needs of their guests.  Kudo's to Aaron and Melissa.  The food is small plate.  Everything was exceptionally tasty and other than the salmon that we were a bit disappointed in, everything from the flatbreads to the charcuterie plate to the crab lettuce wraps were wonderfully prepared and beautifully presented.  We are not real wine drinkers, but we did enjoy a nice Moscato with our meal and Aaron let me know that La Cave has the largest beer selection of any of the restaurants at the Wynn.  This alone is a reason for me to go back and enjoy some craft brews, with a charcuterie board out on the patio.  We are so happy that we finally "found" La Cave and are looking forward to going back.

kLes6w6b3p3ACzyQbs5_0g.text: Hidden gem in Vegas!  Love this place...I've been here twice now and just absolutely love the ambiance and I love the name.  I know I know..don't judge a book by it's cover...but when I first saw the name of the restaurant, it definitely lured me to come try it out.  After the first time, I really fell in love with the ambiance, especially in the patio area.  The tapas were delicious!  I especially love their flatbreads and beef carpaccio.  They also offer wine flights! which go really well with all the food.

Vd67RQjIPo1oDUY1E1nhOQ.text: The food is mediocre, definitely not worth the price. Overseasoned and all lacks a certain cohesiveness you expect tapas to have. The only dish I enjoyed was the carpaccio. Never thought to fry capers, very creative.

8KY2JDBk847N04wcaFvxQw.text: Where do I start. Intimate atmosphere, great service,  and a gastronomic treat. The highlight of our Vegas dining. A mind boggling list of wines and beers. Especially enjoyed the concept of wine "flights" where you can try four wines at a time.  Most dishes are served "tapas" style (small portions) which are great for sharing. The flatbreads are a bit larger and will easily replace two smaller plates. Recommend a flatbread and two other plates for a couple. (Leave room for desert)  The diver sea scollops were delicious. Next we had the stuffed ravioli, again delicious. The beef sirloin medallions with caramelized onion were to die for. Then we had a flatbread with cheese, onion and truffle oil. Soooo good. Should have ordered the flatbread earlier and dropped the stuffed ravioli (hard choice).   You have to leave room for desert! We had beignets (French doughnuts) with vanilla, chocolate and strawberry dipping sauces. We also had a dish with pistachio ice cream, blood orange sorbet and tropical sorbet. A perfect way to top off a fantastic meal.   For the most part, the service staff was excellent. They were very knowledgable and helpful when making selections. Perfect attention to detail. My only problem was that our hostess had tables on both ends of the restaurant. So at times it would be several minutes before she could check in on us. Had a very informative and enjoyable chat with Ralph D (manager). Asked him to convey our compliments to the chef. Highly recommended.

IUtgDhNvGxM9wwWDu-O-Jg.text: We came here for brunch on a Sunday. it is served dim sum or brazilian steakhouse style where a guy comes around with a tray of the same item and you can choose if you want it. It's a fixed price for the table-service buffet brunch of $48. all the items I tried tasted pretty good. I didn't even get to try all of them because I was so full from trying one of most things.

uGO71AJcBSjIrXk1W9aFQA.text: 3.5 stars. We had a very nice patio seating and the weather was perfect. Service was good but not attentive. We raised our concerns about the desserts that we had ordered & the floor manager took care of it immediately - which we appreciated her for. But the desserts were still a disappointment tho. Food & experience overall was just A-OK... we weren't impressed as we had hoped for.  Between the 4 of us we shared the following:  :: FOOD :: Jumbo Lump Crab Lettuce Cups  (5/5) Beef Carpaccio, Arugula, Truffle Aioli  (4/5) Grilled Shrimp  (4/5) Diver Sea Scallops  (4/5) Angus Mini Burgers  (3/5) Fontina Stuff Chicken  (3/5) Veal Pasta  (3/5) Chorizo, Italian & Andouille Sausage Flatbread  (3/5) Snapper Ceviche  (2/5)  :: DESSERTS :: Chocolate Risotto  (3/5)    - Unique. I liked it but i don't think my party members agree with me Beignets  (2/5)    - I had better elsewhere. Hate to say but it's not worth the $9. Creme Brulee (1/5)    - Looks good but it was deceiving. Had it remade twice and it still came out undercooked. The second time around they over torched the sugar & it came out pretty burnt tasting.  I'm not sure if I'll come back or not for I really wasn't super impressed by the food. But who knows... I could give it a second try. i do love tapas and it's so close to XS :D

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème Brûlée
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/13/12: Collage 2 of 2
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/13/12: Collage 1 of 2

HIBuhQQ378wA9iHwu07lRA.text: ive been here twice, once on Mothers day of 2014 and the second time for my mother's graduation brunch in 2015. The service is always fast and a bit impersonal but that's how i prefer it. I love the ambiance and the fact that the tables have a view of the High roller. The first time i came the quail egg pizza and mushroom grits were my favorite but when I returned they no longer made the pizza. The second time I went the mini sliders and the pasta with the egg cooked on top were my favorite. This place is a must try! ill be having my reception here later on this year.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. amazing and so tender
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bomb
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chorizo pizza, i believe?

UxFlqnO2vVKd_P88yB1N_A.text: I had been there several times previously for drinks and appetisers and enjoyed it very much. However on May 15, 2016, we arrived at 9:15 as that was the reservation.  Once our food arrived, we were told if we wanted desert then we had to tell them now as the kitchen was closing? Really?  How does one know if they want dessert before eating? We ordered random deserts anyway......... Our group of 6  left at 10:45. We also were not told that an automatic gratuity was added, which was fine, except we then tipped on top of the tip not knowing this....it was so dark on the patio.  Called the restaurant the next day, left information  for the managers and they never returned my call and proceeded to charge our account for the additional tip!  Not the best experience! So many amazing places in Vegas I'll now  pass on this bar/tapas joint!

ip-h365gST6zVESYwvB7vA.text: Snapper ceviche and crab lettuce cups were my favorites - both very good and something I would come back for. I've had ceviche a thousand times (well, maybe not that much but you get my drift). Theirs is different - flavorful and not overwhelming with citrus. Also had the beef filet flatbread and scallops with polenta cake, which were also good.  The best part was dessert. We had the s'mores flatbread and beignets (which come with 3 dipping sauces). Flatbread was good, but the beignets were AWESOME!  Plates are small but the price is a bit high, compared to what you'd expect at a "tapas" restaurant. Average plate price is $15 and you'd want to order 2-3 plates per person if you're having dinner. However, the quality here is heads above your typical tapas place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores flatbread and beignets with 3 dipping sauces. What?!

y1ycioRKYqGTqWabevzg_A.text: My husband and I stumbled on this gem! The restaurant has a hipper, trendier feel which we enjoyed for a change of pace. The waiters were awesome, and on top of refilling our water, which is important in Vegas! Most importantly, the food was amazing! We ordered 4 dishes since they are tapas style and had plenty to eat! Our 2 favorite dishes were the cheese and charcuterie plate as well as the bacon wrapped dates. My husband and I both got a couple drinks and our bill totaled to $120, which we were very pleased by. I also made a note to the restaurant that we were in Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday, and they gave each of us a complimentary glass of champagne. We HIGHLY recommend La Cave!

koDaY2x9xSJJakbsZW4m4Q.text: From a Celiac:  Before I was diagnosed as a True Celiac and was sick all the time, I looooved this place. Now that I can't eat gluten, this place is out of the rotation.   The cheese plate was awesome, except they don't have any gluten free crackers or bread. They did provide apple slices, but I can't eat those either.  The crab cups had very little flavor and they were really running. I had gross crab juice running down my arm.  There are no GF pizza or pasta options, and items that could be GF unnecessarily have gluten in them.   That was about all I could eat on the menu, so I just sat there while my boyfriend kept ordering little plates for himself, that he enjoyed.  For a wine bar, I would expect the wine to be the correct temperature. Our red wine came out really, really warm. Hating to do it, I added ice to the glass, but it then was like warm, watered down wine.  It is really nice that Steve Wynn has allergy menus at all of the restaurants in his properties. But when there's only 3 things in my section, it made for a quick dinner and a lot of sitting around gagging down warm wine.  My boyfriend really enjoyed his meal, so this is only for the Celiacs out there.

4RfjnTTcqYiEZ_fqumqbTw.text: My friends and I came to Las Vegas for a bachelorette party. We made reservations at La Cave but because our prior plans took a little longer than expected, we were about 10 minutes late to dinner. It was no problem though because we were seated right away. From what I saw, the restaurant is not very big but they were pretty packed. There is a bar area as well as an outside patio. This is one of those places where you order several items off the menu to share. The flatbreads were all very good (very, very thin). The margarita was too strong for me and I can usually handle stronger drinks. The salads were good, but nothing spectacular. I also ordered a side of asparagus and it was awesome. Our food didn't take long at all, our service was good, and the prices were above average.

cKQSKZ4_D8kKVyuEAs5cYA.text: Beautiful start prior to seeing Le Reve at the Wynn. Tapas style food. Ordered Caesar salad made fresh with traditional Caesar dressing made with anchovy and wrapped in Italian procetto. Paired with a fantastic flatbread that my date ordered.  Matt, our server was great. Be sure to ask him about his favs and I will definitely go back these.  They have a very large selection of wines and a full bar. Cocktails were perfect.  Prices are great for being such an upscale presence.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad wrapped procetto. Anchovy dressing.

x-DoFj02JmvaOlgCBz1POQ.text: I have to say, for how much I love almost everything that Steve Wynn touches, I was really disappointed with La Cave.  Again, I think if my expectations weren't so high for the Wynn/Encore, perhaps my review would be better - but, La Cave, in comparison to many of the other fantastic restaurants in these hotels, was a real dud.    Just a few things I'll review..we had an 8:15 reservation and even though the place was more than half empty, we still waited for our table. Our server, who seemed quite aloof couldn't offer us much help with questions about some of the plates, so I got the feeling the food, if he had ever even tried it, wasn't that impressive to him either.  Of the three plates we got, one including a flat bread - which is hard to mess up - none of them were really any good.  We all get a dish we don't love sometimes...but, for all three to miss?  Just surprising.    I will say, the wine was good and the price wasn't unreasonable - but, I do wish this had overall been a better experience.  I had been wanting to try this place for a long time.  Still glad I did....but will certainly be checking out different places in the future.

zDo3gQfZIQ4uiCK5tOEOyw.text: This is easily one of my favorite restaurants ever!  The customer service was phenomenal, the food was absolutely delicious, the atmosphere could not have been better, and the waitresses & their outfits... well you have to go and see for your self!  Food:  We ordered a variety of things including salmon, flat bread, shrimp, pasta, s'mores flat bread dessert, pinot wine flight, and a couple of beers.  It was recommended to share with the table and it was really nice having a mixture of foods - all of which were cooked to perfection. 5 out of 5  Atmosphere:  "Darker" type of environment with both a inside and outside area.  I'm personally a huge fan of this type of restaurant and thought it was visually one of the most appealing restaurants I've eaten at.  There was also a more modern music selection which made the place feel alive. 5 out of 5  Customer service:  When I originally booked the reservation they asked if there was a special reason for my visit and I let them know it was for a 30th birthday.  The person who scheduled my reservation on the phone said she would try to get us one of the nicer tables (all of which are extremely nice) which was appreciated.  Upon the day of our reservation, our flight was delayed so we had to push back the reservation time and it was done without any issue.  The waitresses and bus boys paid close attention to all tables but didn't overly show up at the table.  5 out of 5  If you are looking for a nice place to have dinner, pay an extremely reasonable price for what yo get, and a lot of fun - I HIGHLY recommend La Cave.  We will be back every time we are in Vegas!!

zyY2xHE4vf3JIQs78mH56w.text: This place was very friendly, had a team approach so that service was perfect. The food was one of our best in Vegas. Try it all - the wine flights were a hit. Strongly recommended. Try to sit in the restaurant area, the lounge area is a bit loud.

xRPlv9w31GO-gjS02lznHA.text: Pre show meal and were not disappointed.  Bucked the trend and had craft beer rather than the expensive wine choices.  Had snapper cerviche (B), Bleu and Gouda cheeses (A), the house special flatbread (B+), the shrimp with garlic and peppers and potatoes (B).  Service was good and serviceable but probably the most inattentive we had all week.

JrBdnugwrwB7J9SZ72wKYw.text: I tried La Cave for the first time on Sunday and I really like it there. I love our waitress! She was so nice, I believe her name was Lisa. We told her it was my first time in Vegas since it was my 21st birthday so she came out with a little cheese cake for me and we didnt even ask for it!   The food is kinda pricey but then again, it's vegas. Lol  I love their Angus mini burgers! Their wine is really good! I can't wait to come back when Im in town again (:

FS6xS4CJhXa37alqQ3GyFw.text: Great upscale and casual ambiance. Wonderful place to sit outside in their patio area and enjoy some wine and great tapas. Their flatbreads were delicious as were the beef and chicken tapas. I'd definitely go back! The server was not very familiar with their menu but lucky for us, everything was good.

Zyk0TZ9mAFHIh-2pvGZfxQ.text: Amazing food. Excellent wine. Very pleasant staff and atmosphere. The Grits is a must try!

_0Z3bu-3clnul2jOij4cCg.text: This may be a hip restaurant but I would warn you on the wine. They break prices down by ounces and your glass of wine could turn into a $30 charge without you even knowing. Should have gotten a soda!

0CBQGcQiuWpVhVJCtAnmpQ.text: I really likes this place it had a good atmosphere. We tried several different things charcuterie plate, chorizo flatbread and steak dish. The steak dish was over cooked but actually ok. We told the waiter after we ate that the steak was a little well done... they gave us an appetizer on the house. It is nice to see that a place actually cares what the customer thinks...hard to find in Las Vegas.

JXKBAxM1Zz2PcofEWSqltg.text: After our not so great 5 star Italian experience from the night before I wanted to go somewhere close- in our hotel. Something light, something quick, and something trendy. La Cave caught my eye right awag from the endless restaurant menus at Wynn/Encore. I thought it would be the perfect place to dine, relax and try a few things.  Fact: Michael Morton created this restaurant!  Here the breakdown:  Ahi Tuna Sashimi-pomegranite flavor, small dish, refreshing.  Thai Snapper Cevice- not impressed. It came with little taro chips, but the fish was very "whatever"  Hamachi-refreshing, but nothing special.  Jumbo Crab Lettuce Cumps- a little too watery, hard to eat, but also very light and tender  Charcuterie-amazing! I loved all the difference options of mixing and matching.  Marinated Shrimp-also pretty great!  Angus Mini Burgers- I'm not the biggest red meat fan, but these were pretty delicious and very simple! They came with roasted tomatoes!  Mushroom Grits-the favorite at the table! Even though it was a very small dish it was great for sharing! Very rich and creamy!  My friends also got the Salmon and the beet/goat cheese salad. Both came in small sizes and were perfect for a course or to share.  Overall I really enjoyed this restaurant. We sat in the lounge which had low chairs, dark atmosphere and very lively vibe! I would come back here again!!   It's also a full bar!

FfpwtZVEkx-ufCkjIRuHag.text: Oh, this review breaks my heart.  I am so disappointed.  Whoever decided to close down their wonderful little original store and move into this ridiculously tiny hovel needs to be sent to detention for the rest of the school year.  And the next seven years after that.  And perhaps a lifelong membership after that.  They've moved into a teeny, tiny little place that I'd say 85-90% of their original content is no longer there.  Gone are the cheeses and pates.  The cookbooks and the great majority of all their wine plates and trinkets.   All the charm is gone.  The wine selection is greatly diminished from what it used to be.  With everything else missing, it's lost everything that made the place great.  But I found at least one bottle of wine that I liked.  Not that it was hard to do in such a tiny little rack that now makes up their selection.  It's like a casino convenience store now.  I can only guess financial reasons, or someone in the Paris made them move, but the end result is depressing.  I can't believe that they could justify doing something so foolishly reckless to such a wonderful little place.  Changing up La Cave like this is the "New Coke" of bad brand decisions: Pointless and awful.  But Coca-Cola eventually came to their senses and went back to their original ways.  I sincerely hope La Cave will do the same.

jpIvnyMPYEuY0Ovb_yAg6A.text: Great little romantic dinner place! Good portions for a tapas menu. Try the strawberry cucumber lemonade cocktail! It's delicious.

vl8QoSF469LHXKPwxuFsJg.text: Reservations are a must - regardless of the number of people in your party. A nice place for tapas, where you can share as a group, or greedily order multiple dishes for yourself. A variety of food options, even a menu for the vegetarians. They do have a full bar which is nice, since most of the cocktails are quite sweet tasting.  The food tasted very good, and they do have some very interesting concoctions. Because it is tapas, and the menu is a bit priceier, if you're super hungry, this might not be the best place for you (try Johnny Smalls or Firefly). But if you're looking for a place with a nice ambiance, this is a nice one. They do have a beautiful patio area overlooking the pool which makes for a beautiful backdrop at the end of your meal.

OeVGBxR3FsiSKhDkJSJnyA.text: I love La Cave!  Everything from interior to food to service was outstanding.  We came here before the Phantom of the Opera and were seated in the garden area since it was a little chilly for outdoor seating.  We were in a slight rush to make the show which we explained to our server and she was very accommodating.  She was at our table frequently in case we wanted to order more, and brought our food out as soon as it was ready.  In terms of food, I highly recommend Ahi Tuna with pomegranate, ti's absolutely out of this world!  Flat-bread with tomato, mozzarella and capers was also very good.  The Truffle Tremor and Bermuda Triangle cheeses we also outstanding.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going back for more La Cave tapas!

XKr-5lgnqgxeYAvzr8r_5g.text: Beautiful outdoor patio. Fun wine flights (bold reds) and patio chairs ( try the rockers or the suspended swings). Beets and scallops were outstanding. Flatbread was just okay, but would absolutely eat here again.

yns0Oe0MoVoOQF8LDLhkqA.text: When I called 2 hrs before our reservations, they were able to accommodate a table for 8 with no hesitation!  When we arrived we had our door seats, aww pretty view, but it was way to windy, so when we asked to be seated indoors, they were able to accommodate us after about a 10 mins wait.  Great!  5 stars for that alone!   We wanted to try everything on the list, but were forewarned, each dish were very small portions.  we ordered 2.5 dishes per very 2 people, that wasn't enough for dinner.  But everything from the flat pizzas (4) to the scallop cerviche were delicious! After we all had our own desserts.  They were all very yummy.  The smores pizza was my favorite and I don't even like smores!   The pricey dishes kept us from ordering to be full.  As for flavour, it gets 6 stars, for dinner place to go when hungry it gets a 3 star.  but overall I'd rate it a 4 start place.  I'd definitely go again for dinner but make sure you had a full lunch prior.

thX8RhNUAz_3ABMgOB-9fQ.text: Amazing experience. My wife and I walked in for our 5 year anniversary, and the service and food was astounding. The staff overheard it was our anniversary and treated us with happy wishes and an unbelievable dessert. Stephanie was very accommodating and James was incredibly knowledgeable. We will definitely be back!

JyErzxNsX59cK-x5_LPueg.text: Ambience is beautiful! Food is great! We came here for a bachelorette dinner (10girls) Our waitress said it's tapas style and is good for sharing because it comes in small portions. Don't believe that! We ordered so much food thinking it was small portions and when they started bringing it out we knew we weren't gonna finish. Btw all their flatbreads are to die for. I love how there was always someone making sure your glass wasn't empty and our table wasn't cluttered. We stayed out on the balcony and the view is amazing at night. Id come back. Definitely a must in Vegas!

NERZIKAsZ_Gf3wJMFAUE3w.text: I was very much looking forward to dining here. Love the small plates concept. What a disappointment.  We ordered 5 dishes. The first four came one after another, which was fine, but then we had a gap where we were done eating and waited 20 minutes for the final dish.  No staff even around to ask. The salad dishes were good and had enough for 2 to share, but the meat dishes were very very small. Avoid the French onion soup.  Not much taste, skimpy on the onion and pastry was not done. If you do come, order a Flatbread. They looked good and you will get your money's worth.  Better yet, pick one of the other great restaurants at the Wynn

28dy0jKjaK9pgT1xGtZKGw.text: Absolutely loved this restaurant! Great service, ambiance, and the food.....amazing. Your meal comes out as it is ready. That works well for me, because I'm not a patient person. We ordered snapper, three bean salad, flat bread and several other dishes. All were absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong. Check it out!

DKIskVLe5n9cOvZ1FRK1XQ.text: This is my very favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!  I've been here numerous times (shame on me for not writing a review sooner!) and it is always a wonderful experience.  We were there for Saturday dinner and were seated on the patio.  Our reservation was a bit earlier than usual so it wasn't as crowded yet and there several large parties so that was a new experience.   One of my favorite parts of La Cave is the selection of wine flights.  I'm partial to white wine so I was excited when the selection of the Worldwide Whites had changed since my last visit.  The chenin blanc & the riesling were my favorites.    We ordered our usual favorites: bacon wrapped dates with fondue (YUM!), the three bean salad, and the mushroom grits.  These grits are what made me start liking grits--they are amazing!  In addition, we ordered the crab lettuce cups & the fontina stuffed chicken; both were great!  And, the icing on the cake was the S'Mores Flatbread--always delicious!  La Cave is always reliable--excellent food, wine & service!

wECeJslyc77OILXZ1J31Vw.text: Had another great time at La Cave last weekend.  Casual yet nice wine bar, good food, great wine list, and fun/hip crowd. We like the high top tables in the bar the best. Good people watching and vibe.  Great waitress and service. The hostess could be a bit more friendly.  This place is on our rotation for our Vegas weekends.

GlhrEY95UCTuGRgZsB-SDg.text: An unexpected delight. While out wandering around the casinos, we decided that we wanted to grab some lunch, and were sent to La Cave by the hotel concierge. What a great surprise! After having some pretty expensive and high end meals, we weren't looking for anything special, but La Cave had the best food we ate all weekend. The atmosphere at lunch time was lovely out on the patio, and a little fresh air and sunshine were much appreciated. The service was stellar.

YjhC7yFr-bpyg-ujMMh8Sg.text: Small plates = 2 to 3 plates per head.  Flatbreads are a little bigger.  Next time I would request to sit outside on the patio.  Filet flatbread was very tasty but greasy, and lamb with bacon and greens was great.  Extensive wine list and great drinks.  Vegan menu is a huge plus with losts of choices.  Mushroom tortellini and beet salad made us happy.

zDdNJkfsNyd_rhYtfPKoQQ.text: Great place to have appetizers, a light meal, drinks and socialize. Good place to go before a show.

0sPNmI7F3h1sIl2K2a1Sug.text: This review is for La Cave at the Wynn Hotel. There is also a restaurant called La Cave at the Paris hotel. Different restaurant, a bit confusing.  Back to business, La Cave at the Wynn Hotel. This is a tapas restaurant. You order a bunch of small plates and share. Everything we ordered (and we ordered a lot) was delicious. There were 5 of us and we probably ordered about 15 different small plates. Also had wine. There was also a vegan in our party, and she ordered 3 different menu items off the vegan menu (you have to ask for it but every single restaurant in the Wynn hotel has a vegan menu if you ask.)  My favorite item was the flatbread with artichokes and ricotta cheese on top. It was amazing. I don't eat meat, but the guys in our party loved the mini burgers. They wound up ordering an additional serving of those. Cheeses were phenomenal. Had to ask for more little breads to go with the brie. My sister the vegan ordered another version of the artichoke flatbread (sans cheese) which she said was phenomenal as well. She also had a beet dish that she said was very good.  Just a couple negatives. First of all, I called this restaurant a couple weeks before our trip to make reservations. I was told that since La Cave was one of the more "casual dining options" at the Wynn, they did not take reservations. Upon arriving at La Cave on the night of my 40th birthday, I was asked if we had a reservation. I told the hostess that i had called and was told i could not make a reservation. She said i must have spoken to the wrong person. She proceeded to tell me that their tables were all booked up for the night, but that she could make room for us in the lounge area. This turned out fine. I actually liked the lounge area better than the main restaurant area. A lot more light out there in the enclosed patio area. (Outdoor patio was closed due to high winds....although we saw people sitting out there even after we were told it was closed.) The only problem with the lounge area was that the tables were low and the seating is not really set up for a meal. But it worked out fine since it was a small plates/casual eating situation. I was just disappointed that when i called the phone number listed for the restaurant online, i was told one thing, then was told something different on arrival. I am so glad they had room for us since this was a birthday trip planned months in advance, and i picked La Cave out of all the other restaurants in Vegas due to their menu options that worked for everyone in the birthday party. We dropped about $1,000 at this place, and they almost lost our business. I would say they need to fix this issue asap.  One other caveat: this place is very expensive. It may be one of the more "casual" dining options at the Wynn, but not when it comes to the price. Since it is a small plates/tapas style restaurant, you have to order at least 2 plates per person to have enough food (that's why they're called "small plates.") Each plate is around $12-$20. And then there's the beverages. A glass of wine will cost you about $15. The cheapest bottle is around $65.  Also, i have to say that I wish there were some restaurants in Vegas where all the servers/waitresses/hostesses were not dressed like prostitutes. No matter where we ate throughout our stay, no matter how upscale the restaurant, without fail, all the waitresses were wearing skin tight stretchy dresses/skirts that just barely covered their private parts. Since it was my first trip to Vegas, this caught me a bit off guard. But i guess that's just Vegas. This is definitely a town set up for men. I noticed that male servers were not dressed similarly/scantily. Just the females (and most of the servers were female in all the restaurants.)

lE8_8yGfs6GWloIg-BUAfA.text: One of the best spots in Vegas. ALWAYS a GREAT vibe.  Sommelier Chloe is one of the best in town and has an eye for obscure wines. EVERYTHING is incredible. Must haves - crab lettuce cups, salmon ceviche, chorizo flatbread, lamb chops, grits (one of the best things on the menu) beets. If you don't like beets or grits , order them anyway-guaranteed you will love them. Save room for the smores flatbread. Best dessert ever.

qqjxtGsB25TvVkaO4FhCSQ.text: Amaaaaazing food! Get the cheese plate, the flat breads, and a fancy drink. Love it!

PhPvjKeHt_ZLk9cwVuxI0A.text: Nice atmosphere, waiting staff was friendly.  Food was interesting.  Some dishes I found outstanding, others plain.  Where we were seated was extremely dark were it was incredibly hard to read the menu.  I really enjoyed the small dishes allowing us to try several items.  I did feel the menu was limited.  My wife really loved the roasted beets.    I loved the spaghetti, I could have eaten a whole plate of that!   The skirt steak was nice with the little zucchinis was surprisingly yummy.  Unfortunately we had an incident when the waiter tried to refill my wine glass and spilled red wine on my white shirt.  I reassured him it wasn't the end of the world but I was disappointed after that I ended up refilling our glasses myself because no one seemed to want to approach our table after that!  Toward the end of the evening the waiter bought us dessert and a special oatmeal cookie tasting drink.

tjJY3MflC0GBvWWkHKl99g.text: This place was pretty good. They had a separate vegan/vegetarian menu which was a great bonus. The food wasn't anything extraordinary but it was a good restaurant for small plate food and drinks. Ask to seat at the outdoor patio the view is so pretty.

i4kV-7SBU5uvNg1TirrTRQ.text: Service was excellent. Food was to die for. Wines were delicious. Ambiance was very nice as well. And all this with a variety of vegan options!

YqO3Auv5gms7opZDbYZvhg.text: The atmosphere is great, the service inattentive, the bread is stale and some of the dishes lacked flavor. Desserts are uninspired.

SCfM1wG-cMfOjzweLNCRnA.text: Beautiful setting, excellent food. Make sure you check out pricing before you go but it was worth it. We had the scallops which went well with the polenta.  The salmon was very nicely done with green beans that had a tasty sauce. The truffle potatoes were heavenly.  The chicken thai flat bread was plenty and extremely tasty. The sauces they use are just delightful.  It's a dark romantic atmosphere but still okay for a small business setting.  Service was top par.  My friend did the wine flight options and enjoyed all four wines. I had a mango mojito that was the best mojito I've ever had.

D506OvbeLW6Is4HBCwcGYA.text: I was really excited to visit La Cave but I wasn't impressed.  I planned on having a party of 13 eat and drink there for my sister's bridal dinner and went back and forth with the manager regarding seating.  She claimed if we wanted to sit on the patio we had to have a set menu, which would run us about $60 per person.  Honestly, I don't have that type of money and if I did I wouldn't have spent it there.  Also, where is the patio located in this place?  The pictures online are very misleading.  We talked to the manager and wanted a large table in the back and we were told that would be fine.  We were put in the very front of the entrance in the middle of the room ( which was in between two bars).  The thing that irritates me the most is we could have just shown up and probably got a better seat with having to go through all the hassle of reserving a table.    The service was ok.  There was one lady who was actually paying attention to our table and she wasn't even our waitress (I wish I could remember her name).  On several occasions we asked for waters and the waitress said ok and never came back.  In all honesty she knew because the party was over 10 people she had a guaranteed tip included.  She was NOT worth the $91.00 tip.     The food was ok.  I wasn't wowed by anything.  The waitress said everything would come out when it's ready and at different times.  I've worked in a restaurant for 9 years and I'm sorry that's a load of crap.  It's called knowing how long things take to make and timing when to ring things in.  I'm also sure the waitress could walk over to the kitchen and let people know to bring everything out at the same time.    There are hundreds of other places to eat and drink at in Vegas.  Sadly, I will not be back.

8_80SDnxiPLfkiM6nIApfA.text: Simply put, amazing! The ambiance was very serene, modern, classy.  Service was knowledgeable. The wine and cocktail list appeared well rounded... Though the wine options seemed to start above $50 for a bottle .  We tried six small plates: hamachi with hot peppers (divine!), bacon wrapped figs w blue cheese fondue (one of the highlights of the night), butter lettuce w dates Gorgonzola and crispy prosciutto, flat bread w quail egg and fontina, and delish baked clams, and for dessert  beignets w three dipping sauces. I also tried a wine sampler of reds. It was really a nice set of tastings. A couple (if minor) weak points include that unless you stagger your orders , all of the plates come around the same one and the waiter really didn't  advise us of this.  Also I felt the dessert, while tasty, was not quite as superb as the rest of the meal.  All in all, if I were back in Vegas again, I would definitely take a second trip back to la cave among all the other excellent restaurants in Vegas.

Whe_QBSbAbiqeiq52sUutw.text: I love tapas but this was the best, great variety, everything was great.  Service A+, late night going with team at HIMSS2012 conference.  Love the bacon wrapped dates and himachi. A most in Vegas.

o1CWJ6QVt9lNNp-LTRhwcw.text: Ate here before hanging out at Surrender.  I ordered the filet flat bread, my friends - shrimp avocado flat bread, and beef tenderloin.    The flat breads were phenomenal.  Beef tenderloin was on the small portion side, but was cooked perfectly - melted in my mouth!  I originally had this marked down as a 5 star, but took one away for service.  The ladies at the front were not too nice when I asked what seats were available without reservations, and our waitress forgot the tenderloin dish.  We put in the shrimp flatbread after the initial order, and it came out before the tenderloin.  No comps for their mistakes, just an oops.

EebKheK12CBf9o1BDov7Ig.text: It was amazing! The vegan food was so delicious. The atmosphere and service was fantastic! Will be going back soon.

XlztPEYI4uCngPMEqUtk7A.text: The service is terrible and the food is average. I'm not sure what people find so interesting about this average menu.   The hostess had absolutely no clue what having a reservation means. If you make a reservation - don't plan to be seated any time soon or be told when you might be seated. And the bar is small, so you will not be able to sit and have a cocktail before dinner.   Terrible!

tEh9alZupG1XbsTkaIJD1Q.text: Wonderful food in a great setting.  My friends and I had dinner here while staying at Encore.  I did not realize that the food was tapas style so don't expect large portions.  Having said that, we all ate well without walking away feeling grody.  The waitress was extremely helpful and we opted for two dishes based on her recommendation.  My friend had the 3 bean salad.  Simple and nothing out of the ordinary, right?  Wrong...it was a great salad.  Other friend opted for a salmon dish that was expertly cooked and tasty.  I had the chicken and pasta which was also amazing.  The vibe is a casual/romantic--outdoor seating, lots of candles.

QFBur61fg_sUbO6Rp8iB1w.text: Not the experience we were looking for.  I have had this on my list of places to check out in Vegas for a couple of years.  Certainly didn't expect Sports to be blaring on multiple TVs in every room.  It was so noisy in there, we left after our appetizer.

A1jyGfAkZRO07vIMk4ds2g.text: I had high hopes for this place. Good reviews at a great hotel. The atmosphere is fantastic and the restaurant looks amazing. I would 100% come back for a drink at the bar. It was the food and the service that were not that good. I have eaten at several restaurants at the Wynn/Encore property and have never been disipointed. At any other hotel in Vegas I would have given this place 3-4 stars but a restaurant in a luxury hotel with luxury prices I expect better.

dLLfrHUutpzHdaHlDAiiqw.text: Loved the experience at the food prep bar and the four courses of food we had were all spot on. Stuck to the classic flat iron but had three other courses which were full of flavor. It's hidden and hard to find but worth it over the other restaurants!

6rISE70rgvMXMLDofm1DVA.text: This restaurant was absolutely amazing! It was elegant with just the right amount of casual for a perfect day out with the girls! Me and two of my girlfriends visited here to enjoy some wine and small plates and were truly amazed by the service. We sat out in the terrace with a beautiful view over the Wynn pool and the weather was just perfect. Out waitress, Tara, delivered exceptional service! She was warm and friendly and allowed us a sample of a couple different wines since we are terribly indecisive! Ha! Which by the way, we completely recommend the Pinot Noir, E16! We ordered a charcuterie board to split between the three of us along with the Chicken, Thai Basil Flatbread and the Cavatelli pasta. Oh, and the bacon wrapped dates were amazing! Will definitely be coming back to this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrace
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Wrapped Dates and Chicken, Thai Basil Flatbread
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cavatelli pasta

WU1oTpsKyeeDzXkG6rjP_w.text: Nice bar in the Wynn- had some good appetizers (tuna and flatbread), both tasty. Service was good and attentive, drinks were tasty. Bring your checkbook though- Wynn prices.

fjYlyEStg3ZSikvOvJKSBg.text: Dined last night at La Cave at the Wynn.  1/2 of us were Vegas locals.  Two drinks at the bar and a virgin Mojito came to $55 ! Ouch!  We had reservations,   yet they sat us at their most uncomfortable table  (of which they had quite a few of this stupid uncomfortable table in the dining room.  Not sure who the architect was for this restaurant, but what a mistake putting uncomfortable seating in a restaurant.  One of our guests was a bit late and said he overheard the hostess tell another hostess that if we complained about the table and wanted another table,  that the only table available to us would be the high top table in the front of the restaurant where the bar is.   Well,  we of course asked for a different table.   There were 3 empty nice tables ,  but they said all they had available was the high top one.  We could have left,  but decided we were too tired and hungry ,  so we sat at the hight top table.    We checked later in the dining room to see if anyone was ever seated at the other 3 empty nice tables and no,  no one was ever seated at them.   Shame on you.   Manager had come over as they knew we were not happy,  but did she even give us a free dessert in the end,   nope!   Not sure why they do not care. Sherri C. Summerlin

MIHI3379J7jcgo97I7F_Xg.text: The restaurant concept of La Cave Wine is unique and really cool. The buffet comes to you, as servers walk around with different dishes and offer them to you at your table. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated. My group was seated on the terrace, at a large table that had a view that overlooked the Wynn garden and the High Roller.  The service here is great and the waiters did a great job. It was a little hard getting some of the waiters attention but eventually we ended up getting what we were looking for! They were really knowledgeable on their wines and what paired well with the foods. We took a few of their recommendations and had absolutely no regrets!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kBv3Tb58RsX71aJggSrLhw.text: Absolutely fabulous on all respects- food, service and ambiance. Between the two of us we ordered four dishes- Crab ravioli- incredible, especially the sauce which tasted complex and citrusy Mushroom grits with truffle oil- my favorite dish of the meal. I did need a crack of fresh pepper and the server was more than happy to oblige me. Wonderful! Chorizo sausage flatbread- all flatbreads here are cooked in a stone oven and are toasty and big on flavor. Filet minon with blue cheese and truffle sauce- the filet was cooked to perfection and the dish was innovative and extremely satisfying. We got a table next to the outdoor seating area where the sun was ample and the ambiance was relaxed. After a while, they opened the french windows to include the outdoor seating area into the one next to it where we were, and it just added that special touch to an already spectacular afternoon. Can't wait to be back!

3d28WLRLnWxVnXuGdgD4Qw.text: Came here for brunch. The concept is fun. It's a buffet that comes to you. You don't have to get up and the servers just circulate with trays of food. You can also ask for specific dishes. However, I did not enjoy the food. I tried pretty much all the dishes and there was nothing I wanted seconds of.  Most of what I got I did not finish. Scrambled eggs were too dry. Benedict was also dry and didn't have enough hollandaise. The steak under the egg was under seasoned. We asked for the burgers to be well done but it came out medium.   For $48 per person, I think I would have eaten better at an actual buffet. The service was good. Unfortunately the food was not. If you are looking for a similar concept, check out the brunch at Border Grill. They don't circulate food but it's all you can eat and you order from a menu and they bring it to you. It's about the same price but the food is way better.

nxAK8VUIssOFwM3YuuI0qQ.text: Delicious small plates!! Get whatever the chef recommends!! The one thing you should know is that parts of the restaurant temperature is the same as the outside. All windows are open. It was a bit hot in there but don't let that deter you from trying out the restaurant!!

zR2SAUi0Svq7hUMQcOrUfg.text: Went to this place as suggested by concierge service but totally regret going there. The food was awful and way overpriced. I don't mind overpaying for good food but this one was just awful. We got the scallop, crab ravioli, side of beet and brussel spouts with mushroom. Every dish was tart, otherwise no other flavor to them. The worse part is our server  never came by to check in on us, not.even.once! We only saw her at the beginning when she took our orders and then when she brought the check. I would definitely not go back.

fvt6YQKOfUuMDoT-qiM6ng.text: The food was ok but over priced & portions small. We ordered four items that didn't satisfy us & one glass of wine & bill was 104.00 + tip. Service was below where it should be w/these prices. The atmosphere was very nice & I suppose this might be a good bar later but for dinner place I'd definitely skip it.

fUwzYPyVfMlFGsSPK5Yz-A.text: La Cave (pronounced La Caahve) is pretty darn good for a restaurant inside a hotel. Be prepared to open your wallet though. We went here for lunch & it was a really nice experience. Food was delicious, with the exception of the flatbread pizza thing. We got the Thai chicken basil one ($19) and it was smothered in a super sweet chili sauce. Like eating candy. Ugh. Shoulda gotten a savory one.  The crab lettuce cups ($16) were really delicious. Not too much mayo, fresh herbs, & citrus...nice complex blend of flavors & textures. DH said it was his favorite thing.  Warm Beets with goat cheese & pistachios ($12) was super tasty. It was served in a little cast iron skillet. Portion size was generous for the price. Good choice!  Hawaiian snapper with asparagus ($25) was good, but not a good value. Portion size was really tiny. Probably wouldn't order this again.  We ordered a sparkling cucumber drink. It was okay, but not special.  Overall, nice spot to eat, especially if you order correctly. Kinda pricey, but food quality is high.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Snapper with asparagus
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted beets with goat cheese &amp; pistachios

zkGVT3YmDAbB2aciSTgyGg.text: Went for Happy hour and it was perfect serving size for a quick bite. The bartender was great and paid close attention to me. I would definitely go back next time when visiting WYNN.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8OIYhQQNqs4KpvEm9vDSVw.text: Exceptional brunch!  It's delish!  A neat style of service where they bring you table side a variety of options.  You can have more of anything you like.  It's not cheap by any means but is there anything cheap in Vegas anymore?

kV-HT7XMfYdXSpt5hA6GVw.text: I went during the weekend for brunch after shopping with my son.  The hostess wasn't friendly when I questioned the menu.  Menu is set and they bring small food but a lot of different selection and you can decline eat all these different foods.  The food was absolutely spectacular.  Small but so full of taste. Expensive but worth every bite.  food server and staff again inside the restaurant not as friendly.  Place was a little dark.  I guess it is more for couples lunch but there was a table full of kids so....anyway food amazing staff could put on a smile and make the food experience more enjoyable.

oWmwtq0YeKKu5EQURAOc1Q.text: So, coming from a corporate event perspective. Venue was fantastic with floor to ceiling windows that open up for an inside / outside vibe with terrace overlooking pool area. Who doesn't enjoy fresh air in Vegas?  We were expecting 50-75 mid to high level executives and topped out at 75.   The food, venue, and most importantly, the staff, made this an exceptional event for my company that will pay dividends down the road.

ynam2niHpFsBSpuOnUv2fA.text: Amazing service  Great food  Didn't feel rushed at all Sunday brunch was off the charts

HFiie1Y496rQ-h7w0G66KQ.text: Make your reservations NOW!!   What a gem!!!  We sat on the balcony over looking the beautiful grounds and pool area of Wynn.  Dinner was amazing!! I love tapas style, so you can try a bunch of dishes.  Salad to start was so delicious. Braised short rib cooked to perfection & crab ricotta ravioli the first bite I'm already thinking I better order another order of this. YUM!!!    Service was amazing and I swear we had the best seat in the house.  We will be back as I love seasonal menu!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib cooked to perfection
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup was delicious
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet on a crostini cooked to perfection

gHDkwvFkq8oUztW9eRmsPA.text: Justin was excellent.  He knows way more about wine than anyone I've met and I'm a total wine snob.  I'm  a partner in 3 wineries and these guys know their wine.  No wonder the four seasons sends everyone here.   Tyler is also super kind and helpful.  This is the best place for a wineo in the world if not Vegas.  The four seasons concierge knows their stuff and this place is the bomb!!!

uOmmYFPtG9JW89kfuI9uoA.text: Dined before we went to a show. Exceptional service from the whole team. Really enjoyed the small plates of food, wine list by the glass and ambiance. I look forward to returning.

z_1-Hra_9vej4XGpgaIFEQ.text: Great service & very chill afternoon atmosphere. Very attentive to food allergies. Wines are amazing. Jumbo Lump Crab Lettuce Cups are so good. You almost forget you are in high energy Vegas. Mature afternoon crowd, great music, stellar service & outside tranquility. Ask for Melissa, she knows her wine & food.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside seating you forget you are in Vegas.

k_s8GyJJ3ZIeK6qrCfkKjg.text: La Cave has quickly become my wife's favorite restaurant in Vegas. The food is great and the portions are perfect. This is the type of restaurant where you will want to get several different dishes and share them among your party.  Highlights include an amazing Caesar salad with a delightful Lemon Anchovy dressing. The flatbreads are very good, we've had several different ones and I can't say which was my favorite. The Beef Filet on crostini with Blue Cheese was also excellent.  The wine and beer selection rocks and this is a really dark, but trendy spot to hang out with friends or with a romantic interest.  We will surely come back every time we come to Vegas.

pJnwcUs2cAYAy-WtsKPnIQ.text: We came here for early dinner and was seated by the back which overlook the garden/pool area. It was a chic and pretty ambiance with a group of ladies.  We ordered a variety of tapas which are new American, seafood, and few Spanish style. I like how there is a great variety of tapas and La Cave did a great job executing every dish. I dont' quite remember the exact entree but it was very enjoyable. The highlight was the flatbread (thin pizza), beef carpaccio, and the steak. I would definitely come back to try the brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nRzbfUljwZ4CrZHNo0rYNA.text: We went to La Cave for my best friend's bachelorette party dinner on a Saturday night. The girls we were with wanted a place that was not outrageously expensive but still had good food. La Cave fit the bill so I booked us reservations. It is located in the Wynn hotel and is beautifully decorated.   We started out with the bacon wrapped dates and a few flatbreads for the table. We ordered the bacon, quail egg and fontina flat bread, which was deliciousssss. Half of our table ordered the sliced sirloin steak with mushroom fondue for the main course. Everyone was raving about how delicious it was. The bride ordered the scallops and loved those as well. This was a beautiful place to have her bachelorette dinner!

oa9tkFMS3bRseqUM0lzsTA.text: Good food, great wine flight selection and interesting cocktail menu. The restaurant is very LOUD though, so if you're trying to have a conversation it can be a bit annoying to have to yell over everyone else who is also yelling. It's definitely small size tapas, so if you're super hungry, you'll need to order quite a few things to fill up. The quality was definitely good, though. I thought the scallops were a little salty for my taste, but cooked well otherwise. The ceviche was good, there just wasn't enough of it!

A63yI7s24HoBBJdHpqbCCQ.text: What a nice late night surprise after a show at the Wynn. It is a small tapas style restaurant that delivers on atmosphere, food, wine and service. The low-light and decor is intimate but at the same time is good for a group. The bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese fondue was a different twist and the crab lettuce wraps were perfect for a lighter choice. The chorizo-andouille flatbread was very good-if you don't like spicy just ask for the red pepper flakes to be left off. I enjoyed the 3 bean salad, an updated classic that was such a nice change in a salad choice. We ended the meal with a selection of 3 cheeses and a gelato sampler that was a lovely ending. They have a wide selection of wines and beer lovers will not be disappointed due to a inventory. Service was fast and helpful.

6V2bmiPBWZmvobGnUJ4n4A.text: This is a wonderful casual upscale environment.  Nice way to relax and have a few drinks.

ypvElgdpHYji4wNPLV0CSw.text: What a fantastic restaurant. I absolutely love the ambiance - dinning in a cave or sitting outside with soft candle light. The waiter was very knowledgeable and had superb recommendations. I told him what kind of wine I liked and he chose the perfect one that satisfied my palate. The food is yummy and inventive - The Charizo flatbread had a lovely crust and a perfect balance of cheese to meat to sauce ratio. The Cheese board was great with the honey and toasted bread. My only complaint was the Smores Flatbread - I was not a huge fan of the flavor and found the crust to be more pizza -like then graham cracker which was not the most welcoming flavor. It is a neat concept, just for me, needs a bit of tweaking with the consistency and flavor of the crust. All in All though a fantastic, creative, and relaxing place.

rbRblgLVJKZNLlAMC-z2tQ.text: I love Vegas, I deal with the prices of the food/booze because its Vegas.  I have eaten my way through the strip several times, and cannot believe I have never eaten here before.   We stumbled accross this delightful find by accident, they were expecting a private party but let us eat at the open kitchen bar area as long as we could eat under an hour.    I started with a Spanish wine flight with generous pours and a great selection of wines.  I then moved on to the ceasar salad wrapped in prosciutto, this was amazing.  The cut of meat was perfect...and I know my meat!  Since we were short on time we split a flatbread that had bacon and quail egg on it....oh my!!  This was amazing, bacon melted in my mouth.  The service was perfect, the atmosphere is intimate inside.  I cannot say enough nice things about the food and wine, just remember its VEGAS so prices will be high.

SsDllk-tG-x5GyzDWTORCQ.text: This place is great for large parties if everyone likes to share smaller plates. Also be aware that it can be slightly more casual, we were seated outside with lounge tables (coffee table height).  We went here for the bachelorette dinner, seating is ample, great ambience, and service is lightning fast.  I was expecting dinner to take 2 hours  especially for a large party of 10, but we were in and out in 1 hour.  Everything was good, we ordered the lamb T-bone, sirloin steak, ceviche, hamachi, andouille flatbread, but my favorites of the evening were the beef carpaccio, mushroom grits, and diver sea scallops. The beef carpaccio is AMAZING! melt in your mouth, truffle seasoned beefy deliciousness.  The grits were creamy and rich, also truffle seasoned. The diver sea scallops were fresh, large, and cooked perfectly so they were still tender and succulent.  This is the perfect place to go to get that nice stomach lining before a night on the strip that won't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sirloin steak
