Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb t-bone
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9w_EXwLqv4e49J6KB8uf7A.text: WOW! After a lengthy drive through a wind and sand storm (LA to Vegas), we were ready for some fine dining and cocktails! We made a reservation through the Open Table App for 9pm, and although we arrived a bit early, the hostess found a lovely table for us in the "lounge". Tip: If you can request seating in the lounge or outdoor patio, both dining areas seemed to be a bit nicer than the area next to the bar. You may, however, need your iphone flashlight to get a better view of the menu items, as it is quite dark (romantic vibes) in all of the dining areas. We were greeted by our server almost immediately, who provided us an extensive overview of the menu (some of her favorite plates, and also the "most popular" items). She advised that all items are intended to be shared, and come out as they are ready (instead of coming in a particular order, i.e. appetizer, then salad, then entree). As we looked over the menu and made our decisions, I ordered a dirty martini with stuffed olives, and my boyfriend ordered a craft beer. I was definitely intrigued and tempted by their wine flight selection (they have multiple options that include reds, whites, and the "Somm Selection" (2 reds, 2 whites)), but was in the mood for a cocktail as it was my first beverage of the night.  We ordered the Crispy Ahi Tuna to start, which was way more delicious than anticipated (5 semi-thick slices of high quality tuna which a crispy, thin layer of fried deliciousness). Yum! Then we indulged in the Beef Filet, Crostini, Blue Cheese, Truffle Cream (two 2 ounce cuts of tender, perfectly prepared, melt in your mouth slices). Would definitely order again. We finished the meal with a flatbread (Fiery Artichoke, Pepperoncini, Olives, Ricotta) - which was recommended by our server. A bit spicy - the ricotta was my favorite part. We would have looked over the dessert menu, but the items we ordered were quite filling! It was the perfect amount of food for us to share (and trust me, we arrived hungry...).  Although I came into the experience expecting a decent meal with above average ambiance (as there are so many great options when dining in Vegas)- I was truly impressed with our experience. The service was great (both our server and her support staff), the beverage selection was on point, the food definitely deserives 5 stars, and the ambiance dark and romantic. I left with a smile on my face, and would definitely come back, whether it's with my boyfriend or a group of girlfriends!

3pu52RV9P11h8dhwIKoulQ.text: We came for the Sunday brunch and holy hell did it deliver! I'm not one to spend $165 on breakfast for two but this felt worth it.   The brunch itself is $48 and is all you can eat. It's served butler style, which means you sit on your butt and let the pretty girls in fishnets bring you amazing dishes. We loved the cornflake crusted french toast, the pancakes, the veal short rib beef hash, the egg sandwiches, the chilled tomato shooters, the flatbread, the tater tots and the eggs benedict with filet. Now ... they also have bottomless select alcoholic beverages for the incredibly economically friendly (especially for Wynn) price of $20. These drinks include mimosas, sangrias, bloody marys, mojitos and margaritas.   The total bill was $136 and with tip it came to $165. I regret nothing and neither will you.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Sunday brunch menu. Come hungry - and thirsty!

VceaUQKFSiubC3bpmmH4cg.text: Cool atmosphere although somewhat dark inside and 2 top tables are pretty close together.  Ok wine selections- wish they had more Cali wines like la crema Chardonnay or Justin Cabernet. We ordered cake bread Chardonnay ( only available in half bottle) which of course was awesome. Wish they had the cake bread Sauvignon blanc too.  We ordered:  Gorgonzola salad (best item we had), great flavors absolutely delicious. Nice balance with prosciutto and decent portion size.  Diver scallops on top of polenta cake. Scallops were cooked well but over seasoned, polenta was under seasoned and had more of a tator tot feel to it than a polenta feel. Wasn't our fave. It's hard to put almost anything with a scallop because it's so good on its own.  Filet crostini: absolutely wonderful. Blue cheese with perfectly cooked tender filet was to die for. 2nd favorite item  Flatbread special (pulled pork, Gouda). Least favorite item. I don't think the flatbreads are quite dialed in yet. Crust was too thick, didn't taste freshly made, sauce was too sweet and overall flatbread had one note flavor. Would have liked to see thinner crust with more meat and more distinct layering of toppings instead of everything mixed together and then baked.  All staff extremely friendly and great service.

ORfcUKWSBeBGVzmX1Ekwfw.text: My company hosted an event here, and the service was impeccable! The wait staff and bartenders were spot on. They were friendly to our guests, timely, and the food was delicious. I'd highly recommend the salmon toastada. We came in a few nights before the event to eat. We sat in Brennan's section. He also assisted during the event. Give him a pat on the back. He rocked! My only hesitation is the communication/lack of humility from the general manager. He has an amazing team, and should show appreciation to them and our event planners. Otherwise, 100% excellent.

-nJbnsFjWMZ09Foz6zbdPQ.text: Amazing restaurant !!!! Great food , great menu and affordable !!! Recommend it to everybody .Server Silvia was very friendly and nice !!! I will for sure come back !!! I really enjoyed it

SkffMHq7pbms2AkGxU_CZw.text: Had 2 meals here on my last trip. The first time I sat at the bar and second one at the table. Really tasty yummy good at Vegas price. I loved the beef carpaccio and mushroom grits; both had truffle oil that made it extra delicious. We also has chicken skewer, chicken basil flat bread, crab lettuce cups. All were well made if not especially memorable.   Food came out very quickly. I would have preferred more pacing.

8ph355NSzPwcku9UieH1yQ.text: We stayed at the bar since we don't have any reservations but nevertheless the service was fast and the food is great and we enjoyed seeing the chefs prep the food we tried pretty much everything that they have on the grill menu and I was not disappointed 4 stars for this place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum wagyu skirt
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UlzSShG-2w64ZKpLolezAw.text: Very nice.   We ordered:  baby kale salad diver scallops mushroom flatbread  .... and then we decided we wanted something heavy and ordered sirloin.   Baby kale salad was actually arugula - must have run out of kale - but nonetheless, it was lovely.  Perfect amount of dressing. Crisp apples were a great complement to the greens and the dressing.   Scallops were prefect.  Perfectly seasoned (just salt), with a good amount of butter and seared to perfection. Well done. The pollenta was too salty, but it had a great creamy texture.   Mushroom flatbread w ricotta was great.   Sirloin - nice cut but overcooked.  The waitress did not ask our preference for cooking [would have been medium rare] and we found this medium cooked sirloin too dry.  But I don't regret getting it; the presentation was great and its accompaniments were excellent.

XLgchHCbUdBWL82p4c57GA.text: Wow!!! The food was great, wait staff was great, and the atmosphere was great.  We had such a great time, and great meal.  I love the tapas style of the menu.  The bacon wrapped dates, Shrimp with Shishito Peppers and Crispy Garlic, and the crab ravioli were my favorite.  My wife had a flight of champagne which was a pretty cool idea.  I love this place.

m95n2YaQBWusKUs5qdBVrg.text: This restaurant was suggested to me by a friend.    We were seated half way between the outdoor patio and the interior.  The restaurant is sexy and dark....hard to read your menu dark, but that's ok.  The vibe is lounge, with an extraordinary wine list.  Everything on the menu looks amazing.  It was hard to choose, but we finally settled on the sausage flatbread, pesto cream pasta and the hamachi.  All were incredible, flavorful and fresh.  I was surprised how spicy and perfect the flatbread was, only because pizza crust can be tricky at a restaurant that isn't really a pizza place.  We skipped dessert, so I can't comment on that.  Service started great.  As the night went on, the server became more absent and we finally had to stop a random waiter to get the check.  I plan on coming back.  For drinks or dinner, it's a great place to go with a group or a date.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zdTGzA6CaizwOfKEbQ1aOg.text: Have to say there have been only 2 times in the USA we have had a wow,..good food experience coupled with staff that where wonderful.  Charley Palmer at South Coast PLaza was the 1st   La Cave at the Wynn is the 2nd.  We had a meal that was stunning as well as excellent.  Take your whiny big portion attitude and hit the road - please.  Small services,...wonderful seating, great food,..  We had so much fun eating the food we did not order any wine,..but we sat next to the wine cellar and it was well stocked.  Had bacon wrapped dates with a blue cheese fondue,..yes i know what u r thinking - so I was,..but holy freekn amazing,..the different flavors of the three items was stunning.  We then had the Ahi,....ahhhhh ahi,.. still one of my fave foods to eat when done well,..this was - with some pom and a vinigrette and basil oil.  wonderful  Then we had this flat bread with very delicious canadian bacon and quail eggs,..yeah i know,....but seriously -- this flat bread dish was really really really good,..I could see having a wonderful brut champagne - and just this flat bread,..my gawd it was to die for,...I am not going to add quail egg to my regular dishes at home.  Last dish we had was thin sliced sirloin with baby mushrooms and stuff, Yes it was good and tasted like it was supposed to,...but of all my dishes it was my least fav,...we did go through almost 2 liters of sparkling water - again ,..well chilled and they kept my glass full at all times.  Now,..for those who like a drink,... and who are demanding on a well made drink,..and none of that crap stuff,..  I ordered a standard mojito - it we well muddled,..and perfectly mixed,..and it was a good sized glass too,,..lordy I hate those served in a micro tom collins glass or something,,..this was served well with sugar cane and plenty of mint and lime,..the way it is supposed to be.  I did not take pictures of the food here as it was soo perfect and wonderful that i expect you to go in and enjoy this place before everyone else knows about it and it becomes a reservation only place,..  We ate at around 7 pm and the line was slow - but by 8:30 the place was packed. Packed - crazy packed.  Loved the place,..the staff and the food as well as the seating,...yeah the chair was so special - lol seriously a great seat in a resturant is one of my high points --nothing sucks more than a chair u cant wait to get out of.  Okay I talked enough,,,get ur ass to La Cave - Hurry before it is too late.

RVSg-sgRUkAct2xst5HBAQ.text: Maybe because it was brunch, but the butler passed food just wasn't that great.  Lots of greasy breakfast items.  Lacked sophistication and the food felt overly simplified.  For example just serving bacon strips in a cup - they didn't wrap it and do anything to it that warranted a chef to create.  Sliders, scrambled eggs, tomato-mozzarella caprese, yogurt parfait ... Same thing.  They were all too dumbed down.  Why pay so much for something assembled rather than chef inspired.  Only a couple dishes were more complex like the short rib with eggs and flatbread.  But really, is flatbread that exotic these days?  For the most part, it felt like cafeteria food in a nice setting and served at the table.  Maybe the fact that it was the only restaurant at the Wynn on a Sunday morning with no line and plenty of seats.   That should've told us something.  Live and learn.

6U__rjKuLXgWXDQl2u01Hg.text: This hidden gem at the Wynn is great!!   Very tasty small plates and a great selection of wine and beer!   Perfect for a light snack or lunch exploring some different flavors!!   It is poolside at the Wynn and feature open air or even outside patio dining!

fFpg4hgc8EEjhZ7OEDzfRg.text: This is a really nice new place at the Wynn. Has a fun and cozy atmosphere for small group gatherings to come for happy hour/drinks and little tapas/snacks to share. The plates are all pretty small so definitely do family style. They also have a sommelier and a great wine selection so take advantage of that too if you like wining and dining.   Out of the small plates, my favorite has got to be the sliders. They were so delicious! The flatbread pizzas were good too, esp the ones with the quail eggs, which was very interesting and first time seeing that on a pizza. The hamachi was also good as well. The desserts were also super delicious, with the chocolate toffee covered donut ice cream bars and chocolate mousse!   Because the restaurant is pretty small, there could be a wait, esp if you want to go to the bar area and chill. But I definitely recommend this place esp if you're staying at the Wynn!

N8koQaEH99m_EQEbipXrYQ.text: We went here after seeing La Reve.  Unfortunately we were sat next to a table of very drunk people (who were loud & started putting their used plates on our table).  It wasn't the restaurants fault these people were so obnoxious, but it impacted our feelings about La Cave.  We had the mini Angus burgers, meatballs, steak & mushroom flatbread and a couple of Pinot Noir wine flights.    The mini burgers were excellent (I would recommend getting the chipotle mayo on the side - the chipotle is really strong (and I like Chipotle!))  The flatbread was decent.  The meatballs were good, but the burgers were the star.  I might go back to this place if I could pick a table away from any obnoxious drunk people (maybe when the weather is better sitting on the patio is nice?)

k0xyAICwv4-NWLY3IK1GKQ.text: scallops - 5 stars service - 5 stars flatbread - 3.5 stars salad - 3 stars chocolate cake - 4 stars

9hEpBv8Wpsw6pOX0qY23Gg.text: Finally I find another gem. This place is classy and casual. Our waitress, Lisa, was very attentive. Food was excellent, simple not over powering. The price is reasonable but remember it's tapas style so you'll get little bites so it's fun to share with a group of friends. Nothing bad I can say about the place. For four of us we end up ordering six dishes bill was about $80  If I get to do it again I wouldn't order beef cappachio very small portion... the classic way is to lay thinly slice of beef flat, a little dressing, and choice of micro green. This way there are plenty of raw meat ( 16 - 28 slices on a plate). The best one I had was at Chaya in Beverly Hill. La Cave only served four thinly slices, rolled up with sauce.   You should order:  Crab lettuce wrap Angus beef slider Pizza with quail eggs on it Belgium beer.

qdQBb2o4jHwuB9e8nbLSEw.text: This place is awesome for one reason. They have these great wine label keepers that actually work extremely well to take off the labels from wine bottles so you can keep the labels after you drink the wine and dispose of the bottle!   I have yet to see this neat and nifty little invention come across in most of the Napa shops and boutiques I've been to and even some of the wineries I've visited so I was pleasantly surprised to find it at this quaint Las Vegas little shop.  I've always been a great fan of Paris in general because I LOVE the casino, but their shops are now beginning to offer me something very unique that I can't find anywhere else!

lym5bu2gdAec_lOFn2Xesg.text: Maybe I went to a different place than everyone else, but after all the rave reviews, I was disappointed.  I felt like I was trapped at a really bad country club somewhere in the midwest.   We were going to see the Phantom, and wanted a snack before the play, but not a full meal, so we chose the Cave. From the moment we approached the hostess, the place felt awkward.  Our hostess could not find a table, and sent for a fellow worker, who checked the rooms, but could not locate a table.  Several people just walked in past us, which was curious, then another hostess arrived, who said maybe we could sit on the patio.  Fine, it had been too cold and windy to sit there all day, but would we like to sit there?   Sounds, er, great. We were led through three rooms, each with several empty tables seats amid the sparrows on a small outdoor balcony overlooking people being told to leave the pool, because it was too cold.  I sat shiverring in my faux fur vest, happy I had dressed for the cold Phantom theater. The waitress was very nice, and our orders arrived prompty.  Tapas is my new obsession, so I was delighted with the selection, but the dates were a bit overdone, and the chicken rolls were also dry.  The most fun I had was feeding the little sparrows who darted about delightedly.   I would give the place another try another day.

YWnbUHJAqFQWux2wXRx2jA.text: Love love love. Came here for Easter dinner. Exquisite food sampling a with a phenomenal selection of beer and wine and pristinely warm and attentive service. I will surely be back.

HOSu15Xv-4-U3ZyXGgS3qA.text: I came here for Sunday brunch expecting to be wowed. I was wowed by how disappointing it was. After letting our waiter know we wanted to do the a la carte brunch it took about 10 minutes to get our first dish even though the table two from us and the large party in the center had been served at least 3 times during that time. I saw our waiter direct him to us. That should have been our sign to bail. It was that way the remainder of our time there. At one point we had a couple seated next to us so I thought perhaps we would finally receive some attention but sadly we were alternatively ignored. It's not good when your customers are sitting there long enough without food to talk about how bad service is. Needless to say, I won't be back especially since nothing we were served was spectacular.

DsQuKeZJSf3TbS3JcUp2wQ.text: Went to La Cave for lunch on Friday.  They were not busy at all and we can pick and choose where to sit.  The decor is beautiful and the patio area is just fabulous.  They offer wine flights that features 5 kinds of wines in each flight and the cost ranges from $20-$35.  You don't get a lot of each wine though so they probably add up to a little more than a glass of wine.   The waiter came over and told us that their food is tapas and sharing style and the portions are small so you'd need about 2-3 dishes per person.  HE LIED.  The portions are good size actually.  Depends on what you order, say the flat bread pizza is enough to feed one person, and so is the pasta.   The food itself is very tasty and nicely prepared though.  We ordered a side of truffled fries ($5) and it's the yummiest fries I've ever had.  Their shaved ham with quail egg pizza ($18) is also fantastic.  Not sure if it's good enough for me to return given so many great restaurants in Vegas, but it was an enjoyable meal for sure.

ufWe6xOqs8Koweo_rA6xzw.text: Did someone say tapas?!  Yummm... this place was really really good. If you're not obsessed with tapas you'd probably give it five stars. It's a great place to go if you've never had them. They had some traditional ones (dates wrapped in bacon; but they added a twist with a side of blue cheese fondue which I was surprisingly happy about) and they have some new age ones (crab filled lettuce wraps; soooooo good. I devoured them like they were my last meal on earth and didn't care who was watching. Judge me people, judge me!)   We also ordered the angus burgers (nothing special, but good), and prosciutto and arugula flatbread (too die for, the saltiness was so satisfying) and a bottle of wine.  The decor was awesome. Try and sit in the back; they have romantic lounge styled sitting. Too fun!  Our server was really nice and cute, BUT girl... you gotta come back and keep pouring the wine into our glasses if you want to follow proper restaurant etiquette. I mean common... you know how it goes... the faster/more I drink the drunker/stupider I'm going to be when I over-tip you... Common girl. You know better than that.

iTRlmEemWtvShnF4B3CU3A.text: Excellent experience on 3 out of the 4 nights we dined here.    They have an excellent cheese list, delightful salads and awesome steak!  Especially enjoyed the sirloin and filet.  This is a great place for an extended business dinner or a romantic evening on the patio.

GD9GjSOKdrSAJnEI588F2w.text: I really enjoyed this place and would recommend if asked about places to go in Vegas.  It is intimate and unique.  There are 3 sections:  You walk into a round low ceilinged bar area with some seating, then you walk back further there is a high ceiling dining room with wine all the way up to the top, then to the right there is a lounge room with couches, weird furniture and a beautiful view out large wall of windows.  We sat in the lounge on a comfy couch.  The lighting is all candlelit.  The lounge reminds me slightly of a less ostentatious Parker Palm Springs.  Menu is small plates with a few larger entrees.  Portions are very small, but food is delicious. (bacon dates, beet salad, cheese and charcuterie plates, etc.) They aren't calling it a gastropub, but it is.    The have a large artisan beer selection and tons of wine.  Even the pricey highly specialized enomatic wines.  The vibe with soft reggae and jazz with some bass with the atmosphere was awesome.  I was thinking the lounge would be a perfect place to snuggle, smooch and nosh with a love, but unfortunately I was with my mom, oh well ;)

1gpDOUxXmnQ36heBSkHsig.text: I came here with a friend during her birthday weekend. We thought it was absolutely delicious! We had the veal short rib cavatelli pasta, the bacon and quail egg flatbread, the scallops and the Beignets. The cavatelli pasta was our favorite!!! It was to DIE for and melted in your mouth. The only negative thing was the size. It was pretty small but also very rich that a larger portion might have been overkill. The flatbreads were a great sharing portion. And the bacon quail egg was a great combo! The scallops were ok, nothing memorable, though they were nice and large. And the beignets lacked flavor. We should've gotten the crem brulee, though I heard mixed reviews with the mint thrown in. The other great thing is the price. Very, very affordable for Vegas. PLUS great location in the Wynn. Nice spot to hit up before you head out to XS, Surrender, or Tryst!

DN_HxuCfI61OOxnbarkD4g.text: Came here with 8 other girls for a friend's birthday. Needless to say, we tried pretty much everything on the menu - and was VERY PLEASED! Our server, Matt, was also extremely attentive, funny and quick! The service overall here was very quick - even though we had 9 girls, we were out of there easily in 1.5 hours.   Some of my favorites however include (but note, there really wasn't anything that I disliked):  * hamachi with jalapenos - SO refreshing & crisp! (small portion) * crab/lobster lettuce wrap * flatbreads - both the artichoke & the bacon/egg were delicious * bacon wrapped dates   All in (including tax & tip), ended up being $60 / person (this is excluding alcohol).  They also have various wine flights (4) available ranging from $15-25.

1gto7k7Kbu4SYqNyGwyFpg.text: Absolutely divine. I've eaten a lot of beet salads in the last year - it seems to be on every small-plate and farm-to-table restaurant menu nowadays - but this was the best. Served warm!  We also got a flatbread, scallops and shrimp - all delicious. Got the French wine flight, which was very good. Expensive? Yes, but not the most overpriced restaurant in Vegas.  And like every other place at the Wynn, top-notch service.   Unfortunately the patio was closed that evening so we couldn't check that out.

aBb-tlQ-t4cq2fkB7PJ-Vw.text: Literally sitting in the restaurant right now. Never yelped before but the service here is so terrible that I think I will pop that cherry. Bitchy hostesses quote us an 30 mins when there are 15 open tables, "not enough servers" they say. Well we get a terrible table, ask to move to 5 others and are told no. We steal a couch spot not even cleaned yet and wait another 30 for 1 drink and another 30 for tiney tiny food. Which is delicious by the way. Cost benefit analysis... Might be worth it ;)

6DLL3rYcpL7kqTURlozksg.text: My favorite place in the Wynn!  the atmosphere is very cool.  Our waitress was incredibly friendly, quick and very helpful!  We had the sliders and a steak dish - both which were delicious.  Our bottle of wine - a Syrah - was incredibly tasty.

CQBfaeKf-nyOxezK4bcA9Q.text: We were a group of 8 Las Vegas locals celebrating a friend's birthday.. our first impression was great we had some drinks at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable and nice we were seated at one of the best tables in the restaurant. My whole group would agree that once seated we were disapointed with the service from our waiter he suggested the Chef's Tasting menu($45each) due to the size of our party we all thought that was reasonable but one of the members of our group has a food allergy to mushrooms and 3 of the six items contained mushrooms, when asked to substitute our waiter acted offended and told them "to eat around the mushrooms". We opted out of the tasting menu after the comment was made and ordered some delicious items like the Crab Lettuce Wraps, Pesto Pasta, Asparagus with egg, Flat Breads and other items. The service improved with the evening sadly once they realized we would possibly be repeat customers and after talking to the sommelier about the waiters personality . The bill was over $850 for tapas, dessert, cava toast and wine(2 @bottles at $70each). Overall the food was good and the atmosphere was great.

DzuFhy5z6ehoJRZYBkoM4Q.text: I couldn't pull the trigger on a 5th star because I am a little unsure how much of an effect the alcohol had on the deliciousness of this meal. Regardless, La Cave is a big time winner in my book. I ate a late lunch here with my brother and we were seated on the outside patio with a nice view of the pool and since it was a beautiful day in Vegas, this was a nice touch. Everything on the menu sounded quite good, but there are definitely two must try's, the angus mini burgers and the prosciutto flatbread, while both were great, the angus mini burgers were outstanding and completely melted in your mouth... those are a dish that I have since craved and will order again when I return to Vegas next month. We also had a salad and the jumbo lump crab lettuce cups and those were also quite good, but if we could have substituted two more orders of the mini burgers for those two dishes, we would have done it in a second. The service was very good and the atmosphere was lively and La Cave seems like the perfect place for a lunch before or after a day at the Encore Beach Club.

8mu2xEzxkktIP1CmJcfz1A.text: We went here a couple of times for a late afternoon glass of wine and snack.  We sat outside on one occasion and sat at the bar on another occasion.  Service was pleasant and efficient.  We found the ambiance and experience to be relaxing and a nice way to pass some time and have a light bite.  There were lots of interesting wine selections by the glass.  We would visit again.

naYyaZ31cIOCwxJGi74IiQ.text: I give this joint 1 star for cool architecture. It was horrid service and the food was even more of a let down.  We had the bacon wrapped dates, (which are far better and half the price at Firefly) and crab lettuce cups that were foul. Not to mention the bread was stale... Huge letdown.  Keep walking down the hall there at Wynn to The Country Club.

bt38FhBXF8N9KogOCvvTKQ.text: The ambiance is beautiful.  I'm told (by the pro I was with) that the wine list is quite good.  The food was so-so.  Had the tomato flat bread (turned out to be pizza) - not very good, the prosciutto wrapped stuffed chicken - meh.  But the snapper ceviche was AWESOME and I would go back just for that.

3QU_FZgr5j97V9-58C4KXw.text: Loved the room and atmosphere; loved the casual menu and prices were good; great service -- very friendly and casual; ALL the food was dynamite -- most of our group are big foodies - everyone had something different - every dish was a taste sensation.

j3Zymk-TkPG-t5w9VSDRng.text: I love love love this place..i would give 5 stars but the service - like all las vegas restaurants - is lacking. we had the stuffed chicken (OMG, delicious!!), the bacon wrapped dates - which is an interesting concept but not so yummy, the chicken rigatoni - must have, the marinated shrimp - eh.. not so great, and the mini burgers which weren't WOW either. the dessert is so so so yummy - i love the caramel peanut butter bars (which are two giant lollipops) and the chocolate cake was sooo yummy. i love the outdoor patio and the ambiance. overall a must to visit at least once in vegas. interesting menu, great wine selection, and yummy dessert. all this for $150 (+ a bottle of prosecco)

9YXTvVcFUyl8d8BMNkReGw.text: went here for my moms birthday, service was good and the food was excellent.

eBSWgDQQzNAnvGhF8Bc3fA.text: I was in town for three days in January and a bit embarrassed that I ate at this wonderful gem 5 times.....ya...I did say I was a bit embarrassed. With so many amazing options to choose from in Vegas I chose the same place ? I used to live and work in Vegas so i do know the city fairly well despite its changing scene. The wine list speaks for its self. Amazing and affordable. The food was spot on. I believe I ate through what felt like most of the menu. I must admit that the kitchen did have a bit of smoke rolling out from the hoods when they cooked ....but this was just part of the show and aI quickly got over it. The staff seemed down to earth. I dined alone each time, so for them to come over and "check up on me" in a very sincere way was a nice touch. Each time I looked around the packed room and happen to make eye contact with a staff member, they said hello. Something being from Chicago myself, I'm used to  but not used to seeing in Vegas. The chef (I saw his name and picture on my TV screen in my room) delivered my food! Nice touch. The room , food and service seems very down to earth, giving me and it a comfortable vibe with character. Something I don't find in Vegas all the time. I loved it. Unfortunately I will not being staying at Wynn my next planned visit this spring. But I will def go back to get those bacon wrapped dates !

UoBNXCFSWE0JxFhvHbGzfA.text: Service was great, food was excellent, and drinks were oooo lala!  The only dishes I really did not like was  Ahi Tuna, Pomegranate, Basil Oil-the pomegranate over powered everything and was horrible  Rigatoni Pasta, Grilled Chicken, Basil Cream-came in this lil cute pot, but the pasta was not cooked all the way and the grilled chicken pieces were too big. we gave this back to the kitchen  What I LOVED:  Thai Snapper Ceviche, Asian Pear, Habanero-really fresh  Crispy Wonton Salmon Sashimi, Avocado, Sesame Soy Dressing-just like a realllllly amazing nacho  Sunny Side Organic Egg, Jamon Serrano, Asparagus-i don't usually order stuff with eggs, but this was good. the toast was a lil hard  Chef's Selection~Nueske's Bacon, Poached Quail Egg, Fontina Flatbread -the most amazing flat bread I ever had. This was sooooooooooooooo good I can just only eat this. Must order more stuff with eggs from now on. I LOVE this dish so much  Sliced Sirloin Steak, Mushroom Fondue, Cippolini Onions-great mushroom sauce and cooked perfectly  Diver Sea Scallops, Polenta Cake, Shrimp Sauce-EXCELLENT!

fqzgSKseFwLjy1jbsf7oIw.text: Went here for dinner! It's worth it to order two plates, because the portions can be quite small! The ambiance is nice and the food is super flavorful!   Of course it's pricey, but it's Las Vegas. The drinks are strong and the food is delicious!

hH62tPKEVs59GheFJ5Wx2Q.text: Was staying at the Mirage with some friends and while I like the Mirage as a hotel, the food isn't fantastic, so we wanted to go somewhere a little fancier without breaking the bank before we went out. Because of Yelp reviews, we ended up at La Cave. We got right in at around 8 pm on a Saturday night. A lot of the dishes are tapas style, so we each got a small salad and a few things to share. I got the gorgonzola salad and it was AWESOME. The cheese combined with prosciutto was fantastic! I thought it was going to be super small but it was a pretty decent size. We got a couple flatbreads to share - the tomato, mozz and caper and the artichoke, roasted pepper and olives. I wouldn't LOVED the tomato and mozz but the capers kind of threw it off for me. The drinks are also pretty yummy. Four of us probably spent $40 bucks each, which for a trendier place in Vegas is pretty darn good. Would definitely come back.

ZvlgkL23ni6MKhpIoBTKRg.text: Small casual room with an upscale cave like atmosphere; as you might expect.  Good service; decent wine list, good food - not inspired in nature, but well executed.  Portions are quite small by any tapas standard.  Not a particularly big eater, but if you think about what you need to order to feel reasonably satisfied the price of your meal quickly shoots up to a range where you could for the same price go to a more upscale restaurant and leave more satisfied.  So although the food is good, if I compare to comparably priced alternatives I would rate La Cave below average.

cS7l0-eg2k3Rj-0LFUS_dQ.text: Went for an early dinner the day after Xmas and really enjoyed the two flatbreads that we shared (one with steak and blue cheese and the other with quail egg and pancetta).  Service once we were seated was very good as well.  We opted to sit at the counter next to the display kitchen.  This turned out great for us, as the chef in charge of the flatbreads noticed that one of the ones intended for us was instead delivered to another table.  He quickly let us know that he was making us another one while passing a complimentary plate of bacon-wrapped figs around the partition.  Really above and beyond the level of service I normally expect at LV hotel restaurants, even at a hotel like the Wynn.  One complaint was with the hostess.  We stopped in early (no reservation) when the place was nearly empty and noted that we just wanted to grab a quick round of drinks and appetizers.  Before seating us, she went through this whole process of getting our full names and whether we were staying at the hotel.  Struck me as completely unnecessary and rather ridiculous - they should really do away with it.

vsJb6d01KTw7BHvovoTRXQ.text: I was not impressed by La Cave at all. They had my favourite wine (Joh. Jos. Prum) which is = to a * on its own. but they only had it by the half bottle so that's loss of 1/2 *. The service was mediocre at best.  The food sounded like it was going to amazing and flavorful but most of it was very bland, the only exception being the beef carpacio which was amazing.   Food Ahi Tuna- tasteless Thai Snapper Ceviche- bland Angus Mini burgers-  not enough sauce too much meat Beef Carpaccio- phenomenal  repeat- nope

shot8_IE1qrGO76RcayPfA.text: La Cave can be loud n crowded especially if younare seated in the cellar area. However, while the menu may not be extensive, this may be the best tapas/small plates restaurant in town. Portions were significantly larger than what we had at Julian Serrano the night before.  The salads were excellent, with perfect amount of tossed dressing. The flatbreads here are tops in town besting those at Olives.  The cavatelli pasta with short rib was amaZing,  maybe best pasta I've ever had anywhere. That good. But the real star is the Smores flatbread dessert. Un effen real. Cocktails were solid and cappuccinos were served piping hot. This places delivers a lively atmosphere and phenomenal food. We ll be back.

9jpJu_RsXTyZJBHQaE6w2A.text: What a beautiful hideaway. Great ambiance. It was our first experience here and it was ok. Our server Ralph was mediocre considering it is a 4 star establishment. Knowing that it was our first time there he didn't really take the time to explain all the menus that were given to us or take the time to suggest any of the popular dishes. We ordered the charcuterie board my husband asked the runner for a different bread options and he told us he would check with the chef. As he walked away we asked Ralph if there was a alternative option besides the bread chips they gave us and he said NO. Well there was! Just laziness if you ask me. Not trying to accommodate us and guess what? The restaurant was empty. He had prob 3 tables max. The food was amazing though. Good eats and good price. The only time we saw a manager was when he quickly came by the table to take the check book and cash us out. Didn't even take the time to ask us how everything was....fine dinning at its finest! Would come back....just not excited about the service!

Y55g91IwxYHapWpkyV5yTg.text: Went here with some friends for Sunday brunch. The food was fantastic, but the service was really lacking. I'm not sure what the issue was -- they weren't busy at all, but just trying to get refills on coffee was way too difficult for this caliber of restaurant. It also took them 20 minutes and asking several times for someone to come and take out drink order.  All in all the food was great but the service was not up to par for this level of a restaurant.

oAvcAsg-gtzUNFC9VvPAOg.text: I run the risk of my one regret in life being I didn't eat at more 'small plate' places.  Beyond the obvious brilliance of being able to share, I love to try many different things, particularly at a new place.  La Cave is small plates, and it is great.  On to the food in a minute, but I have to relate my wife's experience.  She has several food allergies and sensitivities, including gluten, and we typically get mixed reactions when we ask what they recommend.  The chef at La Cave went above and beyond.  After a little bit of back and forth on what could be done with our server, we got the message "the chef would like to do something special for you".  We agreed, and he came out to talk with us after we ordered.  Extremely friendly, extremely attentive, great service.  The topper was the food they brought, which was simple, expertly prepared, and absolutely delicious.  My wife had a version of the Salt-Roasted Beets (which may have been the best beets I've ever had) and a version of the Grilled Shrimp (which she thought was the best shrimp she's had) and some terrific grilled Asparagas.  Did I mention absolutely delicious?   I also had the Bacon-wrapped Dates with Bleu Cheese Fondue and the Ham, Egg and Cheese Flatbread (with quail eggs).  The Dates were fantastic, and the flatbread quite good (and a bit rich).  The food was so hot when served I took notice - it felt like they took it off the grill to our table in just a few seconds.  In a couple square miles of many, many food options, La Cave was worth repeating on a single trip.  And the service put them over the top.  I wish I could go back right now.  I've written myself hungry.

EkUH9eLGE4-hrDMJRHyq6Q.text: Food was good, environment not the coolest of restaurants in Vegas, I guess kudos go for being the only non-Wynn concept within the resort complex.  They kind of stopped coming around after a while and I probably would've eaten a few bites more.  Although that was probably a good idea as I would have eaten too much otherwise!

hpDJmh3WdEq-s7v6WrFNLQ.text: I've had tapas here before and loved it but I just experienced brunch for the first time. The selections were fantastic and you don't have to stand in line to try things. They actually bring the food to you and you can select what you'd like. They were very accommodating to any changes in the items that you requested. And the price was extremely reasonable for what you got.

R9Ly2wminKu4I2YDvK7d-Q.text: We have visited the Wynn/Encore three times now and it is always a delight.  La Cave is new for our third visit and we were knocked out satisfied.  In fact, La Cave is the ONLY restaurant we ever visited twice in the same Las Vegas vacation. Our server, Beverly, was delightful.  Very knowledgeable and helpful, but not pushy.  The three meat flatbread was fresh, well prepared and presented on a neat cutting board.  My wife is still talking about the wonderful charcuterie appetizer. On the second visit we tried several other tapas and were very satisfied.  The beef selection had a great taste, along with the blue cheese topping that is!

NdDOa4CP6CR3cbABbec7LA.text: I don't know if I fell into one of those cases where my expectations were just too high, but I wasn't a fan. I expected a great dining experience considering the reviews on here, and the price, but the dishes were hit or miss. The ambiance was nice, but I wouldn't recommend this place.  Hits:  The cheese sauce for the bacon wrapped dates was really good, making it different The sirloin dish was delicious, especially the onion and mushrooms  Misses: The flat bread was pizza...not what we were expecting for a Spanish inspired restaurant The ahi tuna was bland and nothing special

cOUMOhGXclOjL4rLUif5RA.text: A lovely spot with delicious small plates and totally unfriendly, indifferent service.  Three of us sat at the bar (where only one other guest was sitting) and still struggled to get the bartender's attention throughout our meal - to acknowledge us upon arrival, to order drinks, to get said drinks, to order food, to ask for anything. . . though he was great at refilling my water at the end of our meal oddly enough. Maybe you'll have better luck at a table.

L7jvM8aRLSY32VRuf6mbzg.text: What a great little place! Husband and I came here for our anniversary. Got a table where we could watch the chef's in action. Great wine selection, and great tapas. We ordered a few and then ended up getting a few more. We probably should've ordered a few meat tapas earlier on. Those portions were HUGE!   Regardless, would go back in a heartbeat.

p1LnmzYHMAAhENXou_giSg.text: Very delicious. Very intimate. Very fun. A bit pricey for what you get, but if you're looking to splurge a little or impress, definitely the place to consider. It's good for dates because the portions are decent so you get to taste some yummy food without getting full. Nice glass of wine or two and you'll be enjoying everything else as well.  The highlight of our meal was definitely the pizza with chorizo. I could have ordered 3 more of them and kept eating because it was that good. Service was attentive and polite. They screwed up our wine order and sent it to the table next to us, but the staff quickly cleared things up and I was enjoying my nice warm buzz by the end.  We were fortunate enough to sit right in front of the kitchen, so we got to see how hard the chefs work to get the food out. It's like sitting at a bar, but with the kitchen cooking right in front of us as we ate. I got to say, they work hard. It was also great to see that they took the affair of cooking seriously and were concentrating on producing a great meal every time.   Overall, a great experience. The food is thoughtful and creative. The flavors are, in my estimation, meant to be paired with wine. Even if they're not, definitely get a glass because the food and wine definitely complement each other.

ZrNOKXa8F_iqjOlcgtI52g.text: Multum in Parvo... that's what the sign says above the hostess stand.  I asked her what that means and she didn't know.  Then she asked the manager and (s)he didn't know.  Google tells me it means "much in little".  That's how everything is served.  Little dishes for sharing.  The wifey and I came here because I read an article about Mr. Morton's little creation in the Continental magazine.  I was excited about trying out his new joint however, La Cave let me down.  The food was not spectacular.  The wines by the glass were ok.  There are other places on the strip where you can spend the same amount of money and get better dishes.    We tried the following dishes and I have rated them from best to least tasting: raclette cheese and potatoes,  ahi tuna,  mushroom risotto and  the tomato mozzarella and caper pizza.

WggcHF2ODOXscH96iTO7qQ.text: Great vibe in here. The scallops on crispy fried rice were enormous. This should be your first dish if you enjoy seafood. The ceviche is great,too. Unfortunately, it's served with crisps that are latticed, so the ceviche drips on your hands once placed in the crisp. The Thai flavored flatbread is large and tasty. It comes with too much sauce squirted as a topping - I would request it light on the sauce.

m8PGm9UhqSheuqT5o3nZVw.text: I guess the prices are what they are because it's at the Wynn? The food was good, but a little overpriced IMO, even for tapas. It was $13 for 4 small bacon-wrapped dates. The rest of what we ordered was pretty good and fairly priced. The pesto pasta was delicious! The flatbread was filling and definitely tasty. I forget the name of the one we got, but it had artichokes and ricotta cheese...yummm!! I would definitely go back for the flatbread!

rvNgM_Nocsvdz8WdDelrjQ.text: This wasn't on my radar before our trip, but friends who were down at the same time had tried it the night before and wanted to go back. The small plates format is always great because it allows you to try several different things. Everything we had was great. It's also slightly less expensive than some of the other Encore/Wynn restaurants, but yet the food is still excellent and great quality. I was pleasantly surprised and do recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JFEoX2GToxQ29xVW11m8Qw.text: Probably one of the best places we ate at in Vegas. The food and service were awesome and the view is amazing too. The flights of wine were just as good. We did four small plates but could have been filled just ordering two plates for two people but we were glad to try them all.

Mjj9cpEQLVyCXU5OZXLpBw.text: Enjoyed the lounge/bar like atmosphere and delicious tapa dishes here!  The service was excellent as well!  This is truly one of those places that you can't go wrong with 80% of the menu.    Some of my favorites here are: Salmon Sashimi Tostada, Avocado, Sesame Soy Dressing - 15 Fiery Artichoke, Roasted Pepper, Olives Flatbread - 16 Beef Filet, Crostini, Blue Cheese - 20  Their hours: Monday-Thursday, noon-11 pm, and Friday-Sunday, noon-midnight.  Reservation is highly recommended.  Self parking and valet services are available

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef filet flat bread.
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan flat bread.
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood oven for the delicious flatbreads.

TWMELDkdZfk6GzyQR0ZLzA.text: There are places where you know you are going to have a good meal just by the tone of the people that greet you, I have to say the people at Shibuya could really take a lesson on this from La Cave, a friendly greeting and even though it was the Wynn, no stuck up we are better than you as was found at Shibuya.  Anyways, the important stuff, the food.  I will be honest,there were 10 of us, we ordered the menu pretty much, everything, yes everything was great, it's rare (as you will know if you've read my reviews) for me not to have a negative about one thing, this is one of those places.  There were a couple of standout dishes.  The jumbo lump crab lettuce rolls......OMG, a perfectly balanced crab dish The star of the night and maybe the best dish I have eaten this year.....  The Bacon and Egg Fettuccine, Prosciutto Sunny Side Egg    If you get to eat one dish in Vegas, make it this, my taste buds loved me for this dish.  Great service, the total bill was not bad considering the amount of food and wine ordered (less than the following night at Giada) the only negative, hence the 4 instead of 5 stars, the diet coke remained empty for lengths of time, I know it sounds stupid, but a glass of diet coke cost the restaurant a penny, there is no reason for it to sit empty, especially considering the service was good.

geoYLG6vMz6sFSdZn9NbnQ.text: Love that they had vegetarian and vegan options. Overall the food was just ok. The service was excellent and atmosphere was nice.

gwuhXW_gBWAtKzrTxc6fug.text: Really loved this place! I love tapas style eating because you get a chance to try more than one thing. Went here on a Thursday night while in Vegas and we really fell in love with the cool decor. The wait staff was very friendly as well.  We started off with some apps... Chorizo and sausage flatbread: Delicious! Filet and blue cheese flatbread: Also delicious Thai-Basil chicken flatbread: Great but not if you don't like sweet and spicy together- as one in our party mentioned. Salmon sashimi tostada: Very good  For our "main course" we got the Angus mini burgers, beef filet with blue cheese crostini and the sea scallops. All were fantastic with the scallops being the favorite.   Definately will be going back to La Cave!

7keW-YhD-Fwx4AxHS27NIQ.text: One of the best cheese plates we've ever had! Our server gave us great recommendations and details on the various meats/cheeses. Loved the flight of bubblies and the scallop small plate. Will definitely come back next time we are in town.

bmhiabGKa-Ugjqi0DEJCSA.text: 2 words...BEEF CARPACCIO!!!  Truly one of the best things I have ever eaten!  If I had to choose a last meal, la Cave's beef carpaccio would be part of it for sure!  The amazing flavor of the beef, the truffle aioli, capers, arugula...orgasmic! The restaurant itself is so chic and funky...such a contrast to all the slots and table games.  I love the atmosphere and every single thing I have eaten here has been on point.  I would also recommend the salt roasted beets with whipped goat cheese and pistachios...heavenly!

WqERp_2Vszp-ZUL-IKeuEg.text: This is not La Cave. It's La Cah-ve.  HAHAHAHA.  Me (on the phone): Hi, I'd like to make a reservation for La Cave. Girl: You mean, La Caaahve? Me: *embarrassed" Oh, yes, that's what I meant. Sorry. (boyfriend breaks out into hysterical laughter, mocking me) Me: (to the bf) Shut up! If you're so smart, YOU make the reservation next time!!! Girl: ... Me: (to the girl) Oh, sorry! I wasn't talking to you! Girl: That's okay. (boyfriend going into convulsive fits) Girl: Let me check on that.  I'm put on hold  Me: (to the bf) You're such an... Girl: Hello? Me: @$$hole!!!  (realizing I just shouted @$$hole at the girl on the phone) OMG, I'm so sorry!!!  I was talking to someone else. (boyfriend roflhao)  AHHHHHH!!!  Worst and most embarrassing conversation EVER!!!!  Luckily, my experience at the restaurant was much better.   The short rib capellini is TO DIE FOR!!!  I could have eaten tubs of this for days. I want to learn how to make this so I can have it at my disposal at all times!!  The bacon wrapped dates were large and had substantial pieces of thick bacon, but there was no cheese inside, and I didn't notice the bleu cheese dipping sauce until the last piece. :(  The ahi tuna tartar was lovely, but waaaay too small for the price. It's three small pieces.  The beef flatbread was awesome and a great value. I would order this for sure. It's not only delicious, but it will be the largest portion of your meal.   The stuffed chicken was highly disappointing. It was dry and lacking in flavor. Unfortunately, this was the last thing we ordered.  The space is intimate but cozy. The lights are dim, so it's difficult for older people to see the menu. Be sure to bring your glasses. Lol. It's a great place to sit in one of the swinging seats or lounge areas and enjoy a quiet evening.

eRmEY_ltv50A_rcB9SWGmg.text: Loved the wine flights and the sliders were some of the best sliders I've ever had!! Such a nice romantic ambiance! Can't wait to go back in the summer and sit outdoors in the patio! Ps. I had requested on OpenTable for our desert to have my boyfriends and I's names and they did just that! Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine flights
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our delicious desert! Loved this place. Can&#39;t wait to go back in the summer and sit in the outside patio!

DNS2ZQ2IDvV_z_kqYV5vLg.text: Superb. The best Sunday brunch in Vegas.   We have dined here numerous times. Each and every time we leave so satisfied and in somewhat of a 'food coma'.   Our favorite is the Sunday brunch butler service. Cannot say enough good things about this - it is a must do, even if dining solo.

9JlGvEXVKkHmdWmItZ7WnA.text: Dinner with wife and friends, Monday 3/23/2015 7pm.  Not sure, but I think we might have got a better table because we looked like the type of group to review a place. There were already a bunch of people there (older crowd) and we ended up getting the best table on the patio overlooking the pool.  The good: Tapas like plates, many were basic, so if you have people in your party that don't go out of the box, this might be for them as much as you. A few different civeche's which were really good, and great selection of different dishes. Mushroom grits were a big hit.  The meh: Limited drink menu, boring cocktails, maybe the wine was better, but we're not wine drinkers. Some dishes were way too basic, the sliders at $15, thats a lot for three basic little burgers.  Conclusion: It was good, not terribly expensive, but not cheap either. I'd recommend it as one of the places you go in the area, but not my top pick.

6rz_WmU3KcoWF-IvyUU4WQ.text: The hotel and casino are absolutely gorgeous and the reviews for La Cave were great so we were psyched to dine there. However, the meal and the service, in particular, were very disappointing. My husband and I both enjoy tapas style dining because the dishes are usually well seasoned and we can eat a variety of interesting foods. Of the four dishes we ordered, only one wowed us and that was the steak filet. The other 3 were ordinary and not special in any way, the recommended dates wrapped in bacon were not good.  The worst part was the service. Our primary waitress talked so fast that we needed her to repeat everything 2 or 3 times. Then a second waitress was trying to buss the dishes and wine glasses before we had finished eating and drinking from them. We managed to prevent her from taking anything we still wanted and I finally told her we were being rushed - it wasn't as if we were lingering over anything or that there weren't empty tables about. After that, the first waitress returned and pointedly asked if she could remove something every time - not sure if she was being sarcastic or just officious. We skipped dessert not wanting to press our luck.  The atmosphere was OK, a little noisy, tables close together, and dark with many hard surfaces and not enough sound absorbing materials in use. That was the least of our issues and in some ways it could be considered attractive but it in no way compared to the rest of the Wynne.

sU2k3LrHBRzunS9OtASAyw.text: So let's be honest: the girls working at the front of the restaurant are the reason most people give La Cave a second glance. In a city well known for scantily clad women, La Cave still manages to outdo itself.  And, oh yeah ... the restaurant.  The almost-tapas style menu means that you're going to order a lot of finger food style dishes that are tasty. How exactly they come together as a meal depends on whether you carefully select each dish or simply order a smorgasbord ... but either way, the food was delicious, if not pricey. But this is Vegas, after all.  And did I mention the girls who greet you at the front of the restaurant?

6fTP_P7Q1S0_KMV4fjk4Ig.text: We decided to stop in to La Cave for a small early dinner before our red eye flight back east.  We chose this spot because I read that they did small plates and it seemed somewhat tapas style.  While the place certainly isn't Spanish tapas, but they did have a nice mix to choose from.  We went with the 3 meat and 3 cheese board for about $35.  Upon first impression I thought this was insanely expensive, but in reality they gave us a ton of meat and cheese.  It ended up being a full meal for the two of us plus a smores pizza for dessert (amazing).  Drink wise, they were expensive but on par for Vegas.  As for the decor, I thought it was a pretty cool looking restaurant.  The back room was dark and definitely set up to host small or large parties.  They also had a nice covered back deck area to eat outside.  It was a little too warm for the outside when we went, but I could see that being a good place to hang.  As for the service, it was a little slow in the beginning, but our waitress was very nice.

lPGyZDi-p76nxc33_6InBg.text: I can't believe I haven't review this place!  And it is a very special restaurant for me/us, the day we celebrated our pre-maui and mexico trip back in 2014 in March. And we just recently went there last week before seeing the new show at Encore Theater, Showstoppers.   This are just few of their delish treats that we salivated:  Fiery Artichoke, Roasted Pepper, Olives Flatbread Chorizo, Italian & Andouille Sausage Flatbread Mixed Greens oven-roasted tomatoes, grilled onions, shaved goat cheese Sliced Sirloin Steak And their wine selection are quite a stellar.    HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

RYtasG9UTdbOvRA5ewSJNw.text: Grits!... order them period.   This review is long overdue since i have been back here many times for so many different reasons. La Cave is considered the food & wine hideaway and it kind of fits the feel when walking in past the entry cave where they have high tables to enjoy a glass of wine or appetizers and then past this to pen up to a formal style dining room complete with a gorgeous patio that opens up to a gorgeous night. The feel is a little more upbeat and hip with music playing and a diverse setup of tables and chairs to chose from to sit at. If you have the option try to find yourself sitting on the patio with a good glass of wine.   I have had  Grits - Oh God... thats all but eat while hot and dont be shy and let them get cold because its such a waste.  Filet and caramelized onion flatbread with blue cheese - A very nice combination of ingredients on a very generous sized flat bread. If you are a blue cheese lover then this is a must.  Bacon wrapped dates - A great stater and these are winner on many tapas menus but from here happen to be my favorite (far better than firefly) Sea scallops - Although these were well prepared i can say that i could pass on these. Then again i am not a scallop guy so if you love scallops then you may like more than i.  Beef filet crostini - The biggest surprise of the menu for me, so simple yet so delicious and so well put together. I could eat just this all night with the right glass of wine.   Chloe is the sommelier here and is good at what she does. Ask for her assistance with your wine and she will not disappoint with something from their extensive list. Her smile and appreciation for her customers aids in a terrific dining experience. Actually the entire staff here has always been attentive and welcoming as ill continue to return for excellent meals deep into the future.

lHEHLhPVsP30FwalrugWdA.text: I really wanted to love this place... hmmph oh wells my search continues for a nice hideaway.   Food:  Sliced Sirloin Steak: 2/5 Our waitress continuously reminded my table when we ordered our food would come out the order it was made. We said that's fine but when I got my order the sauce was very cold and so was the cut. BUT the plate was definitely heated, I ended up getting it sent back and the chef offered a free desert and his apologies.  Veal: 4/5 was very hard to slice through, maybe it was my knife but I swear it was definitely but it was very delicious, soaked in a pomegranate reduction, on top of a bed of veggies.  Chefs selection Thai Sweet Basil Flat bread: 4/5 very delicious, not too sweet and the flat bread was very soft yet also crispy.   Desert: 4/5 S more's Flat bread courtesy of the Chef for sending out a cold order of sliced sirloin Steak. It was very delicious. I love the dough they use for their flat breads. Very soft and it complimented the chocolate well.    Wine: 4/5 $70 bottle of La Sala Chianti Classico $70, Great Wine, very light and refreshing. I thought buying a bottle would've been a better deal than buying mutilple wines by the glass. Happy we picked this bottle.  Service: 2/5 Personally I think our waitress just forgot about us. She mixed up our order and forgot to order our desert. Well at least she had the balls to come over and apologize that she forgot and the chef offered a free desert.   Ambiance: 4/5 Great atmosphere, I loved the decor. Very modern, dimmed lighting, if you get seat on the patio they have big windows over looking the wynn garden or the waterfall. Very elegant.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores flat bread yumm!
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AC6w3k43MlHzQd7fr0dJ-A.text: This is my favorite place at the Wynn. It's their secret winner. Their flatbread--pizzas, basically--are great. So are the bacon-wrapped dates and nightly specials. White sangria = bliss.  Beignets (donut-hole variety) for dessert.   We went twice this past trip. The only minor complaint was being seated in the bigger, outer room our second visit (perhaps there was a party going on?). The low seats/banquette were cute but oh, so uncomfortable.   La Cave is one of the main reasons I like the Wynn.

Tsio3I0hcZtAv5hw3QkPjw.text: The food here is so amazing! Small tapas style plates to share.  We sat outside and had a view of the pool.  I will go back every time in in Vegas!

pwXpIMPi0qvUA1rPCdiMiw.text: Hands down, the best dish we had here was the crab ravioli. All the dishes are very small. Three ravioli. But perfect. Also had a meatball with grits,which was ok but wouldn't have been my first choice. A lot of dishes came with truffle, and we are not big fans, so our choices were a bit limited. The beignets were also delicious. Our meal was pretty expensive for what we received size wise, but the quality was top notch. Atmosphere is dark and cozy. Tables are pretty tightly packed.

EzDhFd_X0MYIpbRg6oqU5Q.text: This place is a hidden gem for tapas style food. The staff here are awesome super friendly and extremely attentive. They have a large gluten free menu and most items on the menu can be prepared gluten free, you just have to ask. The food was excellent I can't say I had a dish that I'd say I would not order again. Everything was made fresh to order and I loved watching make it at the open kitchen. I recommend ordering three tapas plates per person since I feel even for tapas the portions are on the small side. The only negative about this establishment is that there are TVs all over the place any it takes away from the beautiful ambiance and decor. In my opinion the TVs cheapen the vibe here and should be removed.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Binet
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice selection of wine by the bottle
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeonous Jumbo Lump Crab Lettuce Cups

boqvTfFu25bOMp57zTduRQ.text: Went here for a belated birthday/last unhealthy hurrah dinner. My husband and I are currently obsessed with tapas bars. We have very different tastes in food so if you are like us, this is the place for you. All the portions are small plates and they are arranged by type of food on the menu. If you are adverse to seafood, like my husband, you can just avoid that section of the menu entirely. You order things as you go and eat them as they come out. A very casual way to dine. But at La Cave, the environment is more elevated. A great contrast in my opinion.   We sat on the patio, which was a bit chilly this time of the year. But once the heaters were on it was lovely. You have a nice view of the courtyard and part of the pool area. If you prefer to sit inside they have a room that is entirely windows so you can pretend you like the outdoors without actually having to endure them. Win/win.   The service was amazing, but this is a Vegas restaurant in the Wynn, I would expect nothing less.   The food was delicious. I loved everything I tried. Some of my "must orders" are the truffle mushroom grits, the beet and burrata salad, and the Mexican street corn flatbread. Yes it is better than it sounds.   Their wine list is a book, so if you love wine from all over creation, this is the place for you. They also have a variety of flights, which is fun.   I definitely recommend this place. The atmosphere as well as the food is perfect for a quiet date night, or a fancy friend's night out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the patio
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata, beets and arugula salad
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican street corn flatbread

d0Hw8u7T_J5TldT4zPrhHQ.text: Wow. I don't know where to begin. I'm astonished at the good reviews this place has. The one thing that I can fully applaud is the allergen menu.  So while staying at the Wynn on our honeymoon we decided this would be our last Vegas meal before heading home. We ordered the browned butter sage gnocchi, bean and avocado salad, and tomato and mozzarella flat bread. Overall the food had ZERO flavor. I am unsure if they even have salt or pepper shakers in the kitchen, there were none on the table. Typically the lack of salt and pepper on the table is indicative of a good meal perfectly seasoned to come. NOPE.The gnocchi was sweet. Like dessert sweet. Even disgustingly sweet for a dessert. The gnocchi portion was rather pathetic with a whopping 10 gnocchi for $18. The flatbread completely lacked flavor. It was just canned tomatoes thrown onto a very basic pizza dough with tiny lumps of mozzarella and capers scattered over the top. The bean and avocado salad was a generous portion but had less avocado in it than a 6" subway sub. It was 50% fried garbanzo beans which became overwhelming. The ice wine vinegarette was not even detectable.  The service was good but we left there feeling exceptionally dissatisfied and wishing we'd just gone to White Castle.

ZulKT6ZuGWga04b1sImtgQ.text: My wife and I visited here on our last visit to Las Vegas.  We came for a light dinner before our show, Le Reve, at the Wynn.  The service was solid and the ambiance was nice; as to be expected for the Wynn Hotel.  The prices were high, also to be expected at the Wynn.    We ordered some wine and a couple small plates, as this was the concept.  I'm usually hesitant on small plates, as they just give you a smaller portion, yet still charge you for an entree portion.  It seems to be the trend in the Northwest and west coast, as well as a lot of the bigger cities.    For our food, we had the scallop ceviche to start with, which was very good!  We then tried the French onion soup that was solid; it was served with puff pastry o top that was perfectly browned and crispy.  Then we decided to try the crab lettuce wraps, which were probably the only weak choice we made.  The waiter recommended them, but we weren't impressed.  They were just lump crab meat with a mayo based sauce that was very bland.    Over all it was a nice dinner, but would never pay those prices if I wasn't in Las Vegas.  It's really sad how overpriced it's become...

qli2LyguPTbXXSw2ppQfPw.text: Nice and casual Wynn hotel option for brunch or any meal. Overlooking the Wynn Tower pool, we dropped in for brunch. I don't recall if an a la carte option was available while at brunch but their format worked fine for us.   There is a set menu of items that come out to tables, almost dim sum style. That is, they bring a plate of fresh, easy bite items that you can have or pass on. The ones we tried were very good and options did come back around in case you miss something or want more of a specific item.  I imagine you can ask for something to come back too although we didn't. I believe this cost $45 per person. There was also a bottomless mimosa option for $29 along with other cocktail choices. All said, a good start to the morning and trip.

9n2IuRO-RmYjosnqm_44vw.text: ***CAUTION**** If you are planning on using resort food & beverage credit or comp this restaurant, you will be in for a shock!!! Neither La Cave, nor Ciprianis's, nor Urth Cafe are managed by The Wynn - and you will pay for it yourself!!! Not that anyone tells you this beforehand! You are certainly welcome to charge your meals here to your room, but will NOT be covered when you settle your bill! The Wynn even lists all of these restaurants in their Wynn restaurant guide - and the restaurant doesn't clue you in either. This feels like bait & switch! Aside from that, $45 per person for a limited selection of breakfast nibbles at Sunday brunch didn't even cover coffee or juice - which was a la carte! Too expensive- choose the buffet instead - it can be comped.

3mceANchg99Fgmf_Fl-RDA.text: Beautiful place! For my surprise, I have never noticed before even I come to Vegas 2-3 times per year.  I came here to have a fast bite before check in, and totally loved the experience. All places in Wynn and Encore are top notch including La Cave.  I ordered crispy tuna and flatbread- both came fast and were delicious!  Plus, the servers and front lady were welcoming, smiley and professional!  I would like to come back to try something more.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AJ4IjIt5I-_rhsmUd4BLow.text: This place is amazing. It has been for years and just does not disappoint. During the winter they put a wall up where there would be an outdoor pool view, which makes it feel a little more closed in, but during the summer it feels like a huge patio! Now the salads and pizzas here are unreal, which is what they are known for! However, this past time I went, I decided to try a few other things and man my mouth is watering thinking about it all over again! The short rib tacos are a MUST. The service was relatively good, but they were packed during lunch time which could be the reason for this. Our waitress was very honest about what she did and did not like which was great. However, all the waitresses were dressed very skimpy in cocktail waitress attire as if they were on a casino floor which was a little off putting just because it did not quite make sense for a nice restaurant! The lighting is a bit dark in the winter, but great during the summer. At night, the whole place is really dark, but still well worth your time. It is tapas style so everything is made to share, and the prices are very reasonable- especially for being a restaurant at the Wynn. Such a must try!

HaCPrP6QviYDkPEtAo_6gg.text: OK, so I went to a private event here, and I must say the service was fantastic. The catering menu was excellent. I can't speak for the regular restaurant, but if you are thinking of having a private event here. By all means do it. Top shelf all the way around! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

IDlyQn3MfKFAebBaURJSJA.text: This so my third time at this restaurant and I love this place and every experience that I have had here. Our waitress, Shaundra, was wonderful! She had a smile on her face the whole time and all of the things we had questions about she answered. Great job!!! The food was wonderful and the dessert was brilliant. My friends and I can't wait to come back our next trip to LA.

CQB4DqDkKJjcwtOyBKPrqA.text: This restaurant was beautiful and relaxed! All the food was mouth watering and wine was delicious. What we loved the most was the atmosphere and the staff!! Everyone was so friendly and attentive. Our waiter Matt was super friendly. Thanks for the great dinner!!!

jrdIaSm3jaXzgPAbo-6ijg.text: Amazing low key restaurant hidden gem in big bad Las Vegas awesome food and wine totally worth the trip

v-TuGixPLA4bPu6FPaz0-w.text: This was a great choice in Vegas.  We enjoyed all that we ate, the service was great, some interesting people-watching...  Just a solid choice!

xGUzHnt2A12Fg2N4x4ZoAA.text: One of my favorites! Incredible wine list, friendly staff, gorgeous restaurant. Mushroom Grits are fantastic, short rib flat bread is perfection, bacon wrapped dates will bring you back they're so good. Right inside Wynn but once in restaurant or on patio doesn't at all feel like you're inside a casino. One of the best Vegas has to offer.

U0Q0hAUaHbs1TZJ7uWhwzw.text: This is our all time favorite. The wine selection is excellent and so is the service. We love coming here. Our server Shondra was amazing. We both had the wine flights. You can choose from preset options or you can mix and match. We had the chorizo flatbread and the chicken Thai flatbread. The chorizo one was better. The Thai chicken was too sweet.
