Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

13J6tOcAbMAd5TZSr0Z5Xw.text: As a Frenchman, I rarely expect to be blown away by the food in the US.   This is one of the rare cases where I was blown away by the food, service and the location.   For the location, we sat on the terrace, on a large table (a group of 6), with a view on the internal garden of Wynn, Venetian, and the High Roller. All lighting in the night, the view was magnificent and blended/contrasted amazingly with the internal decoration of the restaurant, made in the style of an old European cellar.  Next, for the service - it was timely, diligent and the wine advisor suggesting pairings of foods with wines was competent and on point.   Now, the last, but definitely not the least - the food. It was amazing. I've never tried a skirt steak that good. Sauce, cooking, and taste - all blended to an experience of a steak I have not experienced even in France, let alone in the US. Combined with the side dish of asparagus and other vegetable blends, the meal overall was absolutely amazing and definitely worth the price charged.  I couldn't recommend this place more. If there was a six-star option of Yelp, that would definitely be a candidate for such a grade.

b1bvr3GC5nm4lgOxEIzodQ.text: This review is for Sunday BRUNCH:  We were sat outside at a table right under the sun. It was 105 degrees outside! I'm disappointed that we were not asked if we preferred inside or outside seating. I did ask for a different table and we were placed at a table that was in the shade on the other side of the same hall with a table that was no higher than our knees when we were sitting in chairs. Not a good thing if you're tall and most certainly not conducive for eating.  The good:  -fruit salad yummy -yogurt parfait yummy -small tomato puree soup yummy -heirloom tomato mozzarella caprese yummy ( two slices of tomatoes and one slice of mozzarella yet easy on balsamic!) -tomato mozzarella caprese flatbread( you get a very small piece so ask for a few if you like it) -scrambled eggs good - bacon good -angus mini burgers good (as per my friend, as I cannot eat mayonnaise and it already comes with mayonnaise with no option to ask for it without mayonnaise) -French toast with corn flakes good  The bad or not that great: -sausage disappointing -tater tots with gravy were not that great -veal short rib hash disappointing -pancakes were small and looked pitiful, not that great as supposed to have Snickers in it... no Snickers to be found! -waffle with cinnamon and apple very average. -mushroom truffle grits more cream than grits and underseasoned, as well as way too heavy. -bacon and egg flatbread was with ham, not bacon, and just ok - I was so looking forward to the lox and bagel, yet the bagels tasted stale. I was disappointed.  -coffee way too strong. I only tried half of one small cup, and left it there. It tasted more like an espresso.  - we had to ask for pastries and cookies, and for the quality, we might as well have bought them at Albertson's, your local supermarket. Not at all impressed. My friend called it a blast of sugar with no other flavor.   Never saw or got in time:  -La cave egg sandwich (they came by an hour and fifteen minutes later with these yet we lost our appetite by then!) -filet mignon with eggs Benedict ( came by one hour and a half later since our arrival!) This is what we were eager to try, and we could not believe that it was actually served an hour and a half after we got there and after we had eaten whatever we actually liked.   - waiter only asked, after 50 minutes of being there, what we still wanted to try. After telling him, 20 minutes later still nothing came out... we only asked for lox with bagel and French toast. -the table beside us had some lady taking pictures and they were bringing all the dishes to her table. The dishes looked flawless, and they do not look like that when they get to you. We were officially chopped liver, because that is the impression we were left with.   -There were one to three persons coming out with small dishes from the kitchen and they go from table to table and those dishes go fast with only a limited number at a time which is not enough to go around for all tables... what's worse, they do not have any more of that dish that your table did not get any of, as the kitchen only made a few and the other tables already grabbed them, and the kitchen is now making a fresh batch so it will be a while!!!  - The only thing that salvaged this restaurant from getting one star instead of three is that the manager was kind enough to be apologetic and even offered me his card, requesting that I call and make another reservation. Despite him being very kind, I am not interested in coming back. As a local and a hard-working professional, I do not have time to sit there and do nothing even when it's leisure. I am there because I'm hungry. This is not a place to come to if your hungry yet rather a place to come in order to waste your money and socialize. I also appreciated that the manager only charged us for one person rather than both, which was very appropriate for the amount of food that we did not eat, either because it never came or we didn't like it so we didn't eat it.   -I would have rather seen this be a buffet. I'm sure the restaurant would not agree, but I think it would have made a lot more sense. Overall, very disappointing experience and I do not plan on coming back nor recommending it to friends. Way too many other amazing places for brunch in Las Vegas that have better food and better service and overall just better experience.  -I did also know that the larger the party  or table was, the more attention they got and all food seemed to go their way first.  Tip: if you valet and spend over $50, have them validate your parking ticket so no parking fee  Sad... I have been here for dinner in the past and it was very good. I cannot say the same of brunch.

WloCMQQsvCuiXZpN-czSjA.text: This place was great! So great we almost came back a 2nd time, 2 days later.   I've been wanting to try La Cave since they opened but there has never been enough time or hunger to fit it in.   The ambiance here is akin to a dark, sexy underground bar in NYC. Something totally different than what you normally find in Vegas.  One thing that stood out was the full bar behind us!  They only provided us with a food & wine menu so I thought they didn't serve cocktails.. until I turned around & saw a full bar.  Everything here is tapas which was great since we weren't too hungry to begin with.  Standouts include the short ribs as well as the sea scallops on polenta & the beet & burrata salad. There were a bunch of other items that looked great so I'm sure I will be back on my next trip.

NPT758tKMyMop3eXchuSlA.text: We went for brunch on Sunday morning and weren't sure what to expect.  Let me say, the atmosphere is phenomenal! We sat on the patio overlooking a garden area on one side and the pool on the other. The weather was great, but the food was even better! So good that I didn't even get any pictures.

MPIbbPaJlS7A-pTD9xK-xA.text: I love La Cave! I went here for lunch and split a few appetizers with my family. We shared a few flat breads which were delicious. The wine was great as well. We sat outside and had a view of the Wynn pool. Service was excellent too. I look forward to going back!

CAzl7nSlLQFHDqY4QT8tDQ.text: Genevieve the manager has no customer service skills and even gave me an attitude because I complained about my over well done hamburger. Like it was my fault they over cooked it. Her manager needs ti retrained her.

HYyfYoLWH7W1zbd_DCRMnQ.text: Had wine and a few bites to eat here. Wines by the glass were limited and not very good. Overpriced. Food was ok to good. Had the mini burgers and chicken skewers. I thought they were mediocre but my husband thought they were ok but overpriced. Service was pretty good and we were seated at a nice table with a pretty nice view. There are better places for happy hour with better food and better prices, especially at the Venetian and Caesars.

57_FAr5V9C_asV0MKoWwdA.text: I was really disappointed in this place. I was so excited to try it, because as a vegan there aren't that many fancy restaurants to get excited about. So going on a business trip to Vegas meant that I go to try a Wynn restaurant (he went vegan and so all of his establishments now have vegan options). I went with some omnivores, and a friend who has a gluten allergy. On paper, this place was perfect-- fun and fancy for a night out, small plates so we can try a couple things each, and gluten-free, vegan, veg, and omnivore menus. My group was pretty large, maybe a dozen of us, and they seemed really flummoxed by that. They didn't want us each to place individual orders- they wanted us to order only things we wanted to share with the whole table. This just doesn't make sense for a restaurant that is catering to multiple kinds of diets. After a little bit of arguing with the waitress, she did let us all order our own things, but she told us not to expect them to come out at the same time. This meant that some people got two small plates before others even got one plate. And they forgot some of our drink orders, so we had to flag them down, which took a ridiculously long time given that they weren't very busy. And on top of that- all the food was disappointing- the omnis, the vegan, and the gluten-free-- all not exciting or worth the price really.   So I would try another Wynn restaurant if I am back in Vegas, but not this one.

VVOEsxDEsz8UR8Dgjqo9QA.text: Love this little hideaway!  Doesn't look very inviting from the outside, but if you venture through the entrance, you'll find a cozy "bar" that overlooks the chefs that make the exquisite flat bread masterpieces - my favorite item on the menu is the Beef Filet, Caramelized Onions, Mushrooms, Blue Cheese Flatbread.  You definitely have to be a fan of Blue Cheese to truly appreciate it.. wash it down with a fun flight of wine and you can't go wrong.  Did I mention it was pretty reasonably priced?

Slw086aR4Tpw81Od_JAYcA.text: We ate at several restaurants in The Wynn and this was my favorite.  I made reservations the day before and had no problem getting the time I requested.  The day of the reservation I had to change the time, and again, no problem.  I was impressed by the decor when we walked in, it is like a little restaurant in Venice.  We were seated by the 'lake', the lighting was perfect, and the acoustics make for good conversation.  We ordered a bottle of French wine, a Gran Cru from Volnay.  The Sommelier came straight away with the bottle and appropriate glasses.  He was very knowledgable about the region, and also friendly without being too chatty.  We ordered a cheese and meat plate to compliment our delicious wine, which it did perfectly.  We only had appetizers as we were heading to a show and would be dining out later.  I regret that choice!  I wish we would have had our meal at The Cave!  The menu was full of good choices that I could pronounce and had some familiarity with.  I will definitely be back.

aEHNhLMGsDnUgmxE2GWO3w.text: 1 good natured waiter, 12 dishes times 2, and several wine flights later we were 9 happy girls! Food was awesome - felt kind of familiar but new at the same time. Thoroughly enjoyed our pre-XS bday celebration dinner here!

pawOovicqvaqXcfPRzceYA.text: My friends and I actually like this place.  Not a huge fan of the Wynn since everything is over priced. But this restaurant isn't as high as the others.  The food and drinks were pretty good.  We had this flatbread pizza with blue cheese and sirloin. Ordered it just because it smelled good when being served next to us.  The staff and outside seating is definitely a plus. Super nosey inside especially with one tv for sports games. But I would come back just for the flatbread

cGauIMgV7eq9gdsZCsWtjQ.text: Went here twice while in Vegas...Enjoyed the cheese plate & their Raspberry Mojitos, made with fresh raspberries.  Their flatbreads were really good.  Would def go back!

XFJqY3vFZY4XS-ZxpuEI2A.text: Must try the bacon-wrapped figs. Quick service, amazing food. We also had the onion soup, snapper ceviche, ahi, and sirloin. The style here is more like tapas so be prepared to order several plates. A little pricey, but great quality food.

DphUMVGd_NHHQWhGJuVM5A.text: La Cave is located inside of the Wynn hotel. The restaurant serves small plates of food so that you can order a bunch of plates to share with your friends. It's best to dine in a group of 2-4 people because the plates are small and even though you can order multiple orders of the same dish it's still hard to pass everything around the table...or you can do what we did and split you table into different groups. We had a party of 8 but divided the table into two groups to make it easier to order, share food, and split the bill. We were advised by our waiter to order about two plates per person and it was the perfect amount of food.  Ahi Tuna (Pomegranate, Basil Oil) $15 - The ahi tuna was super fresh and the sauce was very flavorful. Hamachi (Pickled Chilies, Candied Lemon Zest) $15 - Again, the Hamachi was very fresh and the sauce was light but flavorful. I also liked the added spiciness from the chilies. Beef Carpaccio (Arugula, Truffle Aioli) $15 - I love truffle everything and the truffle aioli in this dish was delicious! Salt-roasted Beets (Whipped Goat Cheese, Pistachio) $10 - I loved the salt-roasted beets. The beets were sweet, the whipped goat cheese was rich and creamy, and the pistachio gave the dish a nice crunch. Shaved Asparagus (Hard Boiled Eggs, Pancetta) $10 - I loved all of the different textures in this dish...the crisp asparagus shavings, the soft egg whites, and the crunchy pancetta. Sliced Sirloin Steak (Mushroom Fondue, Cippolini Onions) $19 - The sliced sirloin steak was to die for. The meat was tender, the sauce was amazing, and the mushrooms and onions were super tasty. Diver Sea Scallops (Polenta Cake, Shrimp Sauce) $17 - The scallops were melt in your mouth delicious. I loved the polenta cake...it was soft and creamy on the inside and slightly crispy on the outside. Chef's Selection: Nueske's Bacon, Poached Quail Egg, Fontina Flatbread $14 - The bacon pretty much looked and tasted like ham. I liked the addition of the quail egg on top...it's something unexpected. The flatbread itself had a nice chewy texture and a nice crisp on the bottom.  Everything was really good...we ate every last morsel of food!  Including a bottle of wine and tip it came out to be a little more than $50 per person which is pretty reasonable for a nice dinner in Vegas. I would highly recommend this restaurant!  P.S. They also have a vegetarian/vegan menu! There was someone in our party that is a vegetarian and she thoroughly enjoyed the vegetarian dishes as well.

bSAXBt55aKJC3sYNjbqBTQ.text: Great food! Great place to have drinks before the show!  Outdoor atmosphere was really nice!

ORp2I3P-ho4KVNTj-OAktA.text: I love this place.  If you're in Vegas and just want to nibble and nosh, and not the full gluttonous experience of dinner, then this is the place.  I had a crisp white Vermentino which I love on hot days. It was refreshing with a sharp bite and faint aroma of fruit, but not quite as cold as I would have like it.  The food, on the other hand was awesome.  We tried two flatbread pizzas, the Fiery Artichoke, Roasted Pepper, Olives Flatbread [sweet and salty and light] and the Chorizo, Italian & Andouille Sausage Flatbread [meaty, smoky and rustic].  Both were quite different but great, esp. the crust. My faves were the beef carpaccio and salmon wontons....we even ordered more.  Definitely will go back to try more dishes.

ieMV0Be3otDmktfTPtN01A.text: Great food, fun presentation, attendant and proactive service, and wonderful atmosphere.  We'd had a couple of mediocre or bad experiences in Vegas on our trip, but this was the one that we were hoping for.  Our server, Larry, was top-notch, accommodating, and pleasant.    The food was tremendous, especially the lump crab lettuce wraps and bacon-wrapped dates.    Thank you for a great night out at a reasonable rate!

XsBGbCDA_2pK1K1bmJoKfQ.text: Great tapas spot in the Wynn. Perfect place to come eat, if you are tired of all the asian-themed stuff in the hotel.  Nice variety of tapas, each plate is about $15.  Decent wine list, not a lot of variety but what they do have is good.  Service isn't super quick but they do a good job of splitting the checks when you have a big group.  Reservations are recommended.  Without them, expect to wait nearly an hour.

Waei4fEdmDTe-lsDi9LhaQ.text: STILL a fan but I'm starting to think they have new management because the employees don't seem happy.  While waiting at the bar for my husband the bartender didn't say two words to me and the other bartender had a big frown on her face. Lots of large parties which mad the dining room very loud but we got outside on the patio at 8 pm no problem and it was only 1/2 full and the weather was glorious. The food was great (Gorgonzola Salad is fantastic) but it's been hard to order a glass of wine with dinner (*bar must take a while) and this has happened to me repeatedly.  We had better service than our last viist but it's quickly slipping off my radar but we do enjoy the atmosphere. I think we will try Jaleo in the Cosmo next time we want tapas.

iO0eb6tmTP6GzsVszJQRfQ.text: @nd night in vegas and SW was booked again! so La Cave it was.  Loved their selection of cured hams and cheese! I've never been a fan of wine until i started pairing them with cheese and I was so glad that la cave had malbec!  my favorite choice of wine. They had goat cheese as well and many different varieties.  The ambiance was perfect, dim lighting and high ceilings and great staff.  We also ordered the beef carpaccio, chicken, and others i can't remember.  Not a full entree type of place but a great place to grab mini items for a night out.  who wants to stuff their face before drinking anyways? just so you can throw it back up later? ummmm no thanks.

AUrfYTQHMkuEJPN8ix6eiQ.text: After eating here feb 11th I got extremely sick I have Diarrhea and headaches calling them to help the problem they are rude accusing me  of lying saying that me being sick isn't there fault it was the only place I ate and I was the only one to eat the dish I ate. They are rude and don't care they are not worth getting sick over period

v7XLmi8VzbvmpiFnoaOisA.text: Best meal of my life, mushroom grits were unbelievably creamy and the flat bread melted in  your mouth

2n9wFPM81C6ypVuiF1CLwQ.text: descent food, very nice ambiance and view in the patio, but our evening was totally ruined because of a very rude waiter. The manager was nice enough to make up for it but I don't recommend this place. There are so many better options in Vegas.

2Xw_jsEpAOpRWrdRDrq0Vw.text: I came here for dinner with my parents on a weekday. The wine selection was quite diverse and they let you sample before you get a glass. Our waitress was very attentive the entire time, and the service was on point. My favorite dishes were the beef carpaccio, the ahi tuna, the warm beet salad, and the beignets. The flatbreads are good, but you can find them anywhere and they have so many other choices on their menu. If I returned, I'd probably skip them for the other fantastic options they have.

LJ1uWqO5LIgkWb8QJ0C7HA.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas. Excellent food and service. Small plates so it fun to go with a friend and share. Started with cheese. Then had three bean salad, kale salad, scallops and Thai basil chicken flatbread. Our server was very attentive and helped us fit all the food on our small table. Will return on every trip

qMgpqcdthKdPiuiG0lVMlg.text: Great place for groups, they have big tables inside and outside on the patio. The menu consists of various sharable plates, lots of great wine. We probably tried half the menu, and most of it was very good.

IwKqnjDLA0e6IkXYe959ag.text: Went for lunch right as we arrived for our overnight at the Encore Tower Suite.   Not a great start to the experience.   Food was fine although pricy for what it is and I'm from NYC. Service was not good.  Hostess first brings us to low rocking chairs and low table. Not very easy to eat at. (I think the table she was suppose to bring us now only has one chair  so she was improvising possibly).  Anyway brings us to another table and we wait and wait for waitress to come although water is brought right away.   She finally takes our order, my husband orders a beer which he finishes and the waitress never even checks on us until we are finished with our tapas and then asks if he would like another drink. I mean the glass has been empty for the whole meal And now we are finished and you are asking?   Anyway we say no thank you to dessert and just the check which she brings and then disappears again.  The check is wrong as she has added some triple ice cream sundae which she says oh sorry.   hummmmm.

5zWj5AzM4MfxrG8eeBNwGQ.text: I went to La Cave with my boyfriend to have a light meal before a show. We were seated at a tiny table towards the back near the bar. It was a little dark, but the ambiance was nice and romantic.   I ordered the Warm Salt-Roasted Beets, Whipped Goat Cheese and Pistachio Salad. My boyfriend had the Caesar Salad with Prosciutto. It was so dark inside that I couldn't take a photo, but the beets were tender and delicious. I had a bite of his salad and it was great.   We ordered two flatbreads as our entree to share:  Fiery Artichoke, Pepperoncini, Olives, and Ricotta and Tomato, Micro Mozzerella, and Caper. They were a decent size, so between the salads and flatbreads, we walked out pretty stuffed.   I'd love to go back here and eat on the patio and try out more of the menu. The service was excellent and we didn't wait too long for service or food.

pgIW9QJZPjvAC-V79s-HVg.text: We all loved La Cave. I brought my family to La Cave yesterday for brunch.  It is a butler style brunch and every single item on the menu was beyond great.  The service was excellent.  My favorite part of being there is the ambiance. We sat out on the patio with a view of beautiful trees and loved the atmosphere which was intimate, classy and upscale yet casual.  Brunch is 48.00 for adults and 28.00 for children 3 years and older.  Bottomless drinks are 28.00 per adult with a variety of great drinks to choose from.  Loved the margaritas the most.  My favorite dish was the eggs Benedict with filet mignon on top.

naXLtdS78E5WKmKOPlbGqQ.text: Have you heard of a gourmet buffet?  I hadn't either till we came here on Sunday during our stay at the Wynn.    It's not cheap and you don't get up to fill up your plate.  The waiters walk around with what ever they create fresh in the kitchen and offer you small plates.  You can decline or take what ever you like as it comes.  Everything we had was perfection.  From the crepes to the sausage, it was pure perfection.    Although more people were seating outside, we wanted to be inside (cooler, darker and more quiet).  As with any Wynn Resort Restaurant, La Cave doesn't skimp on quality.   The food and drinks were delicious!  The staff were pleasant and very helpful.  All I can say is, I can't wait to be back!  Yes, it's that GOOD!

i2kCmWG2kJPTe13rExk2ag.text: It's really average food in small tapas size and pretty pricey. I wouldn't have come here if it weren't for the resort credit. Their American "Wagyu" is tougher than Angus beef. For about $26, it's completely not worth the money.

Zkgzosa2OfyE8OnMEksvZA.text: If you are looking for a restaurant in Las Vegas that's menu has variety, definitely need to check it out here! Here's what I ordered! -Bacon Wrapped Dates: crispy on the outside and flavorful inside! It's a must dish. -Sliced Sirloin Steak: Everything about this dish is amazing. Cooked medium rare, when you receive it the knife smoothly cuts into the steak, and the mushroom adds amazing flavor and texture.  -Diver Sea Scallop: By far the best dish! The seasoning is incredible, everything about this dish was fantastic!  -S'mores Flatbread: last but not least the dessert! Very yummy and not to sweet!  Reason why I knocked off a star, is because even though it's Tapas style, I wish it can be just a little more bigger portion, just a little bit more!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angus Sirloin Steak with Delirium Tremens Beer

n2bIyw51SkVENGsG_H5WbA.text: Top notch. Our favorite hidden jewel in the Wynn. The bar is fun for drinks or restaurant is excellent for tapas style dining. Perfect atmosphere!

Da3xGqWdFyN3bXFhrr04gA.text: I had walked by this place SO many times not even thinking it was worth a meal since there are countless great places in Vegas.  Thanks to a friend who was related to one of the owners, we gave it a try.  And so glad we did.  And looking forward to going back.  Great ambiance-- romantic yet fun, and good for moderate groups too.  We were a group of 8 and sat in the middle of the room next to the patio with the huge windows. Beautiful.    We tried what seemed like almost *everything*.  What others rave about is pretty good (although, bacon wrapped dates just about anywhere will be good); however, some standouts were:  the beef filet flatbread, the gouda foam pasta (I normally don't care for pasta, but OMG), the ceviche (a super well balanced burst of summertime in your mouth), beef carpaccio w/ truffle aioli (WOW, just wish there was more), mushroom grits (melt in your mouth delicioso), wagyu skirt steak, and beef filet crostini.  Oh and the Smores flatbread was heavenly.  Our friend's cousin knew the executive chef, so he came out and prepared this ahi tartare that was incredible-- hope they incorporate it into the menu in the future!    Also have a great selection of specialty cocktails that are...well, what cocktails should be.  Refreshing, balanced, not too alcohol-y, and just super delicious.

oHDzwN6PWv_bW3Ls1cJZ0g.text: A fairly average tapas restaurant in the Wynn/Encore. We split three flatbreads, a salad, and a meat of some kind among eight people, as well as three bottles of red wine. All were decent but nothing to write home about. The ambience is dark, hip, and sexy.

bB8mREpbK48M9ULYFYECeA.text: Surprised to see this place got such high reviews.  Perhaps we got all the wrong things, people around us got flat breads--and I would get this next time. What we got: 1. Ahi, 4 slices served with cubed watermelon and pickles. I love sashimi but the other flavors overpowered the fish. $16 3/5 2. Burgers-you can add extra ones for $5 each. They use a decent meat and the olio sauce is delicious on it. $15+5 3. Beef carpaccio--nice piece of meat, sauces are overpowering for the dish. $16 4. 2 bottled beers--forgettable.   I have no problem with the prices or size, or service (it was great) I have a problem with the actual food. I felt it was forgettable and wasted my time here.

Vm6z-gqhPtPq1AzXMZdXgw.text: Great cocktail menu but a small food menu. The inside area is cramped but it looks like they have an outside area as well for warmer days. Definitely recommend the blackberry whiskey cocktail and beignets.

sCLFiyuJr4MElXQstbKebg.text: Just had the chicken Thai basil flatbread ... Amazing !!! Literally melts in your mouth and the salmon from the grill ... Amazinggggg!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmm!
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Russian

xUqLEyNc1aIDoAQeYhsWsA.text: Sweet employees but bad service. Everything comes in small portions so id recommend coming on a half full stomach. Also they bring every dish 15 minutes apart from each other. Which really sucked. The restaurant is also really nice and right by the shops as Wynn.

Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y4kGlQcJrbEGUCGnpPe9qA.text: Although our server Perry was not as great as I would have expected, you have to come here to try the food. It is amazing. Reservations are highly recommended to this place. We were seated immediately after checking in with the hostess who happens to be outside La Cave (one of the walkways of Wynn).  We were seated in a dark room with a view of the pool area. In fact, the whole place was dimly lit. Our waiter took forever to serve our table (15-20 minutes after being seated). I was rather disappointed with this. He apologized for this, but this is not the way to make a good initial impression. We started out with wine flights. I had the French wine flight and one of my other friends had the Italian wine flight.  The Italian wine flight was clean and crisp, typical of what you would find in an Italian villa. The French wine flight was full of flavor with a kick after each sip. I believe that both of those wine flights were great. I think that the Italian wine flight was $25 and the French wine flight was $30 for 4 tastings each. The wine flights had half reds and half white wines. You drink incrementally from light to dark so you drink the whites first before you drink the reds.  Make sure you bring lots of money because for the three of us, it was almost 100 bucks per each person. I have to say that the dishes we had were so good. I think the combination of all the flavors as you take a bite of each Tapas item was orgasmic. We had the Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, the Diver Sea Scallops with Polenta Cake, the Gorgonzola Salad, Sliced Sirloin Steak with Mushroom Fondue, Mushroom Grits, Beef Filet with Crostini, etc. Do not order everything at the same time. Order in batches so your food is warm when it comes out of the kitchen. Some dishes are quick but some take a while so you should consult your waiter about the lead times. I would love to come back here again for a special occasion as it is very expensive to dine here, but it is worth it.

1d62MJESgOBZ892h_fCi6A.text: Through weeks of prior planning, I was able to booked a surprise birthday brunch for my dear friend and 8 other people while visiting Vegas for a wedding.  The venues and space was perfect!  I made reservations via OpenTable through yelp which was very quick and efficient.    The hostess and staff at La Cave were awesome.  Upon arrive with the birthday girl, the hostess led our "table of 2" to the back patio where all our friends were waiting for the big surprise.  The patio area was beautiful and I adored the two hanging chairs next to our table.  The relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff made our experience quite enjoyable.    For the food we decided to all order tapas style and share amongst each other.  We considered partaking in the chef's tasting, but one person in the group was not that hungry.    We ordered: - bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese fondue - salt roasted beets with whipped goat cheese and pistachios - beef carpaccio with truffle aioli - beef filet, caramelized onion, mushroom, and blue cheese flatbread.    - angus mini burgers with a side of beer battered fries - diver sea scallops on top of polenta  My favorite dishes would have to be the beef carpaccio and beef filet flatbread.  I loved the texture of the flatbread...slightly chewy on the inside, crisp on the edges.  My biggest disappointment was the bacon wrapped dates.  I raved to my friends about how good they are, but the fondue sauce was a big letdown for me.  I prefer to have my dates stuffed so the cheese oozes out, perfectly mixing the sweet and savory flavors.    Overall, great place and will definitely have to come back in the evening for a romantic dinner with the bf.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Kobe burgers
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious flatbread
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dated with bleu cheese dipping sauce

mrLG-HJb86oCiJzqmIbkSw.text: Visit this place. One of the best places I have been recently to. Great ambiance. Crowd is mostly couples in various ages. Nice lounge/chill music playing. One third of the restaurant has patio seating. Reserve in advance if you want those particular tables. Inside and close to patio tables are amazing too. Prices are fare. Usually one needs two things. Example:.salad $10 and flat bread (pizza) $15. Or just get one if not hungry and you just want something to compliment the drinks. Plenty of bottled and draft beer selection. $8 to $12.  They also have good espresso, cappuccino, etc. Great to recharge before continuing the night at top night club/lounge as XS, located at the same resort property Wynn/encore.  In short place appears to be very romantic and I am sure ladies will like it. Mature, yet trendy crowd. No running around kids and strollers. Service was attentive and perfect. La cave is easy to be overlooked, but it is definitely worth it and one of the best restaurants at Wynn property that does not brake the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Atmosphere

MYaKODiqaM5tsvZGHdDkkg.text: DATE/TIME: February 25, 2012 // 11:00 PM  PRICE: $25-$75 depending on appetite & beverages VALUE: Great tasting food in small portions. Worth the prices if you're the type to be more interested in satisfying your taste buds. AMBIANCE: Tasteful modern interior, dimly lit and a bit sultry - provides a great intimate atmosphere. There's an indoor and outdoor patio area where you might be able to enjoy the view of the waterfall or garden. The further away you are from the main entrance, the more cozy you'll be.  SERVICE: Attentive, friendly, beautiful servers with plenty of great suggestions. CHANCE OF RETURNING: 85%  ___________________________________  Great tapas-style dining experience, allowing you to sample a wider array of dishes in smaller quantities. Everything was consistently well prepared and delicious. The five of us quite literally wiped the plates clean.  It's also one of the few late-night places that maintain the quality of its food and service even past your typical dining hours. La Cave is a good pick whether you're just looking to pop in for drinks and a snack or an actual meal.  Will definitely be back the next time I stay at the Wynn/Encore.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. [Dinner, 02/25/12]
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. [Dinner, 02/25/12]

MKsxYjSjY8z_03fUjO4xig.text: I really like this spot at Wynn. It's just outside the casino floor so it's a little more on the quiet side and offers a cozy atmosphere with great seating options in the bar area or out on the patio.   Although they are known for their wine and beer selection, the Perfect G & T on the cocktail list was damn good.   As for the food, all small plates makes it easy to share and sample a few different options. Our definite favorite was the Short Rib Tacos. I'd go back just for them.   This is a great spot for quality drinks, delicious food and a cool intimate setting. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Perfect G &amp; T

VhmSxhu_q3VwdElLPcSvVQ.text: So overpriced.  Came here for brunch. $42pp and an additional $29pp for bottomless.  The food was very mediocre. Nothing stood out. The decor was very pretty and open by the pool.   The service was horrible, too. We kept having to ask for other dishes to be brought out.   This is the strip, I get it. But, you still want your money's worth and you don't get it out of here.  Highly not recommended.

ypEIU3IU9uosAtEkC6F0JQ.text: Not impressed!  I was prepared for the service to be subpar which it was. But the food was dead mediocre. All of the items were ordered were just bland. Not all- the truffle fries were tasty. The rest was lacking seasoning and not very thoughtful. We had the ahi small plate, salmon tostado thingys, the mushroom Brussel sprouts and a salad of some sort.  I wanted to like this place but couldn't find much to like.   Lastly, if you are going to call yourself "La Cave" it seems you should not be window-filled week lit space. The ambiance was bright and not very cave-like.  I was expecting the Newport Beach type La Cave vibe.

I5yA2ucQ-JELfg2qqDFTbA.text: Awesome small plates restaurant located in The Wynn Hotel. My husband and I have been here several times. This time we ordered the Crab lettuce cups (pictured), Short Rib tacos, Moroccan chicken skewers with wine and champagne flights.

3RS9OVONZlRMdUzMBqFzjg.text: I can only speak for the happy hour.  The wine and tapas type food were really great.  The prices were very very good and the ambience was off the chain....truly a place of respite amid the hustle and bustle of the casino.  We ordered the sliders which were tasty.  If you want to just get away and recharge..this is the place.

sYSms18T8ACG85jqlopOiQ.text: We needed to kill time before our flight and wanted to escape the noises of the casino so we gave this place a go.  We were pleasantly surprised by the ambience and Happy Afternoon was going on.  The food was really good.  We split sliders and a flatbread and it was perfect. The server behind the bar was very nice and we were glad we decided to come in here.

5YLKpRhF6KSdXenk37n10Q.text: 3.5 stars rounding to 4 because the service was good.   I really, really wanted to love this place, but unfortunately, nothing stood out to me for it be 5 stars. Came here with a group of three for a bottle of wine and some appetizers before dinner. We were seated immediately, but the sommelier took forever to get to us.   We finally settled on a bottle of pinot and ordered French onion soup, octopus, and meatballs. The meatballs were REALLY good, and the octopus as decent. However, the French onion soup was SOOO salty we sent it back... TWICE! It was really inedible :( Luckily, our server was super understanding and took it off the bill.  Overall, this is a decent place to grab a glass of wine and nibble on some appetizers, but I wouldn't come here for a highlight dinner kind of night. It was really nice to get away all the casino noise so still really like this place.

98hx-ZQ72nt1zLT-OJ5fXA.text: Fabulous food, drinks, atmosphere, and view!   The staff was very attentive and super nice.  Thoroughly enjoyed my "fizzy" flight and bacon wrapped dates. If you're in the area, I highly recommend.  The prices are not too bad especially for what you get.  I missed brunch but it comes with bottomless mimosas.

2wdlPTQ56rpk3e3ua1XLuw.text: I love everything about this cozy, wonderful real Hideaway.  Perfect!

vBo0fNXv1cLwXyxbLtzwGA.text: Recently, Wynn announced that they  brought  back free parking and so me and my boyfriend decided to celebrate by having dinner at La Cave. I highly recommend make dinner reservations if you would like to eat at the patio which I highly recommend.   Came here on Saturday evening  for Cinco De Mayo Weekend on May 4th. Reservations for 6:30 pm which also recommend to have a early dinner so you are able to get easy access to the patio area and beat the crowd. First moments of seeing the front of restaurant we were greeted by hostess. The revolving door immediately catch my eye as we followed the hostess to our table the first part of the restaurant you see a long thanksgiving table, and when you look up there is a motto in red light  " In Vino Veritas." Very catchy!   Second part of the restaurant is my favorite, (hence La cave and Hideaway) it's like you are going through a tunnel and you see a light and once you find this sacred hidden gem you found an oasis of nature. The atmosphere was a Spring, Blooming Breezy weather while you hear the birds chirping. The outdoor/ indoor patio dining is the highlight of this place. Open layout.  A wall of Green foliage on side of the wall.   Our waiter was very informative and attentive as well as the whole entire staff. The menu was described to us as tapas style ( small portions) and great for sharing. ( Please note this is not a Spanish tapas restaurant) just to clarify that if its not stated on the other reviews) On the menu section of From the sea:  we ordered the Chilled Ahi Tuna, Lemon Risotto cake with Basil Aioli. From the Grill: we ordered the Moroccan Chicken Skewers with pear Chutney and pita bread. Prime Flat iron steak with blueberry Glaze with truffle Mushroom Grits. Pacific Sea Bass with Broccolini and Charred Octopus with Crispy Fingerling potatoes. Everything that we ordered was delicious with its own flavor profile. If you have a high flavor palette come to this hidden gem.  Their dessert menu was very limited so I took the chance of ordering Smore's Flatbread which I felt that I could make at home. I recommend to work on the dessert menu which did not align with the food menu. Please elevate your dessert menu.   Dress code for this place is resort casual. For the ladies: Bring a light sweater with you because it can really be cool at night this time of Spring season but  perfect weather to dine at the patio will be spring. Not too hot and not too cold. Just a perfect Spring oasis. Great for groups to socialize and have wine.

photos.caption: Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3wFMzngk9H_mFiLhhj5UUQ.text: We came here because we saw good ratings over all. All we knew was this is a tapas and wine bar. As we walked into the restaurant, it was very dark like a celler and the music was loud. For our relaxing dining, i thought we picked a wrong restaurant but passing through the dark bar, there came a large open air, sun room like dining area. We instantly fell in love with this restaurant. The window is wide open but the temperature is controlled perfectly for the comfortable dining. We had glasses of wine, flight of wine and several dishes. My favorite dish was bacon wrapped dates. The server was very polite and helpful. Even though the restaurant was filled with guests, it was still quiet, breezy and relaxing. I highly recommend this restaurant.

O8TX2oLgyZuNlqEtciu7fQ.text: Usually one of my favorite places to  be when I'm in Vegas. I look forward to hanging outside on the deck. Tonight the deck was closed due to renovations. You could not even look out at the windows as they were blocked out. We ended up hanging in the bar area all night. The food and  drinks were good. Service excellent. Like I said this is one of my favorite places to check out. Not much else to say I can only hope the next time I'm in town the reason to be here, "The View" will be back.

uhaI_F7_geLnUp0spEMniQ.text: Temporarily shuttered for renovation, but now open once again across from The Buffet at Wynn, it is at La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway that diners can find a different sort of "all you can eat" experience from 10:30am until 2:00pm on weekends.  Opened in late 2010 by Michael Morton, at that time the only Wynn Restaurant operated by an outside source but now joined by both Urth Cafe as well as Cipriani, it is at a hostess podium outside that guests are first met, staff then escorting them past a neon fixture reading "In vino veritas" en route to a dining room decorated in dark wood and foliage.  Built to resemble the tasting rooms of Northern California, a pair of Bars including one with seating flanked by temperature-controlled vaults, it is seated on leather chairs as light enters from opaque glass that menus are offered, the first a lengthy list of Wines by the bottle or glass and the other a collection of small plates served "butler style."  Intimate in terms of atmosphere, a light soundtrack and hushed conversations complimented by staff who bring around a list of twenty items at varying intervals, it was with one diner adding-on bottomless Bloody Marys and Mimosas that the other opted for Coffee and a Cocktail, the Tuscan Pear offering a syrupy mouthfeel but plenty of booze reined in by bright Citrus.  Offering American small-plates by Chef Billy DeMarco, several years with the Morton Group including the opening of CRUSH at MGM following years in New York, it is not long after arrival that Food begins to circulate, an opening Gazpacho 'Shooter' refreshing by way of Basil Oil while sliced Tomatoes around fresh Mozzarella and a Basil Leaf were brightened by a drizzle of Balsamic Vinegar.  Moving next to Yogurt, Granola and Fresh Fruit, each item presented from a tray for the guest's acceptance or denial, it was from a cone lined with paper that snappy Sausage and Bacon were plucked before transitioning to "Chicken and Waffles," or in the case the choice of Wing or Drumstick tossed with Mexican Hot Sauce atop a quarter circle that remains crisp around the edges and fluffy on the inside.   Quiet around 11:30 but filling to perhaps quarter capacity by noon, those dissuaded by 45-minute lines at The Buffet all but guaranteed a better experience for approximately the same price at La Cave, it was atop Filet grilled medium that a poached Egg and Paprika was served, the English Muffin readily soaking up Yolk and Hollandaise Sauce just as a skillet of Polenta offered in follow-up had become thick by way of saturation with Cream, Pecorino Cheese and Truffle Oil.  Delighting with toasted Bagels and Lox, the house-smoked Fish served in a good ratio to classic condiments, fans of Hash will also appreciate DeMarco's shredded Veal served with Peppers and Potatoes while Angus "Mini Burgers" are also nicely presented and far from the typical Slider thanks to Mushrooms served like a Spread along with smoky Mayonnaise.  Underwhelmed by both Flatbreads, a staple of the lunch and dinner menu unfortunately undercooked and presented luke-warm, it was with good fortune that these were quickly followed by all-new Snickers Pancakes topped in Bananas Foster, the melted Chocolate and Caramel adding unexpected texture to fluffy Buttermilk and the overall sweetness assuring no additional Syrup was necessary.  Swapping out share plates on request, a necessity for those not wanting to mix sweet with savory, it was after another round of Grits that La Cave's Egg "Sandwich" arrived, the flavor highlighted by Tomato plus a touch of heat while "Loaded" Tots were heavy but delicious thanks to Bacon, Cheddar and Brown Gravy.  Finishing up sweet, a male server who scampered off after presenting one tiny piece of tepid French Toast doing a disservice to what might have otherwise been a decent dish, it was after another skillet of Chicken and Waffles that another type of Waffle was offered, this one riddled with Cinnamon and topped with Apples plus mixed Berries that led nicely into Pastries and Cookies highlighted by a soft and chewy Oatmeal Raisin round plus an incredibly light Raspberry Muffin that turned out to be Gluten-free.   ****Smartly designed for the sort of guests typically visiting Wynn, La Cave Wine and Food Hideaway's Butler-style Brunch offers good value for just $42 per person thanks to well-designed plates, professional service and the sort of room conducive to quiet conversation and relaxation.

_XD9TTpbElWhZWV5tBeHrw.text: We had a huge reserved business party here and life was good! The service was amazing and the servers were in good mood! A few people dropped their drinks and glass went everywhere. But, they cleaned it up quickly and the party continued!

cPNvbJREDoIa3Kf6LFfNzw.text: We loved La Cave. Came because of a Vegan in our party, it did not disappoint..both Vegan and non-Vegan options were excellent..our favorite were the Crab lettuce wraps, chicken came with pita and delicious yoghurt and chutney sauce, crispy eggplant flatbread was very different and so good, bean salad was fresh and again very different than we have ever tasted before..to stuffed for desert haha...

SME1ZfIR_KA2ZjVopJjCNg.text: To quote my best friend "This restaurant will not only feed your stomach but also your taste buds". Delicious wild salmon and flat iron steak.   Only fyi is the plates are small so those with an appetite need to order multiple dishes or order some appetizers to go along  Ambiance is ok.

38Fho30FulLkRN4kv037TQ.text: We have been to La Cave many times and we were looking forward to sitting outside on a lovely Vegas evening, but we were disappointed to find there was a private party and we had to sit inside, cramped in the main dining area next to the bar - bummer.  The food was excellent as always, we had the steak flatbread with gorgonzola, meatballs and gorgonzola salad - everything was great, as usual. Service was meh, OK, but not great.  Although we didn't try this time, they have great wine flights, a good way to try some new wines.   Same price point as FIX in Bellagio, but superior in every way.

gdcAqSugD8C6_L1jabGACg.text: We had a lot of tapas. We loved them all except for Moroccan  chicken skewers. Drinks were also very good. Truffle fries are the best!! My wife loved their ceviche. I usually don't care for French onion soup but this one was very good.
